Sentence: selegiline - induced postural hypotension in parkinson 's disease : a longitudinal study on the effects of drug withdrawal .
Drugs: selegiline
Sentence: objectives :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the united kingdom parkinson 's disease research group ( ukpdrg ) trial found an increased mortality in patients with parkinson 's disease ( pd ) randomized to receive 10 mg
Drugs: 
Sentence: selegiline per day and l - dopa compared with those taking l - dopa alone .
Drugs: selegiline-dopa-dopa, dopa
Sentence: recently , we found that therapy with selegiline and l - dopa was associated with selective systolic orthostatic hypotension which was abolished by withdrawal of selegiline .
Drugs: selegiline-dopa, dopa, selegiline
Sentence: this unwanted effect on postural blood pressure was not the result of underlying autonomic failure .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the aims of this study were to confirm our previous findings in a separate cohort of patients and to determine the time course of the cardiovascular consequences of stopping
Drugs: 
Sentence: selegiline in the expectation that this might shed light on the mechanisms by which the drug causes orthostatic hypotension .
Drugs: selegiline
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the cardiovascular responses to standing and head - up tilt were studied repeatedly in pd patients receiving selegiline and as the drug was withdrawn .
Drugs: selegiline
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: head - up tilt caused systolic orthostatic hypotension which was marked in six of 20 pd patients on selegiline , one of whom lost consciousness with unrecordable blood pressures .
Drugs: selegiline
Sentence: a lesser degree of orthostatic hypotension occurred with standing .
Drugs: 
Sentence: orthostatic hypotension was ameliorated 4 days after withdrawal of selegiline and totally abolished 7 days after discontinuation of the drug .
Drugs: selegiline
Sentence: stopping selegiline also significantly reduced the supine systolic and diastolic blood pressures consistent with a previously undescribed supine pressor action .
Drugs: selegiline
Sentence: conclusion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: this study confirms our previous finding that selegiline in combination with l - dopa is associated with selective orthostatic hypotension .
Drugs: selegiline-dopa, dopa
Sentence: the possibilities that these cardiovascular findings might be the result of non - selective inhibition of monoamine oxidase or of amphetamine and metamphetamine are discussed .
Drugs: amphetamine, metamphetamine
Sentence: explicit episodic memory for sensory - discriminative components of capsaicin - induced pain : immediate and delayed ratings .
Drugs: capsaicin
Sentence: pain memory is thought to affect future pain sensitivity and thus contribute to clinical pain conditions .
Drugs: 
Sentence: systematic investigations of the human capacity to remember sensory features of experimental pain are sparse .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in order to address long - term pain memory , nine healthy male volunteers received intradermal injections of three doses of capsaicin ( 0 . 05 , 1 and 20
Drugs: capsaicin
Sentence: microg , separated by 15 min breaks ) , each given three times in a balanced design across three sessions at one week intervals .
Drugs: 
Sentence: pain rating was performed using a computerized visual analogue scale ( 0 - 100 ) digitized at 1 / s , either immediately online or one hour or one day
Drugs: 
Sentence: after injection .
Drugs: 
Sentence: subjects also recalled their pains one week later .
Drugs: 
Sentence: capsaicin injection reliably induced a dose - dependent flare ( p < 0 . 001 ) without any difference within or across sessions .
Drugs: capsaicin
Sentence: the strong burning pain decayed exponentially within a few minutes .
Drugs: 
Sentence: subjects were able to reliably discriminate pain magnitude and duration across capsaicin doses ( both p < 0 . 001 ) , regardless of whether first - time ratings were
Drugs: capsaicin
Sentence: requested immediately , after one hour or after one day .
Drugs: 
Sentence: pain recall after one week was similarly precise ( magnitude : p < 0 . 01 , duration : p < 0 . 05 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: correlation with rating recall after one week was best when first - time ratings were requested as late as one day after injection ( r ( 2 ) = 0
Drugs: 
Sentence: . 79 ) indicating that both rating retrievals utilized similar memory traces .
Drugs: 
Sentence: these results indicate a reliable memory for magnitude and duration of experimentally induced pain .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the data further suggest that the consolidation of this memory is an important interim stage , and may take up to one day .

Sentence: reversibility of captopril - induced renal insufficiency after prolonged use in an unusual case of renovascular hypertension .
Drugs: captopril
Sentence: we report a case of severe hypertension with an occluded renal artery to a solitary kidney , who developed sudden deterioration of renal function following treatment with captopril .
Drugs: captopril
Sentence: his renal function remained impaired but stable during 2 years ' treatment with captopril but returned to pre - treatment levels soon after cessation of the drug .
Drugs: captopril
Sentence: this indicates reversibility in captopril - induced renal failure even after its prolonged use and suggests that no organic damage occurs to glomerular arterioles following chronic ace inhibition .

Drugs: capsaicin
Sentence: the pathophysiology of painful temporomandibular disorders is not fully understood , but evidence suggests that muscle pain modulates motor function in characteristic ways .

Sentence: this study tested the hypothesis that activation of nociceptive muscle afferent fibers would be linked to an increased excitability of the human jaw - stretch reflex and whether this process
Drugs: 
Sentence: would be sensitive to length and velocity of the stretch .
Drugs: 
Sentence: capsaicin ( 10 micro g ) was injected into the masseter muscle to induce pain in 11 healthy volunteers .
Drugs: capsaicin
Sentence: short - latency reflex responses were evoked in the masseter and temporalis muscles by a stretch device with different velocities and displacements before , during , and after the pain
Drugs: 
Sentence: .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the normalized reflex amplitude increased with an increase in velocity at a given displacement , but remained constant with different displacements at a given velocity .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the normalized reflex amplitude was significantly higher during pain , but only at faster stretches in the painful muscle .
Drugs:

Sentence: following rtms , no side effects and no adverse effects on motor function and pd symptoms were noted .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the results suggest the existence of residual beneficial clinical aftereffects of consecutive daily applications of low - frequency rtms on dyskinesias in pd .
Drugs:

Sentence: neuroplasticity of the adult primate auditory cortex following cochlear hearing loss .
Drugs: 
Sentence: tonotopic organization is an essential feature of the primary auditory area ( a1 ) of primate cortex .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in a1 of macaque monkeys , low frequencies are represented rostrolaterally and high frequencies are represented caudomedially .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the purpose of this study was to determine if changes occur in this tonotopic organization following cochlear hearing loss .
Drugs: 
Sentence: under anesthesia , the superior temporal gyrus of adult macaque monkeys was exposed , and the tonotopic organization of a1 was mapped using conventional microelectrode recording techniques .
Drugs: 
Sentence: following recovery , the monkeys were selectively deafened for high frequencies using kanamycin and furosemide .
Drugs: kanamycin, furosemide
Sentence: the actual frequencies deafened were determined by the loss of tone - burst elicited auditory brainstem responses .
Drugs: 
Sentence: three months after deafening , a1 was remapped .
Drugs: 
Sentence: postmortem cytoarchitectural features identifying a1 were correlated with the electrophysiologic data .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the results indicate that the deprived area of a1 undergoes extensive reorganization and becomes responsive to intact cochlear frequencies .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the region of cortex that represents the low frequencies was not obviously affected by the cochlear hearing loss .
Drugs:

Drugs: salbutamol
Sentence: objective :
Drugs: 
Sentence: to study tremor side effects of salbutamol an easily applicable , quick and low - priced method is needed .
Drugs: salbutamol
Sentence: a new method using a commercially available , pen - shaped laser pointer was developed .
Drugs: 
Sentence: aim of the study was to determine sensitivity , reproducibility , reference values and the agreement with a questionnaire .
Drugs: 
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: tremor was measured using a laser pointer technique .
Drugs: 
Sentence: to determine sensitivity we assessed tremor in 44 patients with obstructive lung disease after administration of cumulative doses of salbutamol .
Drugs: salbutamol
Sentence: subjects were asked to aim at the centre of a target , subdivided in concentric circles , from 5 m distance .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the circle in which the participant succeeded to aim was recorded in millimetres radius .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in another series of measurements , reproducibility and reference values of the tremor was assessed in 65 healthy subjects in three sessions , at 9 a . m . ,
Drugs: 
Sentence: 4 p . m . and 9 a . m . , respectively , 1 week later .
Drugs: 
Sentence: postural tremor was measured with the arm horizontally outstretched rest tremor with the arm supported by an armrest and finally tremor was measured after holding a 2 - kg weight
Drugs: 
Sentence: until exhaustion .
Drugs: 
Sentence: inter - observer variability was measured in a series of 10 healthy subjects .
Drugs: 
Sentence: tremor was measured simultaneously by two independent observers .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: salbutamol significantly increased tremor severity in patients in a dose - dependent way .
Drugs: salbutamol
Sentence: within healthy adults no age - dependency could be found ( b = 0 . 262 mm / year ; p = 0 . 72 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: there was no agreement between the questionnaire and tremor severity ( r = 0 . 093 ; p = 0 . 53 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: postural tremor showed no significant difference between the first and third session ( p = 0 . 07 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: support of the arm decreased tremor severity , exhaustion increased tremor severity significantly .
Drugs: 
Sentence: a good agreement was found between two independent observers ( interclass correlation coefficient 0 . 72 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: discussion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: quantifying tremor by using an inexpensive laser pointer is , with the exception of children ( < 12 years ) a sensitive and reproducible method .

Drugs:

Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: a review of admissions during a 6 - year period revealed 14 patients with cocaine - related aneurysms .
Drugs: cocaine
Sentence: this group was compared with a control group of 135 patients with ruptured aneurysms and no history of cocaine abuse .

Sentence: 5 . 4 mm ; p = 0 . 05 ) .

Drugs: 
Sentence: cocaine - related aneurysms .
Drugs: cocaine
Sentence: conclusion :

Drugs: cocaine

Sentence: procainamide - induced polymorphous ventricular tachycardia .
Drugs: procainamide
Sentence: seven cases of procainamide - induced polymorphous ventricular tachycardia are presented .
Drugs: procainamide
Sentence: in four patients , polymorphous ventricular tachycardia appeared after intravenous administration of 200 to 400 mg of procainamide for the treatment of sustained ventricular tachycardia .
Drugs: procainamide
Sentence: in the remaining three patients , procainamide was administered orally for treatment of chronic premature ventricular contractions or atrial flutter .
Drugs: procainamide
Sentence: these patients had q - t prolongation and recurrent syncope due to polymorphous ventricular tachycardia .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in four patients , the arrhythmia was rapidly diagnosed and treated with disappearance of further episodes of the arrhythmia .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in two patients , the arrhythmia degenerated into irreversible ventricular fibrillation and both patients died .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in the seventh patient , a permanent ventricular pacemaker was inserted and , despite continuation of procainamide therapy , polymorphous ventricular tachycardia did not reoccur .
Drugs: procainamide
Sentence: these seven cases demonstrate that procainamide can produce an acquired prolonged q - t syndrome with polymorphous ventricular tachycardia .
Drugs: procainamide

Sentence: assessment of a new non - invasive index of cardiac performance for detection of dobutamine - induced myocardial ischemia .
Drugs: dobutamine
Sentence: background :
Drugs: 
Sentence: electrocardiography has a very low sensitivity in detecting dobutamine - induced myocardial ischemia .
Drugs: dobutamine
Sentence: objectives :
Drugs: 
Sentence: to assess the added diagnostic value of a new cardiac performance index ( dp / dtejc ) measurement , based on brachial artery flow changes , as compared to standard
Drugs: 
Sentence: 12 - lead ecg , for detecting dobutamine - induced myocardial ischemia , using tc99m - sestamibi single - photon emission computed tomography as the gold standard of comparison to
Drugs: dobutamine-sestamibi, sestamibi
Sentence: assess the presence or absence of ischemia .
Drugs: 
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the study group comprised 40 patients undergoing sestamibi - spect / dobutamine stress test .
Drugs: sestamibi, dobutamine
Sentence: simultaneous measurements of ecg and brachial artery dp / dtejc were performed at each dobutamine level .
Drugs: dobutamine
Sentence: in 19 of the 40 patients perfusion defects compatible with ischemia were detected on spect .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the increase in dp / dtejc during infusion of dobutamine in this group was severely impaired as compared to the non - ischemic group .
Drugs: dobutamine
Sentence: dp / dtejc outcome was combined with the ecg results , giving an ecg - enhanced value , and compared to ecg alone .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the sensitivity improved dramatically from 16 % to 79 % , positive predictive value increased from 60 % to 68 % and negative predictive value from 54 % to 78
Drugs: 
Sentence: % , and specificity decreased from 90 % to 67 % .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: if ecg alone is used for specificity , the combination with dp / dtejc improved the sensitivity of the test and could be a cost - savings alternative to cardiac
Drugs: 
Sentence: imaging or perfusion studies to detect myocardial ischemia , especially in patients unable to exercise .

Drugs: simvastatin, amiodarone, atazanavir
Sentence: objective :
Drugs: 
Sentence: to report a case of a severe interaction between simvastatin , amiodarone , and atazanavir resulting in rhabdomyolysis and acute renal failure .
Drugs: simvastatin, amiodarone, atazanavir
Sentence: background :
Drugs: 
Sentence: a 72 - year - old white man with underlying human immunodeficiency virus , atrial fibrillation , coronary artery disease , and hyperlipidemia presented with generalized pain , fatigue ,
Drugs: 
Sentence: and dark orange urine for 3 days .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the patient was taking 80 mg simvastatin at bedtime ( initiated 27 days earlier ) ; amiodarone at a dose of 400 mg daily for 7 days , then 200
Drugs: simvastatin, amiodarone
Sentence: mg daily ( initiated 19 days earlier ) ; and 400 mg atazanavir daily ( initiated at least 2 years previously ) .
Drugs: atazanavir
Sentence: laboratory evaluation revealed 66 , 680 u / l creatine kinase , 93 mg / dl blood urea nitrogen , 4 . 6 mg / dl creatinine , 1579 u
Drugs: creatineureanitrogen, nitrogen, creatinine
Sentence: / l aspartate aminotransferase , and 738 u / l alanine aminotransferase .
Drugs: aspartate, alanine
Sentence: simvastatin , amiodarone , and the patient 's human immunodeficiency virus medications were all temporarily discontinued and the patient was given forced alkaline diuresis and started on dialysis .
Drugs: simvastatin, amiodarone
Sentence: nine days later the patient 's creatine kinase had dropped to 1695 u / l and creatinine was 3 . 3 mg / dl . the patient was discharged and
Drugs: creatine, creatinine
Sentence: continued outpatient dialysis for 1 month until his renal function recovered .
Drugs: 
Sentence: discussion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the risk of rhabdomyolysis is increased in the presence of concomitant drugs that inhibit simvastatin metabolism .
Drugs: simvastatin
Sentence: simvastatin is metabolized by cyp3a4 .
Drugs: simvastatin
Sentence: amiodarone and atazanavir are recognized cyp3a4 inhibitors .
Drugs: amiodarone, atazanavir
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: pharmacokinetic differences in statins are an important consideration for assessing the risk of potential drug interactions .
Drugs: statins
Sentence: in patients requiring the concurrent use of statins and cyp3a4 inhibitors , pravastatin , fluvastatin , and rosuvastatin carry the lowest risk of drug interactions ; atorvastatin carries moderate risk
Drugs: statins, pravastatin, fluvastatin, rosuvastatin, atorvastatin
Sentence: , whereas simvastatin and lovastatin have the highest risk and should be avoided in patients taking concomitant cyp3a4 inhibitors .
Drugs: simvastatin, lovastatin

Drugs: cisplatin

Sentence: to 30 % ) .

Drugs: 
Sentence: 6 % to 29 % ) .

Sentence: the median dose - intensity ( di ) was 20 mg / m2 / wk .

Sentence: vnb was well tolerated and zero instances of who grade 4 nonhematologic toxicity occurred .

Sentence: background :

Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the objective of this study was to determine the feasibility , response rate , and toxicity of a paclitaxel , cisplatin , and gemcitabine combination to treat metastatic nsclc .
Drugs: paclitaxel, cisplatin, gemcitabine
Sentence: thirty - five consecutive chemotherapy - naive patients with stage iv nsclc and an eastern cooperative oncology group performance status of 0 - 2 were treated with a combination of
Drugs: 
Sentence: paclitaxel ( 135 mg / m ( 2 ) given intravenously in 3 hours ) on day 1 , cisplatin ( 120 mg / m ( 2 ) given intravenously
Drugs: paclitaxel, cisplatin
Sentence: in 6 hours ) on day 1 , and gemcitabine ( 800 mg / m ( 2 ) given intravenously in 30 minutes ) on days 1 and 8 ,
Drugs: gemcitabine
Sentence: every 4 weeks .
Drugs: 
Sentence: although responding patients were scheduled to receive consolidation radiotherapy and 24 patients received preplanned second - line chemotherapy after disease progression , the response and toxicity rates reported refer only
Drugs: 
Sentence: to the chemotherapy regimen given .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: all the patients were examined for toxicity ; 34 were examinable for response .
Drugs: 
Sentence: an objective response was observed in 73 . 5 % of the patients ( 95 % confidence interval [ ci ] , 55 . 6 - 87 . 1 %
Drugs: 
Sentence: ) , including 4 complete responses ( 11 . 7 % ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: according to intention - to - treat , the overall response rate was 71 . 4 % ( 95 % ci , 53 .
Drugs: 
Sentence: 7 - 85 . 4 % ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: after 154 courses of therapy , the median dose intensity was 131 mg / m ( 2 ) for paclitaxel ( 97 . 3 % ) , 117 mg /
Drugs: paclitaxel
Sentence: m ( 2 ) for cisplatin ( 97 . 3 % ) , and 1378 mg / m ( 2 ) for gemcitabine ( 86 . 2 % ) .
Drugs: cisplatin, gemcitabine
Sentence: world health organization grade 3 - 4 neutropenia and thrombocytopenia occurred in 39 . 9 % and 11 . 4 % of patients , respectively .
Drugs: 
Sentence: there was one treatment - related death .
Drugs: 
Sentence: nonhematologic toxicities were mild .
Drugs: 
Sentence: after a median follow - up of 22 months , the median progression free survival rate was 7 months , and the median survival time was 16 months .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the combination of paclitaxel , cisplatin , and gemcitabine is well tolerated and shows high activity in metastatic nsclc .
Drugs: paclitaxel, cisplatin, gemcitabine
Sentence: this treatment merits further comparison with other cisplatin - based regimens .
Drugs: cisplatin

Sentence: immune escape variants of the hepatitis b virus ( hbv ) represent an emerging clinical challenge , because they can be associated with vaccine escape , hbv reactivation , and
Drugs: 
Sentence: failure of diagnostic tests .
Drugs: 
Sentence: recent data suggest a preferential selection of immune escape mutants in distinct peripheral blood leukocyte compartments of infected individuals .
Drugs: 
Sentence: we therefore systematically analyzed the functional impact of the most prevalent immune escape variants , the sg145r and sp120 t mutants , on the viral replication efficacy and antiviral drug

Sentence: susceptibility of common treatment - associated mutants with resistance to lamivudine ( lam ) and / or hbeag negativity .

Drugs: lam, hbeag
Sentence: hbeag - negative background with precore ( pc ) and basal core promoter ( bcp ) mutants .

Drugs: hbeag, lam

Sentence: a randomized , placebo - controlled dose - comparison trial of haloperidol for psychosis and disruptive behaviors in alzheimer 's disease .
Drugs: haloperidol
Sentence: objective : the goal of this study was to compare the efficacy and side effects of two doses of haloperidol and placebo in the treatment of psychosis and disruptive behaviors
Drugs: haloperidol
Sentence: in patients with alzheimer 's disease .
Drugs: 
Sentence: method :
Drugs: 
Sentence: in a 6 - week random - assignment , double - blind , placebo - controlled trial ( phase a ) , haloperidol , 2 - 3 mg / day
Drugs: haloperidol
Sentence: ( standard dose ) , and haloperidol , 0 . 50 - 0 . 75 mg / day ( low dose ) , were compared in 71 outpatients with alzheimer
Drugs: haloperidol
Sentence: 's disease .
Drugs: 
Sentence: for the subsequent 6 - week double - blind crossover phase ( phase b ) , patients taking standard - or low - dose haloperidol were switched to placebo ,
Drugs: haloperidol
Sentence: and patients taking placebo were randomly assigned to standard - or low - dose haloperidol .
Drugs: haloperidol
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: for the 60 patients who completed phase a , standard - dose haloperidol was efficacious and superior to both low - dose haloperidol and placebo for scores on the brief
Drugs: haloperidol, haloperidol
Sentence: psychiatric rating scale psychosis factor and on psychomotor agitation .
Drugs: 
Sentence: response rates according to three sets of criteria were greater with the standard dose ( 55 % - 60 % ) than the low dose ( 25 % - 35
Drugs: 
Sentence: % ) and placebo ( 25 % - 30 % ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the advantage of standard dose over low dose was replicated in phase b .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in phase a , extrapyramidal signs tended to be greater with the standard dose than in the other two conditions , primarily because of a subgroup ( 20 % )
Drugs: 
Sentence: who developed moderate to severe signs .
Drugs: 
Sentence: low - dose haloperidol did not differ from placebo on any measure of efficacy or side effects .
Drugs: haloperidol
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the results indicated a favorable therapeutic profile for haloperidol in doses of 2 - 3 mg / day , although a subgroup developed moderate to severe extrapyramidal signs .
Drugs: haloperidol
Sentence: a starting dose of 1 mg / day with gradual , upward dose titration is recommended .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the narrow therapeutic window observed with haloperidol may also apply to other neuroleptics used in alzheimer 's disease patients with psychosis and disruptive behaviors .
Drugs: haloperidol

Sentence: n = 9 ] .

Drugs:

Sentence: conclusion :

Drugs: adriamycin
Sentence: this supports the assumption that differences in renal ace activity predispose to a less favourable course of renal damage .

Sentence: different lobular distributions of altered hepatocyte tight junctions in rat models of intrahepatic and extrahepatic cholestasis .
Drugs: 
Sentence: hepatocyte tight junctions ( tjs ) , the only intercellular barrier between the sinusoidal and the canalicular spaces , play a key role in bile formation .
Drugs: 
Sentence: although hepatocyte tjs are impaired in cholestasis , attempts to localize the precise site of hepatocyte tj damage by freeze - fracture electron microscopy have produced limited information .
Drugs: 
Sentence: recently , several tj - associated proteins like zo - 1 and 7h6 have been identified and characterized .
Drugs: 
Sentence: immunolocalization of 7h6 appears to closely correlate with paracellular permeability .

Sentence: in control rats , immunostaining for 7h6 and zo - 1 colocalized to outline bile canaliculi in a continuous fashion .

Sentence: in contrast , 7h6 and zo - 1 immunostaining was more discontinuous , outlining the bile canaliculi after bdl .

Drugs: ee
Sentence: lobule .

Sentence: this study is the first to demonstrate that impairment of hepatocyte tjs occurs heterogenously in the liver lobule after bdl and suggests that bdl and ee treatments produce different lobular

Sentence: long term audiological evaluation of beta - thalassemic patients .
Drugs: 
Sentence: objective : the objective of this study was to identify the incidence and to monitor the progression of hearing loss in children and young adults with beta - thalassemia major
Drugs: 
Sentence: .
Drugs: 
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: one hundred and four ( 104 ) patients aged 6 - 35 years ( mean 17 , 2 years ) participated in the study .
Drugs: 
Sentence: all patients were on a regular transfusion - chelation program maintaining a mean hemoglobin level of 9 . 5 gr / dl .
Drugs: 
Sentence: subjects were receiving desferrioxamine ( dfo ) chelation treatment with a mean daily dose of 50 - 60 mg / kg , 5 - 6 days a week during the
Drugs: desferrioxamine, dfo
Sentence: first six years of the study , which was then reduced to 40 - 50 mg / kg for the following eight years .
Drugs: 
Sentence: patients were followed for 8 - 14 years .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: overall , 21 out of 104 patients ( 20 . 2 % ) presented with high frequency sensorineural hearing loss ( snhl ) , either unilateral or bilateral .
Drugs: 
Sentence: no ototoxic factor , other than dfo , was present in any of the patients .
Drugs: dfo
Sentence: patients with snhl presented with relatively lower serum ferritin levels than those with normal hearing , however , no statistically significant difference was observed .
Drugs: 
Sentence: subjects with snhl were submitted to dfo reduction or temporary withdrawal .
Drugs: dfo
Sentence: following intervention , 7 out of 21 affected patients recovered , 10 remained stable and 4 demonstrated aggravation .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the findings are indicative of dfo 's contributing role in the development of hearing impairment .
Drugs: dfo
Sentence: regular audiologic evaluation is imperative in all thalassemic patients so that early changes may be recognized and treatment may be judiciously adjusted in order to prevent or reverse hearing impairment

Drugs: 
Sentence: - loaded rats , respectively .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in conclusion , reductions in creatinine clearance and renal amphotericin b accumulation after chronic amphotericin b administration were enhanced by salt depletion and attenuated by sodium loading in rats .

Drugs: clioquinol

Drugs: clioquinol
Sentence: .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the most common manifestation , observed in 15 further cases , was isolated optic atrophy .
Drugs: 
Sentence: this was most frequently found in children , many of whom had received clioquinol as treatment for acrodermatitis enteropathica .
Drugs: clioquinol
Sentence: in the remaining cases , a combination of myelopathy , visual disturbance , and peripheral neuropathy was the most common manifestation .
Drugs: 
Sentence: isolated myelopathy or peripheral neuropathy , or these manifestations occurring together , were infrequent .

Sentence: older subjects tended to display more side effects .

Sentence: the full syndrome of subacute myelo - optic neuropathy was more frequent in women , but they tended to have taken greater quantities of the drug .

Sentence: epileptic seizures following cortical application of fibrin sealants containing tranexamic acid in rats .
Drugs: tranexamicacid, acid
Sentence: background :
Drugs: 
Sentence: fibrin sealants ( fs ) derived from human plasma are frequently used in neurosurgery .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in order to increase clot stability , fs typically contain aprotinin , a natural fibrinolysis inhibitor .
Drugs: 
Sentence: recently , synthetic fibrinolysis inhibitors such as tranexamic acid ( tamca ) have been considered as substitutes for aprotinin .
Drugs: tranexamicacid, acid, tamca
Sentence: however , tamca has been shown to cause epileptic seizures .
Drugs: tamca
Sentence: we wanted to study whether tamca retains its convulsive action if incorporated into a fs .
Drugs: tamca
Sentence: method :
Drugs: 
Sentence: fs containing aprotinin or different concentrations of tamca ( 0 . 5 - 47 . 5 mg / ml ) were applied to the pial surface of the cortex of
Drugs: tamca
Sentence: anaesthetized rats .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the response of the animals was evaluated using electroencephalography and by monitoring the clinical behaviour during and after recovery from anaesthesia .
Drugs: 
Sentence: findings : fs containing tamca caused paroxysmal brain activity which was associated with distinct convulsive behaviours .
Drugs: tamca
Sentence: the degree of these seizures increased with increasing concentration of tamca .
Drugs: tamca
Sentence: thus , fs containing 47 . 5 mg / ml tamca evoked generalized seizures in all tested rats ( n = 6 ) while the lowest concentration of tamca (
Drugs: tamca, tamca
Sentence: 0 . 5 mg / ml ) only evoked brief episodes of jerk - correlated convulsive potentials in 1 of 6 rats .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in contrast , fs containing aprotinin did not evoke any paroxysmal activity .
Drugs: 
Sentence: interpretation :
Drugs: 
Sentence: tranexamic acid retains its convulsive action within fs .
Drugs: tranexamicacid, acid
Sentence: thus , use of fs containing tamca for surgery within or close to the cns may pose a substantial risk to the patient .
Drugs: tamca

Drugs: 
Sentence: immunosuppressive drugs have been used during the last 30 years in treatment of patients with severe rheumatoid arthritis .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the drugs commonly used are cyclophosphamide and chlorambucil ( alkylating agents ) , azathioprine ( purine analogue ) , and methotrexate ( folic acid analogue ) .
Drugs: cyclophosphamideagentsacid, acid
Sentence: there is evidence that all four immunosuppressive drugs can reduce synovitis , but disease activity almost always recurs after therapy is stopped .
Drugs: 
Sentence: since adverse reactions are frequent , less than 50 percent of patients are able to continue a particular drug for more than one year .
Drugs: 
Sentence: since it takes three to 12 months to achieve maximal effects , those patients who are unable to continue the drug receive little benefit from it .
Drugs:

Sentence: severe ocular and orbital toxicity after intracarotid injection of carboplatin for recurrent glioblastomas .
Drugs: carboplatin
Sentence: background :
Drugs: 
Sentence: glioblastoma is a malignant tumor that occurs in the cerebrum during adulthood .
Drugs: 
Sentence: with current treatment regimens including combined surgery , radiation and chemotherapy , the average life expectancy of the patients is limited to approximately 1 year .
Drugs: 
Sentence: therefore , patients with glioblastoma sometimes have intracarotid injection of carcinostatics added to the treatment regimen .
Drugs: 
Sentence: generally , carboplatin is said to have milder side effects than cisplatin , whose ocular and orbital toxicity are well known .
Drugs: carboplatin, cisplatin
Sentence: however , we experienced a case of severe ocular and orbital toxicity after intracarotid injection of carboplatin , which is infrequently reported .
Drugs: carboplatin
Sentence: case :
Drugs: 
Sentence: a 58 - year - old man received an intracarotid injection of carboplatin for recurrent glioblastomas in his left temporal lobe .
Drugs: carboplatin
Sentence: he complained of pain and visual disturbance in the ipsilateral eye 30 h after the injection .
Drugs: 
Sentence: various ocular symptoms and findings caused by carboplatin toxicity were seen .
Drugs: carboplatin
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: he was treated with intravenous administration of corticosteroids and glycerin for 6 days after the injection .
Drugs: glycerin
Sentence: although the intraocular pressure elevation caused by secondary acute angle - closure glaucoma decreased and ocular pain diminished , inexorable papilledema and exudative retinal detachment continued for 3 weeks .
Drugs: 
Sentence: finally , 6 weeks later , diffuse chorioretinal atrophy with optic atrophy occurred and the vision in his left eye was lost .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: when performing intracarotid injection of carboplatin , we must be aware of its potentially blinding ocular toxicity .
Drugs: carboplatin
Sentence: it is recommended that further studies and investigations are undertaken in the effort to minimize such severe side effects .
Drugs:

Sentence: hmg coa reductase inhibitors .
Drugs: 
Sentence: current clinical experience .
Drugs: 
Sentence: lovastatin and simvastatin are the 2 best - known members of the class of hypolipidaemic agents known as hmg coa reductase inhibitors .
Drugs: lovastatin, simvastatin
Sentence: clinical experience with lovastatin includes over 5000 patients , 700 of whom have been treated for 2 years or more , and experience with simvastatin includes over 3500 patients ,
Drugs: lovastatin, simvastatin
Sentence: of whom 350 have been treated for 18 months or more .
Drugs: 
Sentence: lovastatin has been marketed in the united states for over 6 months .
Drugs: lovastatin
Sentence: both agents show substantial clinical efficacy , with reductions in total cholesterol of over 30 % and in ldl - cholesterol of 40 % in clinical studies .
Drugs: cholesterol, cholesterol
Sentence: modest increases in hdl - cholesterol levels of about 10 % are also reported .
Drugs: cholesterol
Sentence: clinical tolerability of both agents has been good , with fewer than 3 % of patients withdrawn from treatment because of clinical adverse experiences .
Drugs: 
Sentence: ophthalmological examinations in over 1100 patients treated with one or the other agent have revealed no evidence of significant short term ( up to 2 years ) cataractogenic potential .
Drugs: 
Sentence: one to 2 % of patients have elevations of serum transaminases to greater than 3 times the upper limit of normal .
Drugs: 
Sentence: these episodes are asymptomatic and reversible when therapy is discontinued .
Drugs: 
Sentence: minor elevations of creatine kinase levels are reported in about 5 % of patients .
Drugs: creatine

Drugs:

Drugs: fentanyl
Sentence: to discharge from 20 % and 17 % with fentanyl and fentanyl - dexamethasone , respectively , to 5 % ( p = 0 . 013 ) .

Drugs: dexamethasone

Drugs: fentanyl

Drugs:

Drugs: 
Sentence: pain severity and analgesic requirements were unaffected by the omission of fentanyl .
Drugs: fentanyl

Drugs: fentanyl, sevoflurane
Sentence: conclusion :

Drugs: cisplatin-2721, 2721, amifostine
Sentence: background :
Drugs: 
Sentence: cisplatin has minimal antitumor activity when used as second - or third - line treatment of metastatic breast carcinoma .
Drugs: cisplatin
Sentence: older reports suggest an objective response rate of 8 % when 60 - 120 mg / m2 of cisplatin is administered every 3 - 4 weeks .
Drugs: cisplatin
Sentence: although a dose - response effect has been observed with cisplatin , the dose - limiting toxicities associated with cisplatin ( e . g . , nephrotoxicity , ototoxicity ,
Drugs: cisplatin, cisplatin
Sentence: and neurotoxicity ) have limited its use as a treatment for breast carcinoma .
Drugs: 
Sentence: wr - 2721 or amifostine initially was developed to protect military personnel in the event of nuclear war .
Drugs: wr-2721, 2721, amifostine
Sentence: amifostine subsequently was shown to protect normal tissues from the toxic effects of alkylating agents and cisplatin without decreasing the antitumor effect of the chemotherapy .
Drugs: amifostineagents, agents, cisplatin
Sentence: early trials of cisplatin and amifostine also suggested that the incidence and severity of cisplatin - induced nephrotoxicity , ototoxicity , and neuropathy were reduced .
Drugs: cisplatin, amifostine, cisplatin
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: a phase ii study of the combination of cisplatin plus amifostine was conducted in patients with progressive metastatic breast carcinoma who had received one , but not more than one
Drugs: cisplatin, amifostine
Sentence: , chemotherapy regimen for metastatic disease .
Drugs: 
Sentence: patients received amifostine , 910 mg / m2 intravenously over 15 minutes .
Drugs: amifostine
Sentence: after completion of the amifostine infusion , cisplatin 120 mg / m2 was administered over 30 minutes .
Drugs: amifostine, cisplatin
Sentence: intravenous hydration and mannitol was administered before and after cisplatin .
Drugs: mannitol, cisplatin
Sentence: treatment was administered every 3 weeks until disease progression .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: forty - four patients were enrolled in the study of which 7 ( 16 % ) were ineligible .
Drugs: 
Sentence: a median of 2 cycles of therapy was administered to the 37 eligible patients .
Drugs: 
Sentence: six partial responses were observed for an overall response rate of 16 % .
Drugs: 
Sentence: most patients ( 57 % ) stopped treatment because of disease progression .
Drugs: 
Sentence: neurologic toxicity was reported in 52 % of patients .
Drugs: 
Sentence: seven different life - threatening toxicities were observed in patients while receiving treatment .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the combination of cisplatin and amifostine in this study resulted in an overall response rate of 16 % .
Drugs: cisplatin, amifostine
Sentence: neither a tumor - protective effect nor reduced toxicity to normal tissues was observed with the addition of amifostine to cisplatin in this trial .
Drugs: amifostine, cisplatin

Sentence: hepatic reactions associated with ketoconazole in the united kingdom .
Drugs: ketoconazole
Sentence: ketoconazole was introduced in the united kingdom in 1981 .
Drugs: ketoconazole
Sentence: by november 1984 the committee on safety of medicines had received 82 reports of possible hepatotoxicity associated with the drug , including five deaths .
Drugs: 
Sentence: an analysis of the 75 cases that had been adequately followed up suggested that 16 , including three deaths , were probably related to treatment with the drug .
Drugs: 
Sentence: of the remainder , 48 were possibly related to treatment , five were unlikely to be so , and six were unclassifiable .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the mean age of patients in the 16 probable cases was 57 . 9 , with hepatotoxicity being more common in women .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the average duration of treatment before the onset of jaundice was 61 days .
Drugs: 
Sentence: none of these well validated cases occurred within the first 10 days after treatment .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the results of serum liver function tests suggested hepatocellular injury in 10 ( 63 % ) ; the rest showed a mixed pattern .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in contrast , the results of histological examination of the liver often showed evidence of cholestasis .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the characteristics of the 48 patients in the possible cases were similar .
Drugs: 
Sentence: allergic manifestations such as rash and eosinophilia were rare .
Drugs: 
Sentence: hepatitis was usually reversible when treatment was stopped , with the results of liver function tests returning to normal after an average of 3 . 1 months .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in two of the three deaths probably associated with ketoconazole treatment the drug had been continued after the onset of jaundice and other symptoms of hepatitis .
Drugs: ketoconazole
Sentence: clinical and biochemical monitoring at regular intervals for evidence of hepatitis is advised during long term treatment with ketoconazole to prevent possible serious hepatic injury .
Drugs: ketoconazole

Sentence: introduction :
Drugs: 
Sentence: antibiotic - associated hepatotoxicity is rare .
Drugs: 
Sentence: with widespread use of antimicrobial agents , however , hepatic injury occurs frequently , and among adverse drug reactions , idiosyncratic reactions are the most serious .
Drugs: 
Sentence: case summary :
Drugs: 
Sentence: a 25 - year - old male patient , with a height of 175 cm and weight of 72 kg presented to marmara university hospital emergency department , istanbul ,
Drugs: 
Sentence: turkey , with 5 days ' history of jaundice , malaise , nausea , and vomiting .
Drugs:

Drugs: telithromycin
Sentence: both incidents occurred within a year .
Drugs:

Drugs:

Drugs: telithromycin
Sentence: it has been associated with infrequent and usually reversible severe hepatic dysfunction .

Drugs: telithromycin

Drugs: spironolactone
Sentence: ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: because treatments for heart failure have changed since the benefits of spironolactone were reported , the prevalence of these complications may differ in current clinical practice .
Drugs: spironolactone
Sentence: we therefore sought to determine the prevalence and clinical associations of hyperkalemia and renal insufficiency in heart failure patients treated with spironolactone .
Drugs: spironolactone
Sentence: methods :
Drugs:

Sentence: cases were patients who developed hyperkalemia ( k ( + ) > 5 . 0 meq / l ) or renal insufficiency ( cr > or = 2 . 5
Drugs: k, cr
Sentence: mg / dl ) , and they were compared to 2 randomly selected controls per case .

Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: sixty - seven of 926 patients ( 7 . 2 % ) required discontinuation of spironolactone due to hyperkalemia ( n = 33 ) or renal failure ( n =
Drugs: spironolactone
Sentence: 34 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: patients who developed hyperkalemia were older and more likely to have diabetes , had higher baseline serum potassium levels and lower baseline potassium supplement doses , and were more likely
Drugs: potassium, potassium
Sentence: to be treated with beta - blockers than controls ( n = 134 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: patients who developed renal insufficiency had lower baseline body weight and higher baseline serum creatinine , required higher doses of loop diuretics , and were more likely to be treated
Drugs: creatinine
Sentence: with thiazide diuretics than controls .
Drugs: thiazide

Drugs: 
Sentence: spironolactone - induced hyperkalemia and renal insufficiency are more common in our clinical experience than reported previously .
Drugs: spironolactone
Sentence: this difference is explained by patient comorbidities and more frequent use of beta - blockers .

Sentence: end - stage renal disease ( esrd ) after orthotopic liver transplantation ( oltx ) using calcineurin - based immunotherapy : risk of development and treatment .
Drugs: 
Sentence: background :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the calcineurin inhibitors cyclosporine and tacrolimus are both known to be nephrotoxic .
Drugs: cyclosporine, tacrolimus
Sentence: their use in orthotopic liver transplantation ( oltx ) has dramatically improved success rates .
Drugs: 
Sentence: recently , however , we have had an increase of patients who are presenting after oltx with end - stage renal disease ( esrd ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: this retrospective study examines the incidence and treatment of esrd and chronic renal failure ( crf ) in oltx patients .
Drugs: 
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: patients receiving an oltx only from june 1985 through december of 1994 who survived 6 months postoperatively were studied ( n = 834 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: our prospectively collected database was the source of information .
Drugs: 
Sentence: patients were divided into three groups : controls , no crf or esrd , n = 748 ; crf , sustained serum creatinine > 2 . 5 mg / dl
Drugs: creatinine
Sentence: , n = 41 ; and esrd , n = 45 .
Drugs: 
Sentence: groups were compared for preoperative laboratory variables , diagnosis , postoperative variables , survival , type of esrd therapy , and survival from onset of esrd .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: at 13 years after oltx , the incidence of severe renal dysfunction was 18 . 1 % ( crf 8 . 6 % and esrd 9 . 5 % )
Drugs: 
Sentence: .
Drugs: 
Sentence: compared with control patients , crf and esrd patients had higher preoperative serum creatinine levels , a greater percentage of patients with hepatorenal syndrome , higher percentage requirement for dialysis
Drugs: creatinine
Sentence: in the first 3 months postoperatively , and a higher 1 - year serum creatinine .
Drugs: creatinine
Sentence: multivariate stepwise logistic regression analysis using preoperative and postoperative variables identified that an increase of serum creatinine compared with average at 1 year , 3 months , and 4 weeks
Drugs: creatinine
Sentence: postoperatively were independent risk factors for the development of crf or esrd with odds ratios of 2 . 6 , 2 . 2 , and 1 . 6 , respectively
Drugs: 
Sentence: .
Drugs: 
Sentence: overall survival from the time of oltx was not significantly different among groups , but by year 13 , the survival of the patients who had esrd was only 28
Drugs: 
Sentence: . 2 % compared with 54 . 6 % in the control group .
Drugs: 
Sentence: patients developing esrd had a 6 - year survival after onset of esrd of 27 % for the patients receiving hemodialysis versus 71 . 4 % for the patients developing
Drugs: 
Sentence: esrd who subsequently received kidney transplants .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: patients who are more than 10 years post - oltx have crf and esrd at a high rate .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the development of esrd decreases survival , particularly in those patients treated with dialysis only .
Drugs: 
Sentence: patients who develop esrd have a higher preoperative and 1 - year serum creatinine and are more likely to have hepatorenal syndrome .
Drugs: creatinine
Sentence: however , an increase of serum creatinine at various times postoperatively is more predictive of the development of crf or esrd .
Drugs: creatinine
Sentence: new strategies for long - term immunosuppression may be needed to decrease this complication .
Drugs:

Sentence: respectively ) .

Drugs:

Sentence: dependency ( barthel index < 60 ) ( n / n = 25 / 26 , or 10 . 16 , 95 % ci 1 . 02 to 101 .

Sentence: for low - dose nimodipine , the results were not conclusive .

Sentence: transient neurologic symptoms after spinal anesthesia : a lower incidence with prilocaine and bupivacaine than with lidocaine .
Drugs: prilocaine, bupivacaine, lidocaine
Sentence: background :
Drugs: 
Sentence: recent evidence suggests that transient neurologic symptoms ( tnss ) frequently follow lidocaine spinal anesthesia but are infrequent with bupivacaine .
Drugs: lidocaine, bupivacaine
Sentence: however , identification of a short - acting local anesthetic to substitute for lidocaine for brief surgical procedures remains an important goal .
Drugs: lidocaine
Sentence: prilocaine is an amide local anesthetic with a duration of action similar to that of lidocaine .
Drugs: prilocaine, lidocaine
Sentence: accordingly , the present , prospective double - blind study compares prilocaine with lidocaine and bupivacaine with respect to duration of action and relative risk of tnss .
Drugs: prilocaine, lidocaine, bupivacaine
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: ninety patients classified as american society of anesthesiologists physical status
Drugs: 
Sentence: i or ii who were scheduled for short gynecologic procedures under spinal anesthesia were randomly allocated to receive 2 . 5 ml 2 % lidocaine in 7 . 5 %
Drugs: lidocaine
Sentence: glucose , 2 % prilocaine in 7 . 5 % glucose , or 0 . 5 % bupivacaine in 7 . 5 % glucose .
Drugs: glucose, prilocaine, glucose, bupivacaine, glucose
Sentence: all solutions were provided in blinded vials by the hospital pharmacy .
Drugs: 
Sentence: details of spinal puncture , extension and regression of spinal block , and the times to reach discharge criteria were noted .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in the evening of postoperative day 1 , patients were evaluated for tnss by a physician unaware of the drug administered and the details of the anesthetic procedure .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: nine of 30 patients receiving lidocaine experienced tnss , 1 of 30 patients receiving prilocaine ( p = 0 . 03 ) had them , and none of 30 patients
Drugs: lidocaine, prilocaine
Sentence: receiving bupivacaine had tnss .
Drugs: bupivacaine
Sentence: times to ambulate and to void were similar after lidocaine and prilocaine ( 150 vs . 165 min and 238 vs . 253 min , respectively ) but prolonged after
Drugs: lidocaine, prilocaine
Sentence: bupivacaine ( 200 and 299 min , respectively ; p < 0 . 05 ) .
Drugs: bupivacaine
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: prilocaine may be preferable to lidocaine for short surgical procedures because it has a similar duration of action but a lower incidence of tnss .
Drugs: prilocaine, lidocaine
Sentence: the role of nicotine in smoking - related cardiovascular disease .
Drugs: nicotine
Sentence: nicotine activates the sympathetic nervous system and in this way could contribute to cardiovascular disease .
Drugs: nicotine
Sentence: animal studies and mechanistic studies indicate that nicotine could play a role in accelerating atherosclerosis , but evidence among humans is too inadequate to be definitive about such an effect
Drugs: nicotine
Sentence: .
Drugs: 
Sentence: almost certainly , nicotine via its hemodynamic effects contributes to acute cardiovascular events , although current evidence suggests that the effects of nicotine are much less important than are the
Drugs: nicotine, nicotine
Sentence: prothrombotic effects of cigarette smoking or the effects of carbon monoxide .
Drugs: carbonmonoxide, monoxide
Sentence: nicotine does not appear to enhance thrombosis among humans .
Drugs: nicotine
Sentence: clinical studies of pipe smokers and people using transdermal nicotine support the idea that toxins other than nicotine are the most important causes of acute cardiovascular events .
Drugs: nicotine, nicotine
Sentence: finally , the dose response for cardiovascular events of nicotine appears to be flat , suggesting that if nicotine is involved , adverse effects might be seen with relatively low
Drugs: nicotine, nicotine
Sentence: - level cigarette exposures .

Sentence: seizure resulting from a venlafaxine overdose .
Drugs: venlafaxine
Sentence: objective :
Drugs: 
Sentence: to report a case of venlafaxine overdose .
Drugs: venlafaxine
Sentence: case summary :
Drugs: 
Sentence: a 40 - year - old woman with major depression took an overdose of venlafaxine in an apparent suicide attempt .
Drugs: venlafaxine
Sentence: after the ingestion of 26 venlafaxine 50 - mg tablets , the patient experienced a witnessed generalized seizure .
Drugs: venlafaxine
Sentence: she was admitted to the medical intensive care unit , venlafaxine was discontinued , and no further sequelae were seen .
Drugs: venlafaxine
Sentence: discussion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: to our knowledge , this is the first reported case of venlafaxine overdose that resulted in a generalized seizure .
Drugs: venlafaxine
Sentence: based on nonoverdose pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of venlafaxine and the potential risks of available interventions , no emergent therapy was instituted .
Drugs: venlafaxine
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the venlafaxine overdose in our patient resulted in a single episode of generalized seizure but elicited no further sequelae .
Drugs: venlafaxine

Sentence: here we show that perceived pain intensity in secondary hyperalgesia is decreased when attention is distracted away from the painful pinprick stimulus with a visual task .

Sentence: upregulation of brain expression of p - glycoprotein in mrp2 - deficient tr ( - ) rats resembles seizure - induced up - regulation of this drug efflux transporter in
Drugs: 
Sentence: normal rats .
Drugs: 
Sentence: purpose :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the multidrug resistance protein 2 ( mrp2 ) is a drug efflux transporter that is expressed predominantly at the apical domain of hepatocytes but seems also to be expressed at
Drugs: 
Sentence: the apical membrane of brain capillary endothelial cells that form the blood - brain barrier ( bbb ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: mrp2 is absent in the transport - deficient ( tr ( - ) )
Drugs: 
Sentence: wistar rat mutant , so that this rat strain was very helpful in defining substrates of mrp2 by comparing tissue concentrations or functional activities of compounds in mrp2 - deficient
Drugs: 
Sentence: rats with those in transport - competent wistar rats .
Drugs: 
Sentence: by using this strategy to study the involvement of mrp2 in brain access of antiepileptic drugs ( aeds ) , we recently reported that phenytoin is a substrate for mrp2
Drugs: phenytoin
Sentence: in the bbb .
Drugs: 
Sentence: however , one drawback of such studies in genetically deficient rats is the fact that compensatory changes with upregulation of other transporters can occur .
Drugs: 
Sentence: this prompted us to study the brain expression of p - glycoprotein ( pgp ) , a major drug efflux transporter in many tissues , including the bbb , in
Drugs: 
Sentence: tr ( - ) rats compared with nonmutant ( wild - type ) wistar rats .
Drugs: 
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the expression of mrp2 and pgp in brain and liver sections of tr ( - ) rats and normal wistar rats was determined with immunohistochemistry , by using a novel
Drugs: 
Sentence: , highly selective monoclonal mrp2 antibody and the monoclonal pgp antibody c219 , respectively .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: immunofluorescence staining with the mrp2 antibody was found to label a high number of microvessels throughout the brain in normal wistar rats , whereas such labeling was absent in tr
Drugs: 
Sentence: ( - ) rats .
Drugs: 
Sentence: tr ( - ) rats exhibited a significant up - regulation of pgp in brain capillary endothelial cells compared with wild - type controls .
Drugs: 
Sentence: no such obvious upregulation of pgp was observed in liver sections .
Drugs: 
Sentence: a comparable overexpression of pgp in the bbb was obtained after pilocarpine - induced seizures in wild - type wistar rats .
Drugs: pilocarpine
Sentence: experiments with systemic administration of the pgp substrate phenobarbital and the selective pgp inhibitor tariquidar in tr ( - ) rats substantiated that pgp is functional and compensates for the
Drugs: phenobarbital, tariquidar
Sentence: lack of mrp2 in the bbb .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the data on tr ( - ) rats indicate that pgp plays an important role in the compensation of mrp2 deficiency in the bbb .
Drugs: 
Sentence: because such a compensatory mechanism most likely occurs to reduce injury to the brain from cytotoxic compounds , the present data substantiate the concept that mrp2 performs a protective role
Drugs: 
Sentence: in the bbb .
Drugs: 
Sentence: furthermore , our data suggest that tr ( - ) rats are an interesting tool to study consequences of overexpression of pgp in the bbb on access of drugs in
Drugs: 
Sentence: the brain , without the need of inducing seizures or other pgp - enhancing events for this purpose .

Sentence: causes of acute thrombotic microangiopathy in patients receiving kidney transplantation .
Drugs: 
Sentence: objectives :
Drugs: 
Sentence: thrombotic microangiopathy is a well - known problem in patients following renal transplantation .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in postrenal transplantation , thrombotic microangiopathy is often a reflection of hemolytic uremic syndrome .
Drugs: 
Sentence: we aimed to determine the causes of thrombotic microangiopathy in a population of renal transplantation recipients and discuss the literature .
Drugs: 
Sentence: materials and methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: we investigated the causes of thrombotic microangiopathy during a 1 - year period , from june 2003 to june 2004 , at the king fahad national guard hospital in riyadh
Drugs: 
Sentence: , saudi arabia , by reviewing the slides of all transplant biopsies ( n = 25 ) performed during this interval .
Drugs: 
Sentence: pre - and posttransplant crossmatching was done when possible .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: five cases of thrombotic microangiopathy were found .
Drugs: 
Sentence: three of these cases were from the 25 transplantations performed at king fahad national guard hospital , while the other 2 transplantations had been performed abroad and were referred to
Drugs: 
Sentence: us for follow - up .
Drugs: 
Sentence: three cases were related to cyclosporine , and 1 case was secondary to both cyclosporine and tacrolimus .
Drugs: cyclosporine, cyclosporine, tacrolimus
Sentence: the fifth case had features of thrombotic microangiopathy related to an antiphospholipid syndrome in a patient with systemic lupus erythematosus .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: in the literature , the most - frequent cause of hemolytic uremic syndrome in patients following renal transplantation is recurrence of the hemolytic uremic syndrome .
Drugs: 
Sentence: other causes include drug - related ( cyclosporine , tacrolimus ) toxicity , procoagulant status , and antibody - mediated rejection .
Drugs: cyclosporine, tacrolimus
Sentence: we found that the most - frequent cause of thrombotic microangiopathy was drug related , secondary mainly to cyclosporine .
Drugs: cyclosporine
Sentence: in the current study , the frequency of thrombotic microangiopathy was similar to the percentage reported in the literature ( 20 % ) .
Drugs:

Drugs: epinephrine

Drugs: catecholamine, catecholamines
Sentence: in contrast , reports of myocardial dysfunction due to acute iatrogenic overdose are rare .
Drugs: 
Sentence: a 35 - year - old woman whose cervix uteri was inadvertently injected with 8 mg of epinephrine developed myocardial stunning that was characterized by severe hemodynamic compromise , profound
Drugs: epinephrine
Sentence: , albeit transient , left ventricular systolic and diastolic dysfunction , and only modestly elevated biochemical markers of myocardial necrosis .
Drugs: 
Sentence: our case illustrates the serious consequences of medical errors that can be avoided through improved medication labeling and staff supervision .

Sentence: wegener 's granulomatosis , were also estimated .

Drugs: cyclophosphamide

Drugs: 
Sentence: anencephaly has been suggested to develop from exencephaly ; however , there is little direct experimental evidence to support this , and the mechanism of transformation remains unclear .
Drugs: 
Sentence: we examined this theory using the exo utero development system that allows direct and sequential observations of mid - to late - gestation mouse embryos .
Drugs: 
Sentence: we observed the exencephaly induced by 5 - azacytidine at embryonic day 13 . 5 ( e13 . 5 ) , let the embryos develop exo utero until e18 .
Drugs: 5-azacytidine, azacytidine
Sentence: 5 , and re - observed the same embryos at e18 . 5 .
Drugs: 
Sentence: we confirmed several cases of transformation from exencephaly to anencephaly .
Drugs: 
Sentence: however , in many cases , the exencephalic brain tissue was preserved with more or less reduction during this period .
Drugs: 
Sentence: to analyze the transformation patterns , we classified the exencephaly by size and shape of the exencephalic tissue into several types at e13 . 5 and e18 . 5 .
Drugs: 
Sentence: it was found that the transformation of exencephalic tissue was not simply size - dependent , and all cases of anencephaly at e18 . 5 resulted from embryos with a
Drugs: 
Sentence: large amount of exencephalic tissue at e13 . 5 .
Drugs: 
Sentence: microscopic observation showed the configuration of exencephaly at e13 . 5 , frequent hemorrhaging and detachment of the neural plate from surface ectoderm in the exencephalic head at e15 .
Drugs: 
Sentence: 5 , and multiple modes of reduction in the exencephalic tissue at e18 . 5 .
Drugs: 
Sentence: from observations of the vasculature , altered distribution patterns of vessels were identified in the exencephalic head .
Drugs: 
Sentence: these findings suggest that overgrowth of the exencephalic neural tissue causes the altered distribution patterns of vessels , subsequent peripheral circulatory failure and / or hemorrhaging in various parts of
Drugs: 
Sentence: the exencephalic head , leading to the multiple modes of tissue reduction during transformation from exencephaly to anencephaly .

Sentence: acute cocaine - induced seizures : differential sensitivity of six inbred mouse strains .
Drugs: cocaine
Sentence: mature male and female mice from six inbred stains were tested for susceptibility to behavioral seizures induced by a single injection of cocaine .
Drugs: cocaine
Sentence: cocaine was injected ip over a range of doses ( 50 - 100 mg / kg ) and behavior was monitored for 20 minutes .
Drugs: cocaine
Sentence: seizure end points included latency to forelimb or hindlimb clonus , latency to clonic running seizure and latency to jumping bouncing seizure .
Drugs: 
Sentence: a range of strain specific sensitivities was documented with a / j and sjl mice being most sensitive and c57bl / 6j most resistant .
Drugs: 
Sentence: dba / 2j , balb / cbyj and nzw / lacj strains exhibited intermediate sensitivity .
Drugs: 
Sentence: eeg recordings were made in sjl , a / j and c57bl / 6j mice revealing a close correspondence between electrical activity and behavior .
Drugs: 
Sentence: additionally , levels of cocaine determined in hippocampus and cortex were not different between sensitive and resistant strains .
Drugs: cocaine
Sentence: additional studies of these murine strains may be useful for investigating genetic influences on cocaine - induced seizures .
Drugs: cocaine

Sentence: effects of aminophylline on the threshold for initiating ventricular fibrillation during respiratory failure .
Drugs: aminophylline
Sentence: cardiac arrhythmias have frequently been reported in association with respiratory failure .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the possible additive role of pharmacologic agents in precipitating cardiac disturbances in patients with respiratory failure has only recently been emphasized .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the effects of aminophylline on the ventricular fibrillation threshold during normal acid - base conditions and during respiratory failure were studied in anesthetized open chest dogs .
Drugs: aminophylline
Sentence: the ventricular fibrillation threshold was measured by passing a gated train of 12 constant current pulses through the ventricular myocardium during the vulnerable period of the cardiac cycle .
Drugs: 
Sentence: during the infusion of aminophylline , the ventricular fibrillation threshold was reduced by 30 to 40 percent of the control when ph and partial pressures of oxygen ( po2 )
Drugs: aminophylline, oxygen, po2
Sentence: and carbon dioxide ( co2 ) were kept within normal limits .
Drugs: carbondioxide, dioxide, co2
Sentence: when respiratory failure was produced by hypoventilation ( ph 7 . 05 to 7 . 25 ; pc02 70 to 100 mm hg : p02 20 to 40 mm hg
Drugs: 
Sentence: ) , infusion of aminophylline resulted in an even greater decrease in ventricular fibrillation threshold to 60 percent of the control level .
Drugs: aminophylline
Sentence: these experiments suggest that although many factors may contribute to the increased incidence of ventricular arrhythmias in respiratory failure , pharmacologic agents , particularly aminophylline , may play a significant
Drugs: aminophylline

Sentence: case report : acute unintentional carbachol intoxication .
Drugs: carbachol
Sentence: introduction :
Drugs: 
Sentence: intoxications with carbachol , a muscarinic cholinergic receptor agonist are rare .
Drugs: carbachol
Sentence: we report an interesting case investigating a ( near ) fatal poisoning .
Drugs: 
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the son of an 84 - year - old male discovered a newspaper report stating clinical success with plant extracts in alzheimer 's disease .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the mode of action was said to be comparable to that of the synthetic compound ' carbamylcholin ' ; that is , carbachol .
Drugs: carbamylcholin, carbachol
Sentence: he bought 25 g of carbachol as pure substance in a pharmacy , and the father was administered 400 to 500 mg .
Drugs: carbachol
Sentence: carbachol concentrations in serum and urine on day 1 and 2 of hospital admission were analysed by hplc - mass spectrometry .
Drugs: carbachol
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: minutes after oral administration , the patient developed nausea , sweating and hypotension , and finally collapsed .
Drugs: 
Sentence: bradycardia , cholinergic symptoms and asystole occurred .
Drugs: 
Sentence: initial cardiopulmonary resuscitation and immediate treatment with adrenaline ( epinephrine ) , atropine and furosemide was successful .
Drugs: adrenaline, epinephrine, atropine, furosemide
Sentence: on hospital admission , blood pressure of the intubated , bradyarrhythmic patient was 100 / 65 mmhg .
Drugs: 
Sentence: further signs were hyperhidrosis , hypersalivation , bronchorrhoea , and severe miosis ; the electrocardiographic finding was atrio - ventricular dissociation .
Drugs: 
Sentence: high doses of atropine
Drugs: atropine
Sentence: ( up to 50 mg per 24 hours ) , adrenaline and dopamine were necessary .
Drugs: adrenaline, dopamine
Sentence: the patient was extubated 1 week later .
Drugs: 
Sentence: however , increased dyspnoea and bronchospasm necessitated reintubation .
Drugs: 
Sentence: respiratory insufficiency was further worsened by proteus mirabilis infection and severe bronchoconstriction .
Drugs: 
Sentence: one week later , the patient was again extubated and 3 days later was transferred to a peripheral ward .
Drugs: 
Sentence: on the next day he died , probably as a result of heart failure .
Drugs: 
Sentence: serum samples from the first and second days contained 3 . 6 and 1 . 9 mg / l carbachol , respectively .
Drugs: carbachol
Sentence: the corresponding urine concentrations amounted to 374 and 554 mg / l .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: this case started with a media report in a popular newspaper , initiated by published , peer - reviewed research on herbals , and involved human failure in a case
Drugs: 
Sentence: history , medical examination and clinical treatment .
Drugs: 
Sentence: for the first time , an analytical method for the determination of carbachol in plasma and urine has been developed .
Drugs: carbachol
Sentence: the analysed carbachol concentration exceeded the supposed serum level resulting from a therapeutic dose by a factor of 130 to 260 .
Drugs: carbachol
Sentence: especially in old patients , intensivists should consider intoxications ( with cholinergics ) as a cause of acute cardiovascular failure .
Drugs:

Drugs: cyclophosphamide
Sentence: assess association between presence of peritransplant congestive heart failure ( chf ) and the following pretreatment characteristics : presence of electrocardiogram ( ekg ) abnormalities , age , hypertension ,
Drugs: 
Sentence: prior cardiac history , smoking , diabetes mellitus , prior use of anthracyclines , and left - sided chest irradiation .

Drugs:

Sentence: incidence of transient cyclophosphamide - related cardiac toxicity ( 10 % ) is comparable to previous recorded literature .

Sentence: can angiogenesis be a target of treatment for ribavirin associated hemolytic anemia ?
Drugs: ribavirin
Sentence: background / aims :
Drugs: 
Sentence: recently ribavirin has been found to inhibit angiogenesis and a number of angiogenesis inhibitors such as sunitinib and sorafenib have been found to cause acute hemolysis .
Drugs: ribavirin, sunitinib, sorafenib
Sentence: we aimed to investigate whether there is a relation between hemoglobin , haptoglobin and angiogenesis soluble markers which are modifiable and can help in developing strategies against anemia .
Drugs: 
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: fourteen patients chronically infected with hepatitis c virus were treated by pegylated interferon alpha 2a and ribavirin .
Drugs: pegylatedinterferonalpha2a, 2a, ribavirin
Sentence: serum hemoglobin , haptoglobin and angiogenesis markers of vascular endothelial growth factor and angiopoetin - 2 were investigated before and after therapy .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: we observed a significant decrease in haptoglobin levels at the end of the treatment period .
Drugs: 
Sentence: hemoglobin levels also decreased but insignificantly by treatment .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in contrast with the literature , serum levels of angiogenesis factors did not change significantly by pegylated interferon and ribavirin therapy .
Drugs: pegylatedinterferon, interferon, ribavirin
Sentence: we found no correlation of angiogenesis soluble markers with either hemoglobin or haptoglobin .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: this is the first study in the literature investigating a link between angiogenesis soluble markers and ribavirin induced anemia in patients with hepatitis c and we could not find any
Drugs: ribavirin
Sentence: relation .
Drugs: 
Sentence: future research with larger number of patients is needed to find out modifiable factors that will improve the safety of ribavirin therapy .
Drugs: ribavirin

Drugs: curcumin, phenobarbitone, carbamazepine
Sentence: the antiepileptic drugs , phenobarbitone and carbamazepine are well known to cause cognitive impairment on chronic use .
Drugs: phenobarbitone, carbamazepine
Sentence: the increase in free radical generation has been implicated as one of the important mechanisms of cognitive impairment by antiepileptic drugs .
Drugs: 
Sentence: curcumin has shown antioxidant , anti - inflammatory and neuro - protective properties .
Drugs: curcumin
Sentence: therefore , the present study was carried out to investigate the effect of chronic curcumin administration on phenobarbitone - and carbamazepine - induced cognitive impairment and oxidative stress in rats
Drugs: curcumin, phenobarbitone, carbamazepine
Sentence: .
Drugs: 
Sentence: pharmacokinetic interactions of curcumin with phenobarbitone and carbamazepine were also studied .
Drugs: curcumin, phenobarbitone, carbamazepine
Sentence: vehicle / drugs were administered daily for 21days to male wistar rats .
Drugs: 
Sentence: passive avoidance paradigm and elevated plus maze test were used to assess cognitive function .
Drugs: 
Sentence: at the end of study period , serum phenobarbitone and carbamazepine , whole brain malondialdehyde and reduced glutathione levels were estimated .
Drugs: phenobarbitone, carbamazepine, malondialdehyde, glutathione
Sentence: the administration of phenobarbitone and carbamazepine for 21days caused a significant impairment of learning and memory as well as an increased oxidative stress .
Drugs: phenobarbitone, carbamazepine
Sentence: concomitant curcumin administration prevented the cognitive impairment and decreased the increased oxidative stress induced by these antiepileptic drugs .
Drugs: curcumin
Sentence: curcumin co - administration did not cause any significant alteration in the serum concentrations of both phenobarbitone as well as carbamazepine .
Drugs: curcumin, phenobarbitone, carbamazepine
Sentence: these results show that curcumin has beneficial effect in mitigating the deterioration of cognitive functions and oxidative damage in rats treated with phenobarbitone and carbamazepine without significantly altering their serum
Drugs: curcumin, phenobarbitone, carbamazepine
Sentence: concentrations .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the findings suggest that curcumin can be considered as a potential safe and effective adjuvant to phenobarbitone and carbamazepine therapy in preventing cognitive impairment associated with these drugs .
Drugs: curcumin, phenobarbitone, carbamazepine

Sentence: both , production of reactive oxygen species as well as activation of nf - kappab have been implicated in severe neuronal damage in different sub - regions of the hippocampus
Drugs: oxygen
Sentence: as well as in the surrounding cortices .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the effect of pdtc on status epilepticus - associated cell loss in the hippocampus and piriform cortex was evaluated in the rat fractionated pilocarpine model .
Drugs: pdtc, pilocarpine
Sentence: treatment with 150 mg / kg pdtc before and following status epilepticus significantly increased the mortality rate to 100 % .
Drugs: pdtc
Sentence: administration of 50 mg / kg pdtc ( low - dose ) did not exert major effects on the development of a status epilepticus or the mortality rate .
Drugs: pdtc
Sentence: in vehicle - treated rats , status epilepticus caused pronounced neuronal damage in the piriform cortex comprising both pyramidal cells and interneurons .
Drugs: 
Sentence: low - dose pdtc treatment almost completely protected from lesions in the piriform cortex .
Drugs: pdtc
Sentence: a significant decrease in neuronal density of the hippocampal hilar formation was identified in vehicle - and pdtc - treated rats following status epilepticus .
Drugs: pdtc
Sentence: in conclusion , the nf - kappab inhibitor and antioxidant pdtc protected the piriform cortex , whereas it did not affect hilar neuronal loss .
Drugs: pdtc

Drugs: oxygen
Sentence: temporal cortex as compared to the hippocampal hilus .
Drugs: 
Sentence: however , future investigations are necessary to exactly analyze the biochemical mechanisms by which pdtc exerted its beneficial effects in the piriform cortex .

Drugs: nicotine, nicotine
Sentence: study .
Drugs: 
Sentence: background :
Drugs: 
Sentence: nicotine polacrilex lozenges deliver 25 % to 27 % more nicotine compared with equivalent doses of nicotine polacrilex gum .

Sentence: the increased nicotine exposure from the lozenge has raised questions about the relative safety of the lozenge and gum .

Sentence: objective : the objective of this study was to compare the safety profiles of the 4 - mg nicotine lozenge and 4 - mg nicotine gum in smokers with selected
Drugs: nicotine, nicotine
Sentence: label - restricted diseases .
Drugs: 
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: this was a multicenter , randomized , open - label study in adult smokers with heart disease , hypertension not controlled by medication , and / or diabetes mellitus .
Drugs: 
Sentence: patients were randomized in a 1 : 1 ratio to receive the 4 - mg nicotine lozenge or 4 - mg nicotine gum .
Drugs: nicotine, nicotine
Sentence: safety assessments were made at baseline and at 2 , 4 , 6 , and 12 weeks after the start of product use .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: nine hundred one patients were randomized to treatment , 447 who received the lozenge and 454 who received the gum ( safety population ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the majority were women ( 52 . 7 % ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: patients ' mean age was 53 . 9 years , their mean weight was 193 . 9 pounds , and they smoked a mean of 25 . 2 cigarettes per
Drugs: 
Sentence: day at baseline .
Drugs: 
Sentence: five hundred fifty - three patients , 264 taking the lozenge and 289 taking the gum , used the study product for > or = 4 days per week during
Drugs: 
Sentence: the first 2 weeks ( evaluable population ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the nicotine lozenge and nicotine gum were equally well tolerated , despite increased nicotine exposure from the lozenge .
Drugs: nicotine, nicotine, nicotine
Sentence: the incidence of adverse events in the 2 groups was similar during the first 2 weeks of product use ( evaluation population : 55 . 3 % lozenge , 54
Drugs: 
Sentence: . 7 % gum ) , as well as during the entire study ( safety population : 63 . 8 % and 58 . 6 % , respectively ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: stratification of patients by sex , age , extent of concurrent smoking , extent of product use , and severity of adverse events revealed no clinically significant differences between the
Drugs: 
Sentence: lozenge and gum .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the most common adverse events were nausea ( 17 . 2 % and 16 . 1 % ; 95 % ci , - 3 . 7 to 6 . 0
Drugs: 
Sentence: ) , hiccups ( 10 . 7 % and 6 . 6 % ; 95 % ci , 0 . 5 to 7 . 8 ) , and headache (
Drugs: 
Sentence: 8 . 7 % and 9 . 9 % ; 95 % cl , - 5 . 0 to 2 . 6 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: serious adverse events were reported in 11 and 13 patients in the respective groups .
Drugs: 
Sentence: fewer than 6 % of patients in either group were considered by the investigator to have a worsening of their overall disease condition during the study .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the majority of patients ( > 60 % ) experienced no change in their disease status from baseline .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the 4 - mg nicotine lozenge and 4 - mg nicotine gum had comparable safety profiles in these patients with label - restricted medical conditions .
Drugs: nicotine, nicotine

Drugs: levodopa
Sentence: levodopa - induced dyskinesias ( lids ) present a major problem for the long - term management of parkinson 's disease ( pd ) patients .
Drugs: levodopa
Sentence: due to the interdependence of risk factors in clinical populations , it is difficult to independently examine factors that may influence the development of lids .
Drugs: 
Sentence: using macaque monkeys with different types of mptp - induced parkinsonism , the current study evaluated the degree to which rate of symptom progression , symptom severity , and response
Drugs: mptp
Sentence: to and duration of levodopa therapy may be involved in the development of lids .
Drugs: levodopa
Sentence: monkeys with acute ( short - term ) mptp exposure , rapid symptom onset and short symptom duration prior to initiation of levodopa therapy developed dyskinesia between 11 and 24
Drugs: mptp, levodopa
Sentence: days of daily levodopa administration .
Drugs: levodopa
Sentence: in contrast , monkeys with long - term mptp exposure , slow symptom progression and / or long symptom duration prior to initiation of levodopa therapy were more resistant to
Drugs: mptp, levodopa
Sentence: developing lids ( e . g . , dyskinesia developed no sooner than 146 days of chronic levodopa administration ) .
Drugs: levodopa
Sentence: all animals were similarly symptomatic at the start of levodopa treatment and had similar therapeutic responses to the drug .
Drugs: levodopa
Sentence: these data suggest distinct differences in the propensity to develop lids in monkeys with different rates of symptom progression or symptom durations prior to levodopa and demonstrate the value of
Drugs: levodopa
Sentence: these models for further studying the pathophysiology of lids .
