Sentence: flestolol : an ultra - short - acting beta - adrenergic blocking agent .
Drugs: flestolol
Sentence: flestolol ( acc - 9089 ) is a nonselective , competitive , ultra - short - acting beta - adrenergic blocking agent , without any intrinsic sympathomimetic activity .
Drugs: flestolol-9089, 9089
Sentence: flestolol is metabolized by plasma esterases and has an elimination half - life of approximately 6 . 5 minutes .
Drugs: flestolol
Sentence: this agent was well tolerated in healthy volunteers at doses up to 100 micrograms / kg / min .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in long - term infusion studies , flestolol was well tolerated at the effective beta - blocking dose ( 5 micrograms / kg / min ) for up to seven
Drugs: flestolol
Sentence: days .
Drugs: 
Sentence: flestolol blood concentrations increased linearly with increasing dose and good correlation exists between blood concentrations of flestolol and beta - adrenergic blockade .
Drugs: flestolol, flestolol
Sentence: flestolol produced a dose - dependent attenuation of isoproterenol - induced tachycardia .
Drugs: flestolol, isoproterenol
Sentence: electrophysiologic and hemodynamic effects of flestolol are similar to those of other beta blockers .
Drugs: flestolol
Sentence: in contrast with other beta blockers , flestolol - induced effects reverse rapidly ( within 30 minutes ) following discontinuation because of its short half - life .
Drugs: flestolol
Sentence: flestolol effectively reduced heart rate in patients with supraventricular tachyarrhythmia .
Drugs: flestolol
Sentence: in patients with unstable angina , flestolol infusion was found to be safe and effective in controlling chest pain .
Drugs: flestolol
Sentence: it is concluded that flestolol is a potent , well - tolerated , ultra - short - acting beta - adrenergic blocking agent .
Drugs: flestolol
Sentence: use of flestolol in the critical care setting is currently undergoing investigation .
Drugs: flestolol

Drugs:

Sentence: the historical controls consisted of 50 consecutive patients who underwent ct without prophylactic lamivudine .

Sentence: a study on the effect of the duration of subcutaneous heparin injection on bruising and pain .
Drugs: heparin
Sentence: aim :
Drugs: 
Sentence: this study was carried out to determine the effect of injection duration on bruising and pain following the administration of the subcutaneous injection of heparin .
Drugs: heparin
Sentence: background :
Drugs: 
Sentence: although different methods to prevent bruising and pain following the subcutaneous injection of heparin have been widely studied and described , the effect of injection duration on the occurrence of
Drugs: heparin
Sentence: bruising and pain is little documented .
Drugs: 
Sentence: design :
Drugs: 
Sentence: this study was designed as within - subject , quasi - experimental research .
Drugs: 
Sentence: method :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the sample for the study consisted of 50 patients to whom subcutaneous heparin was administered .
Drugs: heparin
Sentence: heparin was injected over 10 seconds on the right abdominal site and 30 seconds on the left abdominal site .
Drugs: heparin
Sentence: injections areas were assessed for the presence of bruising at 48 and 72 hours after each injection .
Drugs: 
Sentence: dimensions of the bruising on the heparin applied areas were measured using transparent millimetric measuring paper .
Drugs: heparin
Sentence: the visual analog scale ( vas ) was used to measure pain intensity and a stop - watch was used to time the pain period .
Drugs: 
Sentence: data were analysed using chi - square test , mann - whitney u , wilcoxon signed ranks tests and correlation .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the percentage of bruising occurrence was 64 % with the injection of 10 seconds duration and 42 % in the 30 - second injection .
Drugs: 
Sentence: it was determined that the size of the bruising was smaller in the 30 - second injection .
Drugs: 
Sentence: pain intensity and pain period were statistically significantly lower for the 30 - second injection than for the 10 - second injection .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: it was determined that injection duration had an effect on bruising and pain following the subcutaneous administration of heparin .
Drugs: heparin
Sentence: this study should be repeated on a larger sample .
Drugs: 
Sentence: relevance to
Drugs: 
Sentence: clinical practice :
Drugs: 
Sentence: when administering subcutaneous heparin injections , it is important to extend the duration of the injection .
Drugs: heparin

Sentence: thrombocytopenia with platelet counts in the range of 30 , 000 to 40 , 000 per cubic millimeter .

Sentence: appropriate treatment consists of discontinuation of heparin , and anticoagulation with sodium warfarin if necessary .

Sentence: long - term prognosis for transplant - free survivors of paracetamol - induced acute liver failure .
Drugs: paracetamol
Sentence: background :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the prognosis for transplant - free survivors of paracetamol - induced acute liver failure remains unknown .
Drugs: paracetamol
Sentence: aim :
Drugs: 
Sentence: to examine whether paracetamol - induced acute liver failure increases long - term mortality .
Drugs: paracetamol
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: we followed up all transplant - free survivors of paracetamol - induced acute liver injury , hospitalized in a danish national referral centre during 1984 - 2004 .
Drugs: paracetamol
Sentence: we compared age - specific mortality rates from 1 year post - discharge through 2008 between those in whom the liver injury led to an acute liver failure and those
Drugs: 
Sentence: in whom it did not .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: we included 641 patients .
Drugs: 
Sentence: on average , age - specific mortality rates were slightly higher for the 101 patients whose paracetamol - induced liver injury had caused an acute liver failure ( adjusted mortality
Drugs: paracetamol
Sentence: rate ratio = 1 . 70 , 95 % ci 1 . 02 - 2 . 85 ) , but the association was age - dependent , and no survivors
Drugs: 
Sentence: of acute liver failure died of liver disease , whereas suicides were frequent in both groups .
Drugs: 
Sentence: these observations speak against long - term effects of acute liver failure .
Drugs: 
Sentence: more likely , the elevated mortality rate ratio resulted from incomplete adjustment for the greater prevalence of substance abuse among survivors of acute liver failure .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: paracetamol - induced acute liver failure did not affect long - term mortality .
Drugs: paracetamol
Sentence: clinical follow - up may be justified by the cause of the liver failure , but not by the liver failure itself .

Sentence: serotonin 6 receptor gene is associated with methamphetamine - induced psychosis in a japanese population .
Drugs: serotonin, methamphetamine
Sentence: background :
Drugs: 
Sentence: altered serotonergic neural transmission is hypothesized to be a susceptibility factor for psychotic disorders such as schizophrenia .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the serotonin 6 ( 5 - ht6 ) receptor is therapeutically targeted by several second generation antipsychotics , such as clozapine and olanzapine , and d - amphetamine - induced
Drugs: serotonin--amphetamine, amphetamine
Sentence: hyperactivity in rats is corrected with the use of a selective 5 - ht6 receptor antagonist .
Drugs: 5-, -
Sentence: in addition , the disrupted prepulse inhibition induced by d - amphetamine or phencyclidine was restored by 5 - ht6 receptor antagonist in an animal study using rats .
Drugs: d-amphetamine-, -
Sentence: these animal models were considered to reflect the positive symptoms of schizophrenia , and the above evidence suggests that altered 5 - ht6 receptors are involved in the pathophysiology of
Drugs: 5-, -
Sentence: psychotic disorders .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the symptoms of methamphetamine ( meth ) - induced psychosis are similar to those of paranoid type schizophrenia .
Drugs: methamphetamine, meth
Sentence: therefore , we conducted an analysis of the association of the 5 - ht6 gene ( htr6 ) with meth - induced psychosis .
Drugs: 5-, -, meth
Sentence: method :
Drugs: 
Sentence: using five tagging snps ( rs6693503 , rs1805054 , rs4912138 , rs3790757 and rs9659997 ) , we conducted a genetic association analysis of case - control samples ( 197
Drugs: 
Sentence: meth - induced psychosis patients and 337 controls ) in the japanese population .
Drugs: meth
Sentence: the age and sex of the control subjects did not differ from those of the methamphetamine dependence patients .
Drugs: methamphetamine
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: rs6693503 was associated with meth - induced psychosis patients in the allele / genotype - wise analysis .
Drugs: meth
Sentence: moreover , this association remained significant after bonferroni correction .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in the haplotype - wise analysis , we detected an association between two markers ( rs6693503 and rs1805054 ) and three markers ( rs6693503 , rs1805054 and rs4912138 ) in
Drugs: 
Sentence: htr6 and meth - induced psychosis patients , respectively .
Drugs: meth
Sentence: conclusion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: htr6 may play an important role in the pathophysiology of meth - induced psychosis in the japanese population .
Drugs: meth
Sentence: effect of increasing intraperitoneal infusion rates on bupropion hydrochloride - induced seizures in mice .
Drugs: bupropionhydrochloride, hydrochloride
Sentence: background : it is not known if there is a relationship between input rate and incidence of bupropion - induced seizures .
Drugs: bupropion
Sentence: this is important , since different controlled release formulations of bupropion release the active drug at different rates .
Drugs: bupropion
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: we investigated the effect of varying the intraperitoneal infusion rates of bupropion hcl 120 mg / kg , a known convulsive dose 50 ( cd50 ) , on the incidence
Drugs: bupropionhcl, hcl
Sentence: and severity of bupropion - induced convulsions in the swiss albino mice .
Drugs: bupropion
Sentence: a total of 69 mice , approximately 7 weeks of age , and weighing 21 . 0 to 29 . 1 g were randomly assigned to bupropion hcl 120 mg
Drugs: bupropionhcl, hcl
Sentence: / kg treatment by intraperitoneal ( ip ) administration in 7 groups ( 9 to 10 animals per group ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: bupropion hcl was infused through a surgically implanted ip dosing catheter with infusions in each group of 0 min , 15 min , 30 min , 60 min , 90
Drugs: bupropionhcl, hcl
Sentence: min , 120 min , and 240 min .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the number , time of onset , duration and the intensity of the convulsions or absence of convulsions were recorded .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the results showed that ip administration of bupropion hcl 120 mg / kg by bolus injection induced convulsions in 6 out of 10 mice ( 60 % of convulsing mice
Drugs: bupropionhcl, hcl
Sentence: ) in group 1 .
Drugs: 
Sentence: logistic regression analysis revealed that infusion time was significant ( p = 0 . 0004 ; odds ratio = 0 . 974 ) and increasing the ip infusion time of
Drugs: 
Sentence: bupropion hcl 120 mg / kg was associated with a 91 % reduced odds of convulsions at infusion times of 15 to 90 min compared to bolus injection .
Drugs: bupropionhcl, hcl
Sentence: further increase in infusion time resulted in further reduction in the odds of convulsions to 99 . 8 % reduction at 240 min .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: in conclusion , the demonstration of an inverse relationship between infusion time of a fixed and convulsive dose of bupropion and the risk of convulsions in a prospective study is
Drugs: bupropion
Sentence: novel .

Sentence: detailed spectral profile analysis of penicillin - induced epileptiform activity in anesthetized rats .
Drugs: penicillin
Sentence: penicillin model is a widely used experimental model for epilepsy research .
Drugs: penicillin
Sentence: in the present study we aimed to portray a detailed spectral analysis of penicillin - induced epileptiform activity in comparison with basal brain activity in anesthetized wistar rats .
Drugs: penicillin
Sentence: male wistar rats were anesthetized with i . p .
Drugs: 
Sentence: urethane and connected to an electrocorticogram setup .
Drugs: urethane
Sentence: after a short period of basal activity recording , epileptic focus was induced by injecting 400iu / 2 microl penicillin - g potassium into the left lateral ventricle while the
Drugs: penicillin-gpotassium, potassium
Sentence: cortical activity was continuously recorded .
Drugs: 
Sentence: basal activity , latent period and the penicillin - induced epileptiform activity periods were then analyzed using both conventional methods and spectral analysis .
Drugs: penicillin
Sentence: spectral analyses were conducted by dividing the whole spectrum into different frequency bands including delta , theta ( slow and fast ) , alpha - sigma , beta ( 1
Drugs: 
Sentence: and 2 ) and gamma ( 1 and 2 ) bands .
Drugs: 
Sentence: our results show that the most affected frequency bands were delta , theta , beta - 2 and gamma - 2 bands during the epileptiform activity and there were marked
Drugs: 
Sentence: differences in terms of spectral densities between three investigated episodes ( basal activity , latent period and epileptiform activity ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: our results may help to analyze novel data obtained using similar experimental models and the simple analysis method described here can be used in similar studies to investigate the basic
Drugs: 
Sentence: neuronal mechanism of this or other types of experimental epilepsies .

Sentence: high dose dexmedetomidine as the sole sedative for pediatric mri .
Drugs: dexmedetomidine
Sentence: objective :
Drugs: 
Sentence: this large - scale retrospective review evaluates the sedation profile of dexmedetomidine .
Drugs: dexmedetomidine
Sentence: aim :
Drugs: 
Sentence: to determine the hemodynamic responses , efficacy and adverse events associated with the use of high dose dexmedetomidine as the sole sedative for magnetic resonance imaging ( mri ) studies
Drugs: dexmedetomidine
Sentence: .
Drugs: 
Sentence: background :
Drugs: 
Sentence: dexmedetomidine has been used at our institution since 2005 to provide sedation for pediatric radiological imaging studies .
Drugs: dexmedetomidine
Sentence: over time , an effective protocol utilizing high dose dexmedetomidine as the sole sedative agent has evolved .
Drugs: dexmedetomidine
Sentence: methods / materials :
Drugs: 
Sentence: as part of the ongoing quality assurance process , data on all sedations are reviewed monthly and protocols modified as needed .
Drugs: 
Sentence: data were analyzed from all 747 consecutive patients who received dexmedetomidine for mri sedation from april 2005 to april 2007 .
Drugs: dexmedetomidine
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: since 2005 , the 10 - min loading dose of our dexmedetomidine protocol increased from 2 to 3 microg . kg ( - 1 ) , and the infusion rate
Drugs: dexmedetomidine
Sentence: increased from 1 to 1 . 5 to 2 microg . kg ( - 1 ) . h ( - 1 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the current sedation protocol progressively increased the rate of successful sedation ( able to complete the imaging study ) when using dexmedetomidine alone from 91 . 8 % to 97
Drugs: dexmedetomidine
Sentence: . 6 % ( p = 0 . 009 ) , reducing the requirement for adjuvant pentobarbital in the event of sedation failure with dexmedetomidine alone and decreased the mean
Drugs: pentobarbital, dexmedetomidine
Sentence: recovery time by 10 min ( p < 0 . 001 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: although dexmedetomidine sedation was associated with a 16 % incidence of bradycardia , all concomitant mean arterial blood pressures were within 20 % of age - adjusted normal range and
Drugs: dexmedetomidine
Sentence: oxygen saturations were 95 % or higher .
Drugs: oxygen
Sentence: conclusion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: dexmedetomidine in high doses provides adequate sedation for pediatric mri studies .
Drugs: dexmedetomidine
Sentence: while use of high dose dexmedetomidine is associated with decreases in heart rate and blood pressure outside the established ' awake ' norms , this deviation is generally within 20
Drugs: dexmedetomidine
Sentence: % of norms , and is not associated with adverse sequelae .
Drugs: 
Sentence: dexmedetomidine is useful as the sole sedative for pediatric mri .
Drugs: dexmedetomidine
Sentence: methamphetamine causes alterations in the map kinase - related pathways in the brains of mice that display increased aggressiveness .
Drugs: methamphetamine
Sentence: aggressive behaviors have been reported in patients who suffer from some psychiatric disorders , and are common in methamphetamine ( meth ) abusers .
Drugs: methamphetamine, meth
Sentence: herein , we report that multiple ( but not single ) injections of meth significantly increased aggressiveness in male cd - 1 mice .
Drugs: meth
Sentence: this increase in aggressiveness was not secondary to meth - induced hyperactivity .
Drugs: meth
Sentence: analysis of protein expression using antibody microarrays and western blotting revealed differential changes in map kinase - related pathways after multiple and single meth injections .
Drugs: meth
Sentence: there were statistically significant ( p < 0 . 05 ) decreases in mek1 , erk2p , gsk3alpha , 14 - 3 - 3e , and mek7 in the striata
Drugs: 
Sentence: of mice after multiple injections of meth .
Drugs: meth
Sentence: mek1 was significantly decreased also after a single injection of meth , but to a much lesser degree than after multiple injections of meth .
Drugs: meth, meth
Sentence: in the frontal cortex , there was a statistically significant decrease in gsk3alpha after multiple ( but not single ) injections of meth .
Drugs: meth
Sentence: these findings suggest that alterations in map kinase - related pathways in the prefronto - striatal circuitries might be involved in the manifestation of aggressive behaviors in mice .

Sentence: assessment of the onset and persistence of amnesia during procedural sedation with propofol .
Drugs: propofol
Sentence: objectives :
Drugs: 
Sentence: to assess patients ' ability to repeat and recall words presented to them while undergoing procedural sedation with propofol , and correlate their recall with their level of awareness as
Drugs: propofol
Sentence: measured by bispectral index ( bis ) monitoring .
Drugs: 
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: this was a prospective , single - intervention study of consenting adult patients undergoing procedural sedation with propofol between december 28 , 2002 , and october 31 , 2003 .
Drugs: propofol
Sentence: bis monitoring was initiated starting 3 minutes before the procedure and continuing until the patient had regained baseline mental status .
Drugs: 
Sentence: at 1 - minute intervals during the procedural sedation , until the patient regained baseline mental status at the end of the procedure , a word from a standardized list
Drugs: 
Sentence: was read aloud , and the patient was asked to immediately repeat the word to the investigator .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the bis score at the time the word was read and the patient 's ability to repeat the word were recorded .
Drugs: 
Sentence: after the procedure , the patient was asked to state all of the words from the list that he or she could recall , and to identify the last word
Drugs: 
Sentence: recalled from prior to the start of the procedure and the first word recalled from after the procedure was completed .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: seventy - five consenting patients were enrolled ; one patient was excluded from data analysis for a protocol violation .
Drugs: 
Sentence: no serious adverse events were noted during the procedural sedations .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the mean ( + / - standard deviation ) time of data collection was 16 . 4 minutes ( + / - 7 . 1 ; range 5 to 34
Drugs: 
Sentence: minutes ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the mean initial ( preprocedure ) bis score was 97 . 1 ( + / - 2 . 3 ; range 92 to 99 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the mean lowest bis score occurring during these procedural sedations was 66 . 9 ( + / - 14 . 4 ; range 33 to 91 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the mean lowest bis score corresponding to the ability of the patient to immediately repeat words read from the list was 77 . 1 ( 95 % ci = 74
Drugs: 
Sentence: . 3 to 80 . 0 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the mean highest bis score corresponding to the inability to repeat words was 81 . 5 ( 95 % ci = 78 . 1 to 84 . 8 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the mean bis score corresponding to the last word recalled from prior to the initiation of the sedation was 96 . 7 ( + / - 2 . 4 ;
Drugs: 
Sentence: range 84 to 98 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the mean bis score corresponding to the first word recalled after the procedure was completed was 91 . 2 ( 95 % ci = 88 . 1 to 94 .
Drugs: 
Sentence: 3 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: all patients recalled at least one word that had been read to them during the protocol .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the mean lowest bis score for any recalled word was 91 . 5 ( + / - 11 . 1 ; range 79 to 98 ) , and no words
Drugs: 
Sentence: were recalled when the corresponding bis score was less than 90 .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: there is a range of bis scores during which sedated patients are able to repeat words read to them but are not able to subsequently recall these words .
Drugs: 
Sentence: furthermore , patients had no recall of words repeated prior to procedural sedation in bis ranges associated with recall after procedural sedation , suggestive of retrograde amnesia .

Sentence: assessment of perinatal hepatitis b and rubella prevention in new hampshire delivery hospitals .
Drugs: 
Sentence: objective :
Drugs: 
Sentence: to evaluate current performance on recommended perinatal hepatitis b and rubella prevention practices in new hampshire .
Drugs: 
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: data were extracted from 2021 paired mother - infant records for the year 2000 birth cohort in new hampshire 's 25 delivery hospitals .
Drugs: 
Sentence: assessment was done on the following : prenatal screening for hepatitis b and rubella , administration of the hepatitis b vaccine birth dose to all infants , administration of hepatitis
Drugs: 
Sentence: b immune globulin to infants who were born to hepatitis b surface antigen - positive mothers , rubella immunity , and administration of in - hospital postpartum rubella vaccine to
Drugs: hepatitisbsurfaceantigen, antigen
Sentence: rubella nonimmune women .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: prenatal screening rates for hepatitis b ( 98 . 8 % ) and rubella ( 99 . 4 % ) were high .
Drugs: 
Sentence: hepatitis b vaccine birth dose was administered to 76 . 2 % of all infants .
Drugs: 
Sentence: all infants who were born to hepatitis b surface antigen - positive mothers also received hepatitis b immune globulin .
Drugs: hepatitisbsurfaceantigen, antigen
Sentence: multivariate logistic regression showed that the month of delivery and infant birth weight were independent predictors of hepatitis b vaccination .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the proportion of infants who were vaccinated in january and february 2000 ( 48 . 5 % and 67 . 5 % , respectively ) was less than any other
Drugs: 
Sentence: months , whereas the proportion who were vaccinated in december 2000 ( 88 . 2 % ) was the highest .
Drugs: 
Sentence: women who were born between 1971 and 1975 had the highest rate of rubella nonimmunity ( 9 . 5 % ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in - hospital postpartum rubella vaccine administration was documented for 75 . 6 % of nonimmune women .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: this study documents good compliance in new hampshire 's birthing hospitals with national guidelines for perinatal hepatitis b and rubella prevention and highlights potential areas for improvement .

Sentence: expression of p300 protects cardiac myocytes from apoptosis in vivo .
Drugs: 
Sentence: doxorubicin is an anti - tumor agent that represses cardiac - specific gene expression and induces myocardial cell apoptosis .
Drugs: doxorubicin
Sentence: doxorubicin depletes cardiac p300 , a transcriptional coactivator that is required for the maintenance of the differentiated phenotype of cardiac myocytes .
Drugs: doxorubicin
Sentence: however , the role of p300 in protection against doxorubicin - induced apoptosis is unknown .
Drugs: doxorubicin
Sentence: transgenic mice overexpressing p300 in the heart and wild - type mice were subjected to doxorubicin treatment .
Drugs: doxorubicin
Sentence: compared with wild - type mice , transgenic mice exhibited higher survival rate as well as more preserved left ventricular function and cardiac expression of alpha - sarcomeric actin .
Drugs: 
Sentence: doxorubicin induced myocardial cell apoptosis in wild - type mice but not in transgenic mice .
Drugs: doxorubicin

Drugs: 
Sentence: .
Drugs: 
Sentence: these findings demonstrate that overexpression of p300 protects cardiac myocytes from doxorubicin - induced apoptosis and reduces the extent of acute heart failure in adult mice in vivo .

Sentence: mitochondrial dna and its respiratory chain products are defective in doxorubicin nephrosis .
Drugs: doxorubicin
Sentence: background :
Drugs: 
Sentence: doxorubicin induces a self - perpetuating nephropathy characterized by early glomerular and late - onset tubular lesions in rats .
Drugs: doxorubicin
Sentence: we investigated the potential role of mitochondrial injury in the onset of these lesions .
Drugs: 
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: rats were treated with intravenous doxorubicin ( 1 mg kg ( - 1 ) week ( - 1 ) ) for 7 weeks and were sacrificed either 1 week (
Drugs: doxorubicin
Sentence: ' short - term ' ) or 30 weeks ( ' long - term ' ) following the last dose .
Drugs: 
Sentence: additional rats received a single dose either 6 days or 2 h prior to euthanasia .
Drugs: 
Sentence: all rats were killed at 48 weeks of age .
Drugs: 
Sentence: glomerular and tubular injury was monitored and correlated to the activity or expression of respiratory chain components .
Drugs: 
Sentence: finally , we quantified both nuclear and mitochondrial dna ( mtdna ) as well as superoxide production and the 4834 base pair ' common ' mtdna deletion .
Drugs: superoxide
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the ' long - term ' group had significant glomerular and tubular lesions , depressed activities of mtdna - encoded nadh dehydrogenase and cytochrome - c oxidase ( cox )
Drugs: 
Sentence: and increased citrate synthase activity .
Drugs: citrate
Sentence: in addition , expression of the mtdna - encoded cox subunit i was reduced and mtdna levels were decreased .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in ' short - term ' rats , there were fewer tubular lesions , but similar numbers of glomerular lesions activity .
Drugs: 
Sentence: among all animals , glomerular and tubular injury were inversely correlated with mtdna levels , mtdna - encoded respiratory chain activities and with the expression of the mtdna - encoded
Drugs: 
Sentence: respiratory chain subunit cox - i . injury was positively correlated with superoxide production and the activities of nucleus - encoded mitochondrial or cytoplasmic enzymes .
Drugs: superoxide
Sentence: kidneys from the ' long - term ' group showed more mtdna deletions than in ' short - term ' animals and these were not observed in the other groups
Drugs: 
Sentence: .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: these results suggest an important role for quantitative and qualitative mtdna alterations through the reduction of mtdna - encoded respiratory chain function and induction of superoxide in doxorubicin - induced
Drugs: superoxide, doxorubicin

Sentence: stopped and the drug concentrations decreased with time .

Drugs: phenytoinb, b

Drugs: 
Sentence: aids and cryptococcal meningitis , both of which the patient had , can potentially cause seizures .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the patient had a history of alcohol abuse ; alcohol intake as well as withdrawal can also cause seizures .
Drugs: alcohol
Sentence: didanosine also has a potential for inducing seizures .
Drugs: didanosine
Sentence: however , these other potential causes of seizure were ruled out .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the time course of events suggested that amphotericin b was the cause of the seizures in this aids patient .
Drugs: amphotericinb, b
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: amphotericin b seems to be the probable cause of the seizures .
Drugs: amphotericinb, b
Sentence: to date , only three cases of seizures associated with amphotericin b have been reported in the literature , but healthcare providers should be aware of the potential for this
Drugs: amphotericinb, b

Sentence: patients undergoing treatment with i . v .
Drugs: 
Sentence: tobramycin ( 4 mg / kg / day ) were randomised to two groups .
Drugs: tobramycin
Sentence: group od ( n = 22 ) received a once - daily dose of tobramycin and group td ( n = 21 ) received the same dose divided into two
Drugs: tobramycin
Sentence: doses daily .
Drugs: 
Sentence: tobramycin serum concentrations ( peak and trough ) were measured by enzyme multiplied immunoassay .
Drugs: tobramycin
Sentence: the renal and auditory functions of the patients were monitored before , during and immediately after treatment .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the two groups were comparable with respect to sex , age , body weight and renal function .
Drugs: 
Sentence: no statistically significant differences were found in mean daily dose , duration of treatment , or cumulative dose .
Drugs: 
Sentence: trough concentrations were < 2 g / ml in the two groups ( 100 % ) .

Sentence: peak concentrations were > 6 microg / ml in 100 % of the od group and in 67 % of the td group ( p < 0 . 01 )
Drugs: 
Sentence: .
Drugs: 
Sentence: mean peak concentrations were markedly different :
Drugs: 
Sentence: 11 . 00 + / - 2 . 89 microg / ml in od vs . 6 . 53 + / - 1 . 45 microg / ml in td
Drugs: 
Sentence: ( p < 0 . 01 ) .

Sentence: the pharmacokinetics parameters were : ke , ( 0 . 15 + / - 0 . 03 / h in od vs . 0 . 24 + / - 0
Drugs: 
Sentence: . 06 / h in td ) , t1 / 2 , ( 4 . 95 + / - 1 . 41 h in od vs . 3 . 07
Drugs: 
Sentence: + / - 0 . 71 h in td ) , vd ( 0 . 35 + / - 0 . 11 l / kg in od vs . 0
Drugs: 
Sentence: . 33 + / - 0 . 09 l / kg in td ) , cl ( 0 . 86 + / - 0 . 29 ml / min /
Drugs: 
Sentence: kg in od vs . 1 . 28 + / - 0 . 33 ml / min / kg in td ) .

Drugs: creatinine

Drugs: 
Sentence: one patient presented decreased auditory function .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: this small study suggests that a once - daily dosing regimen of tobramycin is at least as effective as and is no more and possibly less toxic than the twice
Drugs: tobramycin
Sentence: - daily regimen .
Drugs: 
Sentence: using a single - dose therapy , peak concentration determination is not necessary , only trough samples should be monitored to ensure levels below 2 microg / ml .

Sentence: on - period score for ipsilateral dyskinesias , 44 percent ( 95 percent confidence interval , 29 to 59 percent ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the improvements in dyskinesias and the total scores for off - period parkinsonism , contralateral bradykinesia , and rigidity were sustained in the 11 patients examined at two years .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the improvement in ipsilateral dyskinesias was lost after one year , and the improvements in postural stability and gait lasted only three to six months .
Drugs: 
Sentence: approximately half the patients who had been dependent on assistance in activities of daily living in the off period before surgery became independent after surgery .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the complications of surgery were generally well tolerated , and there were no significant changes in the use of medication .

Sentence: conclusions :

Sentence: neuropeptide - y immunoreactivity in the pilocarpine model of temporal lobe epilepsy .
Drugs: pilocarpine
Sentence: neuropeptide - y ( npy ) is expressed by granule cells and mossy fibres of the hippocampal dentate gyrus during experimental temporal lobe epilepsy ( tle ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: this expression may represent an endogenous damping mechanism since npy has been shown to block seizure - like events following high - frequency stimulation in hippocampal slices .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the pilocarpine ( pilo ) model of epilepsy is characterized by an acute period of status epilepticus followed by spontaneous recurrent seizures and related brain damage .
Drugs: pilocarpine, pilo

Drugs: 
Sentence: pilo - injected animals exhibited npy immunoreactivity in the region of the mossy fibre terminals , in the dentate gyrus inner molecular layer and , in a few cases ,
Drugs: pilo
Sentence: within presumed granule cells .
Drugs: 
Sentence: npy immunoreactivity was also dramatically changed in the entorhinal cortex , amygdala and sensorimotor areas .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in addition , pilo injected animals exhibited a reduction in the number of npy - immunoreactive interneurons compared with controls .
Drugs: pilo
Sentence: the results demonstrate that changes in npy expression , including expression in the granule cells and mossy fibres and the loss of vulnerable npy neurons , are present in the
Drugs: 
Sentence: pilo model of tle .
Drugs: pilo
Sentence: however , the significance of this changed synthesis of npy remains to be determined .

Sentence: results :

Sentence: no statistically significant differences were seen between treated and control eyes nor between treated eyes preoperatively and postoperatively .

Drugs: thallium

Drugs: 
Sentence: during a transient ( 20 - s ) coronary occlusion , a perfusion defect was observed with contrast echocardiography in 14 of the 15 dogs in which the occlusion was
Drugs: 
Sentence: produced .
Drugs:

Drugs: dipyridamole

Drugs: 
Sentence: ; p less than 0 . 03 ) .

Drugs: bupropion, carbimazole
Sentence: objective :
Drugs: 
Sentence: to report a case of fatal liver failure possibly associated with concurrent use of bupropion and carbimazole .
Drugs: bupropion, carbimazole
Sentence: case summary :
Drugs: 
Sentence: a 41 - year - old chinese man with a history of hyperthyroidism had been treated with carbimazole and propranolol for the past 5 years .
Drugs: carbimazole, propranolol
Sentence: he received a 10 - day course of bupropion as an aid for smoking cessation 10 weeks prior to presentation .
Drugs: bupropion
Sentence: he developed acute liver failure with rapid deterioration of renal function .
Drugs: 
Sentence: liver biopsy showed evidence of nonspecific drug - induced acute liver injury .
Drugs: 
Sentence: his condition was further complicated by sepsis and coagulopathy .
Drugs: 
Sentence: death resulted 19 days after the onset of symptoms .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the likelihood that bupropion induced hepatotoxicity in our patient was possible , based on the naranjo probability scale .
Drugs: bupropion
Sentence: discussion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: although there is increasing evidence of hepatotoxicity induced by bupropion , this is the first case of fatality that could have resulted from acute liver failure in a patient receiving
Drugs: bupropion
Sentence: bupropion while on concomitant treatment with carbimazole .
Drugs: bupropion, carbimazole
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: clinicians should be aware of the possibility of acute liver insult induced by bupropion given concurrently with other hepatotoxic drugs .
Drugs: bupropion
Sentence: long term hormone therapy for perimenopausal and postmenopausal women .
Drugs: 
Sentence: background :
Drugs: 
Sentence: hormone therapy ( ht ) is widely used for controlling menopausal symptoms and has also been used for the management and prevention of cardiovascular disease , osteoporosis and dementia in
Drugs: 
Sentence: older women .
Drugs: 
Sentence: this is an updated version of the original cochrane review first published in 2005 .
Drugs: 
Sentence: objectives :
Drugs: 
Sentence: to assess the effect of long - term ht on mortality , cardiovascular outcomes , cancer , gallbladder disease , cognition , fractures and quality of life .
Drugs: 
Sentence: search strategy :
Drugs: 
Sentence: we searched the following databases to november 2007 : trials register of the cochrane menstrual disorders and subfertility group , cochrane central register of controlled trials , medline , embase
Drugs: 
Sentence: , biological abstracts .
Drugs: 
Sentence: also relevant non - indexed journals and conference abstracts .
Drugs: 
Sentence: selection criteria :
Drugs: 
Sentence: randomised double - blind trials of ht versus placebo , taken for at least one year by perimenopausal or postmenopausal women .
Drugs: 
Sentence: ht included oestrogens , with or without progestogens , via oral , transdermal , subcutaneous or transnasal routes .
Drugs: oestrogens, progestogens
Sentence: data collection and analysis :
Drugs: 
Sentence: two authors independently assessed trial quality and extracted data .
Drugs: 
Sentence: main results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: nineteen trials involving 41 , 904 women were included .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in relatively healthy women , combined continuous ht significantly increased the risk of venous thrombo - embolism or coronary event ( after one year 's use ) , stroke (
Drugs: 
Sentence: after three years ) , breast cancer and gallbladder disease .
Drugs: 
Sentence: long - term oestrogen - only ht significantly increased the risk of venous thrombo - embolism , stroke and gallbladder disease ( after one to two years , three years
Drugs: oestrogen
Sentence: and seven years ' use respectively ) , but did not significantly increase the risk of breast cancer .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the only statistically significant benefits of ht were a decreased incidence of fractures and ( for combined ht ) colon cancer , with long - term use .
Drugs: 
Sentence: among women aged over 65 who were relatively healthy ( i . e . generally fit , without overt disease ) and taking continuous combined ht , there was a
Drugs: 
Sentence: statistically significant increase in the incidence of dementia .
Drugs: 
Sentence: among women with cardiovascular disease , long - term use of combined continuous ht significantly increased the risk of venous thrombo - embolism .
Drugs: 
Sentence: one trial analysed subgroups of 2839 relatively healthy 50 to 59 year old women taking combined continuous ht and 1637 taking oestrogen - only ht , versus similar - sized
Drugs: oestrogen
Sentence: placebo groups .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the only significantly increased risk reported was for venous thrombo - embolism in women taking combined continuous ht : their absolute risk remained low , at less than 1 /
Drugs: 
Sentence: 500 .
Drugs: 
Sentence: however , this study was not powered to detect differences between groups of younger women .
Drugs: 
Sentence: authors ' conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: ht is not indicated for the routine management of chronic disease .
Drugs: 
Sentence: we need more evidence on the safety of ht for menopausal symptom control , though short - term use appears to be relatively safe for healthy younger women .
Drugs: 
Sentence: passage of mannitol into the brain around gliomas : a potential cause of rebound phenomenon .
Drugs: mannitol
Sentence: a study on 21 patients .
Drugs: 
Sentence: aim :
Drugs: 
Sentence: widespread use of mannitol to reduce brain edema and lower elevated icp in brain tumor patients continues to be afflicted by the so - called rebound phenomenon .
Drugs: mannitol
Sentence: leakage of mannitol into the brain parenchyma through an altered bbb and secondary reversal of osmotic gradient is considered the major cause of rebound .
Drugs: mannitol
Sentence: this has only been demonstrated experimentally in animals .
Drugs: 
Sentence: as a contribution to this issue we decided to research the possible passage of mannitol into the brain after administration to 21 brain tumor patients .
Drugs: mannitol
Sentence: methods : mannitol ( 18 % solution ; 1 g / kg ) was administered as a bolus to patients ( ten had malignant glioma , seven brain metastases and
Drugs: mannitol
Sentence: four meningioma ) about 30 minutes before craniotomy .
Drugs: 
Sentence: during resection , a sample of the surrounding edematous white matter was taken at the same time as a 10 ml venous blood sample .
Drugs: 
Sentence: mannitol concentrations were measured in plasma and white matter by a modified version of the enzyme assay of blonquist et al .
Drugs: mannitol
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: in most glioma patients , mannitol concentrations in white matter were 2 to 6 times higher than in plasma ( mean 3 . 5 times ) .
Drugs: mannitol
Sentence: in meningioma and metastases patients plasma concentrations of mannitol were higher than white matter concentrations except in three cases with infiltration by neoplastic cells .
Drugs: mannitol
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the results of our study show that even after a single bolus , mannitol may leak through the altered bbb near gliomas , reversing the initial plasma - to -
Drugs: mannitol
Sentence: blood osmotic gradient , aggravating peritumoral edema and promoting rebound of icp .
Drugs: 
Sentence: can lidocaine reduce succinylcholine induced postoperative myalgia ?
Drugs: lidocaine, succinylcholine
Sentence: this study was undertaken to determine the effect of lidocaine pretreatment on reduction of succinylcholine - induced myalgia in patients undergoing general anesthesia for gynecological surgery .
Drugs: lidocaine, succinylcholine
Sentence: one hundred and thirty - five patients were assigned to one of three groups in a prospective , double blind , randomized manner .
Drugs: 
Sentence: group ps , the control group , received normal saline and succinylcholine 1 . 5 mg x kg ( - 1 ) ; group ls , lidocaine 1 . 5
Drugs: succinylcholine, lidocaine
Sentence: mg x kg ( - 1 ) and succinylcholine 1 . 5 mg x kg ( - 1 ) ; group pr , normal saline and rocuronium 0 . 6
Drugs: succinylcholine, rocuronium
Sentence: mg x kg ( - 1 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: morphine 0 . 1
Drugs: morphine
Sentence: mg x kg ( - 1 )
Drugs: 
Sentence: iv was given for premedication and all patients were monitored with a noninvasive blood pressure monitor , ecg and pulse oximetry .
Drugs: 
Sentence: anesthesia was induced with 5 mg . kg ( - 1 ) thiopental iv .
Drugs: thiopental
Sentence: followed by succinylcholine ( group ps , ls ) or rocuronium ( group pr ) for tracheal intubation .
Drugs: succinylcholine, rocuronium
Sentence: following administration of these agents , the presence , and degree of fasciculation were assessed visually on a four point scale by one investigator who was blinded to the drug
Drugs: 
Sentence: administered .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the blood pressure and heart rate of each patient were monitored on nine occasions .
Drugs: 
Sentence: twenty - four hours later , any myalgia experienced was assessed according to a structured questionaire and graded by a four point scale by one investigator blinded to the intraoperative
Drugs: 
Sentence: management .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the results indicate that muscle fasciculation was not found in group pr while the patients in group ls had a lower incidence of muscle fasciculation than those in group ps
Drugs: 
Sentence: ( p < 0 . 001 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: at 24 h , the incidence of myalgia was higher in group ps than in group ls and pr ( p < 0 . 05 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: a correlation was not found between the incidence of myalgia and the occurrence of muscle fasciculation .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the changes in systolic and diastolic blood pressure and heart rate were not significant among the three groups .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in conclusion , where succinylcholine is used , lidocaine is proven to be the useful pretreatment agent for the reduction of postoperative myalgia .
Drugs: succinylcholine, lidocaine
Sentence: open - label assessment of levofloxacin for the treatment of acute bacterial sinusitis in adults .
Drugs: levofloxacin
Sentence: purpose :
Drugs: 
Sentence: to evaluate the efficacy and safety of levofloxacin ( 500 mg orally once daily for 10 to 14 days ) in treating adult outpatients with acute bacterial sinusitis .
Drugs: levofloxacin
Sentence: patients and methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: a total of 329 patients enrolled in the study at 24 centers .
Drugs: 
Sentence: all patients had a pre - therapy gram 's stain and culture of sinus exudate obtained by antral puncture or nasal endoscopy .
Drugs: 
Sentence: clinical response was assessed on the basis of signs and symptoms and sinus radiograph or computed tomography results .
Drugs: 
Sentence: microbiologic cure rates were determined on the basis of presumed plus documented eradication of the pre - therapy pathogen ( s ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the most common pathogens were haemophilus influenzae , streptococcus pneumoniae , staphylococcus aureus , and moraxella catarrhalis .
Drugs: 
Sentence: of 300 clinically evaluable patients , 175 ( 58 % ) were cured and 90 ( 30 % ) were improved at the post - therapy evaluation , resulting in
Drugs: 
Sentence: a clinical success rate of 88 % .
Drugs: 
Sentence: thirty - five patients ( 12 % ) clinically failed treatment .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the microbiologic eradication rate ( presumed plus documented ) among 138 microbiologically evaluable patients was 92 % .
Drugs: 
Sentence: microbiologic eradication rates ( presumed plus documented ) of the most common pathogens ranged from 93 % ( m . catarrhalis ) to 100 % ( s . pneumoniae )
Drugs: 
Sentence: at the post - therapy visit .
Drugs:

Drugs: diclofenac

Drugs: etoricoxib, diclofenac
Sentence: conclusions :

Drugs: etoricoxib, diclofenac
Sentence: discontinuations from renovascular aes , although less common than discontinuations from gi aes , were significantly higher with etoricoxib .

Sentence: pemoline induced acute choreoathetosis : case report and review of the literature .
Drugs: pemoline
Sentence: background : pemoline is an oxazolidine derivative that is structurally different from amphetamines and used in the treatment of attention deficit disorder .
Drugs: pemoline, oxazolidine, amphetamines
Sentence: pemoline has not been commonly associated in the literature as a cause of acute movement disorders .
Drugs: pemoline
Sentence: the following case describes two children acutely poisoned with pemoline who experienced profound choreoathetosis .
Drugs: pemoline
Sentence: case report :
Drugs: 
Sentence: two , 3 - year - old male , identical twin siblings presented to the emergency department after found playing with a an empty bottle of pemoline originally containing 59
Drugs: pemoline
Sentence: tablets .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the children had a medical history significant for attention deficit disorder previously treated with methylphenidate without success .
Drugs: methylphenidate
Sentence: this was their first day of pemoline therapy .
Drugs: pemoline
Sentence: the choreoathetoid movements began 45 min to 1 h after ingestion .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the children gave no history of prior movement disorders and there was no family history of movement disorders .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the children received gastrointestinal decontamination and high doses of intravenous benzodiazepines in an attempt to control the choreoathetoid movements .
Drugs: benzodiazepines
Sentence: despite treatment , the children continued to have choreoathetosis for approximately 24 hours .
Drugs: 
Sentence: forty - eight hours after admission , the children appeared to be at their baseline and were discharged home .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: pemoline associated movement disorder has been rarely reported in the acute toxicology literature .
Drugs: pemoline
Sentence: the possibility of choreoathetoid movements should be considered in patients presenting after pemoline overdose .
Drugs: pemoline

Drugs: mesna

Sentence: modification of drug action by hyperammonemia .
Drugs: 
Sentence: pretreatment with ammonium acetate ( nh4ac ) ( 6 mmol / kg s . c . ) approximately doubled the time morphine - treated mice remained on a hot surface
Drugs: ammoniumacetate, acetate, nh4ac, morphine
Sentence: and similarly increased muscular incoordination by diazepam , but nh4ac treatment alone had no effect .
Drugs: diazepam, nh4ac
Sentence: thus , hyperammonemia is capable of altering drug action and must be considered along with impaired drug metabolism in enhanced drug responses associated with liver disease .

Drugs: acetylcholine, catecholamine, nh4ac, kcl
Sentence: induced contractions of guinea - pig ileum were inhibited 20 % by 5 mm nh4ac .

Sentence: addition of excess calcium reversed the depression in both tissues , but calcium - independent catecholamine release by acetaldehyde was not blocked by nh4ac .
Drugs: calcium, calcium, catecholamine, acetaldehyde, nh4ac
Sentence: these results suggested that ammonia blocks calcium channels .
Drugs: ammonia, calcium

Sentence: and nh4ac pretreatment enhanced morphine

Drugs: diazepam, amphetamine, verapamil, nh4ac, metrazol

Drugs: calcium

Sentence: optical coherence tomography can measure axonal loss in patients with ethambutol - induced optic neuropathy .
Drugs: ethambutol
Sentence: purpose :
Drugs: 
Sentence: to map and identify the pattern , in vivo , of axonal degeneration in ethambutol - induced optic neuropathy using optical coherence tomography ( oct ) .
Drugs: ethambutol
Sentence: ethambutol is an antimycobacterial agent often used to treat tuberculosis .
Drugs: ethambutol
Sentence: a serious complication of ethambutol is an optic neuropathy that impairs visual acuity , contrast sensitivity , and color vision .
Drugs: ethambutol
Sentence: however , early on , when the toxic optic neuropathy is mild and partly reversible , the funduscopic findings are often subtle and easy to miss .
Drugs: 
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: three subjects with a history of ethambutol ( emb ) - induced optic neuropathy of short - , intermediate - , and long - term visual deficits were administered a
Drugs: ethambutol, emb
Sentence: full neuro - ophthalmologic examination including visual acuity , color vision , contrast sensitivity , and fundus examination .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in addition , oct ( oct 3000 , humphrey - zeiss , dublin , ca ) was performed on both eyes of each subject using the retinal nerve fiber layer
Drugs: 
Sentence: ( rnfl ) analysis protocol .
Drugs: 
Sentence: oct interpolates data from 100 points around the optic nerve to effectively map out the rnfl .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the results were compared to the calculated average rnfl of normal eyes accumulated from four prior studies using oct , n = 661 .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in all subjects with history of emb - induced optic neuropathy , there was a mean loss of 72 % nerve fiber layer thickness in the temporal quadrant ( patient
Drugs: emb
Sentence: a , with eventual recovery of visual acuity and fields , 58 % loss ; patient b , with intermediate visual deficits , 68 % loss ; patient c ,
Drugs: 
Sentence: with chronic visual deficits , 90 % loss ) , with an average mean optic nerve thickness of 26 + / - 16 microm .
Drugs: 
Sentence: there was a combined mean loss of 46 % of fibers from the superior , inferior , and nasal quadrants in the ( six ) eyes of all three subjects
Drugs: 
Sentence: ( mean average thickness of 55 + / - 29 microm ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in both sets ( four ) of eyes of the subjects with persistent visual deficits ( patients b and c ) , there was an average loss of 79 %
Drugs: 
Sentence: of nerve fiber thickness in the temporal quadrant .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the oct results in these patients with emb - induced optic neuropathy show considerable loss especially of the temporal fibers .
Drugs: emb
Sentence: this is consistent with prior histopathological studies that show predominant loss of parvo - cellular axons ( or small - caliber axons ) within the papillo - macular bundle in
Drugs: 
Sentence: toxic or hereditary optic neuropathies .
Drugs: 
Sentence: oct can be a valuable tool in the quantitative analysis of optic neuropathies .
Drugs: 
Sentence: additionally , in terms of management of emb - induced optic neuropathy , it is important to properly manage ethambutol dosing in patients with renal impairment and to achieve proper
Drugs: emb, ethambutol
Sentence: transition to a maintenance dose once an appropriate loading dose has been reached .

Sentence: kg for lidocaine , and 243 . 4 and 266 . 5 mg / kg for chloroprocaine .

Sentence: the inferior colliculus ( ic ) is primarily involved in the processing of auditory information , but it is distinguished from other auditory nuclei in the brainstem by its connections
Drugs: 
Sentence: with structures of the motor system .
Drugs: 
Sentence: functional evidence relating the ic to motor behavior derives from experiments showing that activation of the ic by electrical stimulation or excitatory amino acid microinjection causes freezing , escape -

Sentence: like behavior , and immobility .

Drugs: nmda

Drugs: glutamate
Sentence: metabotropic glutamate ( mglu ) receptors modulate synaptic transmission in the central nervous system and represent promising therapeutic targets for symptomatic treatment of parkinson 's disease ( pd ) .
Drugs: glutamate

Sentence: not known .

Drugs:

Drugs: remifentanil

Drugs: etomidate
Sentence: conclusion :

Drugs: tamoxifen
Sentence: italian tamoxifen prevention study .
Drugs: tamoxifen
Sentence: background :
Drugs: 
Sentence: tamoxifen is a candidate chemopreventive agent in breast cancer , although the drug may be associated with the development of endometrial cancer .
Drugs: tamoxifen
Sentence: therefore we did a trial in hysterectomised women of tamoxifen as a chemopreventive .
Drugs: tamoxifen
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: in october , 1992 , we started a double - blind placebo - controlled , randomised trial of tamoxifen in women ( mainly in italy ) who did not have
Drugs: tamoxifen
Sentence: breast cancer and who had had a hysterectomy .
Drugs: 
Sentence: women were randomised to receive tamoxifen 20 mg per day or placebo , both orally for 5 years .
Drugs: tamoxifen
Sentence: the original plan was to follow the intervention phase by 5 years ' follow - up .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in june , 1997 , the trialists and the data - monitoring committee decided to end recruitment primarily because of the number of women dropping out of the study .
Drugs: 
Sentence: recruitment ended on july 11 , 1997 , and the study will continue as planned .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the primary endpoints are the occurrence of and deaths from breast cancer .
Drugs: 
Sentence: this preliminary interim analysis is based on intention - to - treat .
Drugs: 
Sentence: findings :
Drugs: 
Sentence: 5408 women were randomised ; participating women have a median follow - up of 46 months for major endpoints .
Drugs: 
Sentence: 41 cases of breast cancer occurred so far ; there have been no deaths from breast cancer .
Drugs: 
Sentence: there is no difference in breast - cancer frequency between the placebo ( 22 cases ) and tamoxifen ( 19 ) arms .
Drugs: tamoxifen
Sentence: there is a statistically significant reduction of breast cancer among women receiving tamoxifen who also used hormone - replacement therapy during the trial : among 390 women on such therapy
Drugs: tamoxifen
Sentence: and allocated to placebo , we found eight cases of breast cancer compared with one case among 362 women allocated to tamoxifen .
Drugs: tamoxifen
Sentence: compared with the placebo group , there was a significantly increased risk of vascular events and hypertriglyceridaemia among women on tamoxifen .
Drugs: tamoxifen
Sentence: interpretation :
Drugs: 
Sentence: although this preliminary analysis has low power , in this cohort of women at low - to - normal risk of breast cancer , the postulated protective effects of
Drugs: 
Sentence: tamoxifen are not yet apparent .
Drugs: tamoxifen
Sentence: women using hormone - replacement therapy appear to have benefited from use of tamoxifen .
Drugs: tamoxifen
Sentence: there were no deaths from breast cancer recorded in women in the study .
Drugs: 
Sentence: it is essential to continue follow - up to quantify the long - term risks and benefits of tamoxifen therapy .
Drugs: tamoxifen

Sentence: ranitidine and 3 . 6 g per day for cimetidine ) .

Sentence: yohimbine treatment of sexual side effects induced by serotonin reuptake blockers .
Drugs: yohimbine, serotonin
Sentence: background :
Drugs: 
Sentence: preclinical and clinical studies suggest that yohimbine facilitates sexual behavior and may be helpful in the treatment of male impotence .
Drugs: yohimbine
Sentence: a single case report suggests that yohimbine may be used to treat the sexual side effects of clomipramine .
Drugs: yohimbine, clomipramine
Sentence: this study evaluated yohimbine as a treatment for the sexual side effects caused by serotonin reuptake blockers .
Drugs: yohimbine, serotonin
Sentence: method :
Drugs: 
Sentence: six patients with either obsessive compulsive disorder , trichotillomania , anxiety , or affective disorders who suffered sexual side effects after treatment with serotonin reuptake blockers were given yohimbine on
Drugs: serotonin, yohimbine
Sentence: a p . r . n . basis in an open clinical trial .
Drugs: 
Sentence: various doses of yohimbine were used to determine the ideal dose for each patient .
Drugs: yohimbine
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: five of the six patients experienced improved sexual functioning after taking yohimbine .
Drugs: yohimbine
Sentence: one patient who failed to comply with yohimbine treatment had no therapeutic effects .
Drugs: yohimbine
Sentence: side effects of yohimbine included excessive sweating , increased anxiety , and a wound - up feeling in some patients .
Drugs: yohimbine
Sentence: conclusion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the results of this study indicate that yohimbine may be an effective treatment for the sexual side effects caused by serotonin reuptake blockers .
Drugs: yohimbine, serotonin
Sentence: future controlled studies are needed to further investigate the effectiveness and safety of yohimbine for this indication .
Drugs: yohimbine

Sentence: reversible myocardial hypertrophy induced by tacrolimus in a pediatric heart transplant recipient : case report .
Drugs: tacrolimus
Sentence: tacrolimus is a potent immunosuppressant that is frequently used in organ transplantation .
Drugs: tacrolimus
Sentence: however , adverse effects include cardiac toxicity .
Drugs: 
Sentence: herein we describe transient myocardial hypertrophy induced by tacrolimus after heart transplantation .
Drugs: tacrolimus
Sentence: the hypertrophy caused no clinical symptoms but was noted because of elevation of plasma brain natriuretic peptide concentration and confirmed at echocardiography .
Drugs: 
Sentence: initially , allograft rejection was feared ; however , myocardial biopsy samples revealed only interstitial edema and mild myocardial hypertrophy ; neither cellular nor humoral rejection was detected .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the blood tacrolimus concentration was higher than usual at that time ; thus , tacrolimus dosage was reduced .
Drugs: tacrolimus, tacrolimus
Sentence: myocardial hypertrophy completely resolved upon reducing the target concentration of tacrolimus and did not recur , as confirmed at echocardiography and myocardial biopsy .
Drugs: tacrolimus
Sentence: thus , we conclude that tacrolimus induces reversible myocardial hypertrophy .
Drugs: tacrolimus
Sentence: in patients receiving tacrolimus therapy , blood concentration should be carefully controlled and extreme attention paid to cardiac involvement .
Drugs: tacrolimus

Drugs: 
Sentence: this prospective study evaluated consecutive eligible seizure patients who had a plasma sample collected as part of their clinical evaluation .

Sentence: plasma samples with benzoylecgonine greater than 150 ng / ml or an amphetamine greater than 500 ng / ml were defined as positive .

Drugs: 
Sentence: benzoylecgonine and no samples ( 0 % , 95 % ci 0 - 1 . 2 % ) were positive for amphetamine .

Sentence: positive test results were more common in patient visits where there was a history or suspicion of cocaine or amphetamine abuse ( p < 0 . 0005 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: during this study period , routine plasma screening for cocaine and amphetamines in adult seizure patients had a low yield .
Drugs: cocaine, amphetamines
Sentence: as a result , routine plasma screening would yield few cases of stimulant drug in which there was neither a history nor suspicion of drug abuse in this population .

Sentence: urine n - acetyl - beta - d - glucosaminidase - - a marker of tubular damage ?
Drugs: 
Sentence: background :
Drugs: 
Sentence: although an indicator of renal tubular dysfunction , an increased urinary n - acetyl - beta - d - glucosaminidase ( nag ) activity might reflect increased lysosomal activity in
Drugs: 
Sentence: renal tubular cells .
Drugs: 
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: puromycin aminonucleoside ( pan ) was administered to sprague dawley rats to induce proteinuria .
Drugs: puromycinaminonucleoside, aminonucleoside, pan
Sentence: total protein , albumin , nag activity and protein electrophoretic pattern were assessed in daily urine samples for 33 days .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the morphological appearance of the kidneys was examined on days three , four , six , eight and thirty three and the nag isoenzyme patterns on days zero , four
Drugs: 
Sentence: , eight and thirty three .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: following intravenous pan urine volume and urine nag activity increased significantly by day two , but returned to normal by day four .
Drugs: pan
Sentence: after day four all treated animals exhibited a marked rise in urine albumin , total protein excretion and nag activity .
Drugs: 
Sentence: electrophoresis showed a generalised increase in middle and high molecular weight urine proteins from day four onwards .
Drugs: 
Sentence: protein droplets first appeared prominent in tubular cells on day four .
Drugs: 
Sentence: peak urine nag activity and a change in nag isoenzyme pattern coincided with both the peak proteinuria and the reduction in intracellular protein and nag droplets ( day six onwards
Drugs: 
Sentence: ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: this animal model demonstrates that an increase in lysosomal turnover and hence urine nag activity , occurs when increased protein is presented to the tubular cells .
Drugs: 
Sentence: urine nag activity is thus a measure of altered function in the renal tubules and not simply an indicator of damage .

Drugs: doxorubicin, dxr, adriamycin

Drugs: dxr
Sentence: morphologic damage was variable but was proportional to the total cumulative dxr dose between 100 and 600 mg / m2 .
Drugs: dxr
Sentence: performance abnormalities correlated weakly with dose , exhibited a curvilinear relationship , and had a """" threshold """" for expression .

Drugs: 
Sentence: and this relationship also exhibited a curvilinear , threshold configuration .

Drugs: dxr, dxr
Sentence: damage is reached , after which myocardial performance deteriorates rapidly .

Drugs: amisulpride, tiapride
Sentence: objective :
Drugs: 
Sentence: to describe the unmasking of pheochromocytoma in a patient treated with amisulpride and tiapride .
Drugs: amisulpride, tiapride
Sentence: case summary :
Drugs: 
Sentence: a 42 - year - old white man developed acute hypertension with severe headache and vomiting 2 hours after the first doses of amisulpride 100 mg and tiapride 100 mg
Drugs: amisulpride, tiapride
Sentence: .
Drugs: 
Sentence: both drugs were immediately discontinued , and the patient recovered after subsequent nicardipine and verapamil treatment .
Drugs: nicardipine, verapamil
Sentence: abdominal ultrasound showed an adrenal mass , and postoperative histologic examination confirmed the diagnosis of pheochromocytoma .
Drugs: 
Sentence: discussion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: drug - induced symptoms of pheochromocytoma are often associated with the use of substituted benzamide drugs , but the underlying mechanism is unknown .
Drugs: benzamide
Sentence: in our case , use of the naranjo probability scale indicated a possible relationship between the hypertensive crisis and amisulpride and tiapride therapy .
Drugs: amisulpride, tiapride
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: as of march 24 , 2005 , this is the first reported case of amisulpride - and tiapride - induced hypertensive crisis in a patient with pheochromocytoma .
Drugs: amisulpride, tiapride
Sentence: physicians and other healthcare professionals should be aware of this potential adverse effect of tiapride and amisulpride .
Drugs: tiapride, amisulpride

Drugs: 
Sentence: participants in the medical research council treatment trial for mild hypertension are randomly allocated to one of four treatment groups : bendrofluazide , propranolol , or a placebo for either
Drugs: bendrofluazide, propranolol
Sentence: of these drugs .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the trial is single - blind .
Drugs: 
Sentence: 23 582 patient - years of observation have been completed so far , 10 684 on active drugs and 12 898 on placebos .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the results show an association between bendrofluazide treatment and impotence , and impotence also occurred more frequently in patients taking propranolol than in those taking placebos .
Drugs: bendrofluazide, propranolol
Sentence: other adverse reactions significantly linked with active drugs include impaired glucose tolerance in men and women and gout in men , associated with bendrofluazide treatment , and raynaud 's phenomenon
Drugs: bendrofluazide
Sentence: and dyspnoea in men and women taking propranolol .
Drugs: propranolol
Sentence: no corneal disease is known to have occurred in the propranolol group .
Drugs: propranolol
Sentence: mean serum potassium level fell , and urea and uric acid levels rose , in men and women taking bendrofluazide .
Drugs: potassiumacid, acid, bendrofluazide
Sentence: in the propranolol group , serum potassium and uric acid levels rose in both sexes , but the urea level rose significantly in women only .
Drugs: propranololacid, acid, urea

Drugs: chloroquine

Sentence: intravenous ribavirin treatment for severe adenovirus disease in immunocompromised children .
Drugs: ribavirin
Sentence: background : adenovirus is an important cause of morbidity and mortality in the immunocompromised host .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the incidence of severe adenovirus disease in pediatrics is increasing in association with growing numbers of immunocompromised children , where case fatality rates as high as 50 % to 80
Drugs: 
Sentence: % have been reported .
Drugs: 
Sentence: there are no approved antiviral agents with proven efficacy for the treatment of severe adenovirus disease , nor are there any prospective randomized , controlled trials of potentially useful anti
Drugs: 
Sentence: - adenovirus therapies .
Drugs: 
Sentence: apparent clinical success in the treatment of severe adenovirus disease is limited to a few case reports and small series .
Drugs: 
Sentence: experience is greatest with intravenous ribavirin and cidofovir .
Drugs: ribavirin, cidofovir
Sentence: ribavirin , a guanosine analogue , has broad antiviral activity against both rna and dna viruses , including documented activity against adenovirus in vitro .
Drugs: ribavirin, guanosine
Sentence: ribavirin is licensed in aerosol form for the treatment of respiratory syncytial virus infection , and orally in combination with interferon to treat hepatitis c . intravenous ribavirin is the
Drugs: ribavirin, ribavirin
Sentence: treatment of choice for infection with hemorrhagic fever viruses .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the most common adverse effect of intravenous ribavirin is reversible mild anemia .
Drugs: ribavirin
Sentence: the use of cidofovir in severe adenovirus infection has been limited by adverse effects , the most significant of which is nephrotoxicity .
Drugs: cidofovir
Sentence: objective :
Drugs: 
Sentence: we report our experience with intravenous ribavirin therapy for severe adenovirus disease in a series of immunocompromised children and review the literature .
Drugs: ribavirin
Sentence: design / methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: we retrospectively reviewed the medical records of 5 children treated with intravenous ribavirin for documented severe adenovirus disease .
Drugs: ribavirin
Sentence: two patients developed adenovirus hemorrhagic cystitis after cardiac and bone marrow transplants , respectively .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the bone marrow transplant patient also received intravenous cidofovir for progressive disseminated disease .
Drugs: cidofovir
Sentence: an additional 3 children developed adenovirus pneumonia ; 2 were neonates , 1 of whom had partial digeorge syndrome .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the remaining infant had recently undergone a cardiac transplant .
Drugs: 
Sentence: intravenous ribavirin was administered on a compassionate - use protocol .
Drugs: ribavirin
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: complete clinical recovery followed later by viral clearance was observed in 2 children : the cardiac transplant recipient with adenovirus hemorrhagic cystitis and the immunocompetent neonate with adenovirus pneumonia .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the remaining 3 children died of adenovirus disease .
Drugs: 
Sentence: intravenous ribavirin therapy was well tolerated .
Drugs: ribavirin
Sentence: use of cidofovir in 1 child was associated with progressive renal failure and neutropenia .
Drugs: cidofovir
Sentence: discussion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: our series of patients is representative of the spectrum of immunocompromised children at greatest risk for severe adenovirus disease , namely solid - organ and bone marrow transplant recipients ,
Drugs: 
Sentence: neonates , and children with immunodeficiency .
Drugs: 
Sentence: although intravenous ribavirin was not effective for all children with severe adenovirus disease in this series or in the literature , therapy is unlikely to be of benefit if begun
Drugs: ribavirin
Sentence: late in the course of the infection .
Drugs: 
Sentence: early identification , eg by polymerase chain reaction of those patients at risk of disseminated adenovirus disease may permit earlier antiviral treatment and better evaluation of therapeutic response .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: two of 5 children with severe adenovirus disease treated with intravenous ribavirin recovered .
Drugs: ribavirin
Sentence: the availability of newer rapid diagnostic techniques , such as polymerase chain reaction , may make earlier , more effective treatment of adenovirus infection possible .
Drugs: 
Sentence: given the seriousness and increasing prevalence of adenovirus disease in certain hosts , especially children , a large , multicenter clinical trial of potentially useful anti - adenoviral therapies ,
Drugs: 
Sentence: such as intravenous ribavirin , is clearly required to demonstrate the most effective and least toxic therapy .
Drugs: ribavirin
Sentence: hepatotoxicity of amiodarone .
Drugs: amiodarone
Sentence: amiodarone has proved very effective in the treatment of otherwise resistant cardiac tachyarrhythmias .
Drugs: amiodarone
Sentence: the use of amiodarone has , however , been limited due to its serious side - effects .
Drugs: amiodarone
Sentence: a patient with cholestatic hepatitis due to amiodarone treatment is presented below and a review of the hepatotoxicity of amiodarone is given .
Drugs: amiodarone, amiodarone
Sentence: it is concluded that solid evidence exists of hepatic injury due to amiodarone treatment , including steatosis , alterations resembling alcoholic hepatitis , cholestatic hepatitis and micronodular cirrhosis of the
Drugs: amiodarone
Sentence: liver .
Drugs: 
Sentence: patients receiving amiodarone should be regularly screened with respect to hepatic enzyme levels .
Drugs: amiodarone
Sentence: therapy should be discontinued on the suspicion of cholestatic injury or hepatomegaly .

Sentence: catalepsy induced by combinations of ketamine and morphine : potentiation , antagonism , tolerance and cross - tolerance in the rat .
Drugs: ketamine, morphine
Sentence: previous studies demonstrated that both ketamine and morphine induced analgesia and catalepsy in the rat . pre - treatment with ketamine produced cross - tolerance to morphine , whereas pretreatment
Drugs: ketamine, morphine, ketamine, morphine
Sentence: with morphine did not induce cross - tolerance to ketamine but rather augmented the cataleptic response ; this augmentation was attributed to residual morphine in the brain .
Drugs: morphine, ketamine, morphine
Sentence: the present studies explored the duration of the loss of righting reflex induced by sub - effective doses of ketamine and morphine , administered simultaneously .
Drugs: ketamine, morphine
Sentence: there was mutual potentiation between sub - effective doses of ketamine and morphine , but sub - effective doses of ketamine partly antagonized fully - effective doses of morphine .
Drugs: ketamine, morphine, ketamine, morphine
Sentence: latency to the loss of righting reflex , rigidity and behavior on recovery , reflected the relative predominance of ketamine or morphine in each combination .
Drugs: ketamine, morphine
Sentence: naloxone inhibited the induced cataleptic effects .
Drugs: naloxone
Sentence: the degree and time course of development of tolerance to daily administration of sub - effective dose combinations of ketamine and morphine were similar .
Drugs: ketamine, morphine
Sentence: rats , tolerant to ketamine - dominant combinations , were cross - tolerant to both drugs , while those tolerant to morphine - dominant combinations were cross - tolerant to
Drugs: ketamine, morphine
Sentence: morphine but showed either no cross - tolerance or an augmented response to ketamine .
Drugs: morphine, ketamine
Sentence: while the mutual potentiation , antagonism and tolerance suggest common mechanisms for the induced catalepsy , differences in latency , rigidity and behavior , asymmetry of cross - tolerance and
Drugs: 
Sentence: a widely - different id50 for naloxone would argue against an action at a single opioid site .
Drugs: naloxone

Sentence: delayed leukoencephalopathy with stroke - like presentation in chemotherapy recipients .
Drugs: 
Sentence: background :
Drugs: 
Sentence: a transient leukoencephalopathy mimicking cerebrovascular accident has been described as a complication of chemotherapy , most commonly in recipients of intrathecal methotrexate for childhood leukaemia .
Drugs: methotrexate
Sentence: recently published neuroimaging data suggest a common pathophysiology associated with a variety of chemotherapy agents and modes of administration .
Drugs: 
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: we reviewed the medical literature for single reports and case series of patients presenting with stroke - like episodes while receiving systemic or intrathecal chemotherapy .
Drugs: 
Sentence: we only included studies providing detailed neuroimaging data .
Drugs: 
Sentence: patients with cerebrovascular accidents were excluded .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: we identified 27 reports of toxic leukoencephalopathy in patients treated with methotrexate ( intrathecal , systemic ) , 5 - fluorouracil and its derivative carmofur , and capecitabine .
Drugs: methotrexate-fluorouracil, fluorouracil, carmofur, capecitabine
Sentence: diffusion weighted imaging ( dwi ) of all patients revealed well demarcated hyperintense lesions within the subcortical white matter of the cerebral hemispheres and the corpus callosum , corresponding to
Drugs: 
Sentence: areas of decreased proton diffusion on apparent diffusion coefficient ( adc ) maps ( available in 21 / 27 patients ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: lesions exceeded the confines of adjacent vascular territories .
Drugs: 
Sentence: complete resolution of symptoms within 1 - 4 days was accompanied by normalisation of adc abnormalities .
Drugs: 
Sentence: however , fluid attenuated inversion recovery ( flair ) sequences frequently revealed persistent white matter abnormalities .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: several pathophysiological models of delayed leukoencephalopathy after exposure to intrathecal or systemic chemotherapy have been proposed .
Drugs: 
Sentence: dwi findings in this cohort are indicative of cytotoxic oedema within cerebral white matter and lend support to an at least partially reversible metabolic derangement as the basis for this
Drugs: 
Sentence: syndrome .
Drugs:

Sentence: not cortex , striatum or amygdalae .

Sentence: co -
Drugs: 
Sentence: administration of lidocaine , bupivacaine or tricaine with desipramine reversed this effect .
Drugs: lidocaine, bupivacaine, tricaine, desipramine
Sentence: daily treatment of cocaine increased [ ( 3 ) h ] norepinephrine uptake into the hippocampus .
Drugs: cocaine, norepinephrine
Sentence: daily administration of desipramine increased the incidence of appearance of lidocaine - induced convulsions and decreased that of cocaine - induced convulsions .
Drugs: desipramine, lidocaine, cocaine
Sentence: co -
Drugs:

Drugs: lidocaine, desipramine, lidocaine, cocaine, desipramine

Drugs: na, desipramine
