Drugs: cocaine
Sentence: desipramine - induced sensitization of lidocaine seizures may have a mechanism distinct from kindling resulting from repeated administration of cocaine .
Drugs: desipramine, lidocaine, cocaine
Sentence: definition and management of anemia in patients infected with hepatitis c virus .
Drugs: 
Sentence: chronic infection with hepatitis c virus ( hcv ) can progress to cirrhosis , hepatocellular carcinoma , and end - stage liver disease .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the current best treatment for hcv infection is combination therapy with pegylated interferon and ribavirin .
Drugs: interferon, ribavirin
Sentence: although this regimen produces sustained virologic responses ( svrs ) in approximately 50 % of patients , it can be associated with a potentially dose - limiting hemolytic anemia .
Drugs: 
Sentence: hemoglobin concentrations decrease mainly as a result of ribavirin - induced hemolysis , and this anemia can be problematic in patients with hcv infection , especially those who have comorbid
Drugs: ribavirin
Sentence: renal or cardiovascular disorders .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in general , anemia can increase the risk of morbidity and mortality , and may have negative effects on cerebral function and quality of life .
Drugs: 
Sentence: although ribavirin - associated anemia can be reversed by dose reduction or discontinuation , this approach compromises outcomes by significantly decreasing svr rates .
Drugs: ribavirin
Sentence: recombinant human erythropoietin has been used to manage ribavirin - associated anemia but has other potential disadvantages .
Drugs: ribavirin
Sentence: viramidine , a liver - targeting prodrug of ribavirin , has the potential to maintain the virologic efficacy of ribavirin while decreasing the risk of hemolytic anemia in patients with
Drugs: viramidine, ribavirin, ribavirin
Sentence: chronic hepatitis c .
Drugs: 
Sentence: calcium carbonate toxicity : the updated milk - alkali syndrome ; report of 3 cases and review of the literature .
Drugs: calciumcarbonate, carbonate
Sentence: objective :
Drugs: 
Sentence: to describe 3 patients with calcium carbonate - induced hypercalcemia and gain insights into the cause and management of the milk - alkali syndrome .
Drugs: calciumcarbonate, carbonate
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: we report the clinical and laboratory data in 3 patients who presented with severe hypercalcemia ( corrected serum calcium > or = 14 mg / dl ) and review the
Drugs: calcium
Sentence: pertinent literature on milk - alkali syndrome .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the 3 patients had acute renal insufficiency , relative metabolic alkalosis , and low parathyroid hormone ( pth ) , pth - related peptide , and
Drugs: 
Sentence: 1 , 25 - dihydroxyvitamin d concentrations .
Drugs: 1,25-dihydroxyvitamind, d
Sentence: no malignant lesion was found .
Drugs: 
Sentence: treatment included aggressive hydration and varied amounts of furosemide .
Drugs: furosemide
Sentence: the 2 patients with the higher serum calcium concentrations received pamidronate intravenously ( 60 and 30 mg , respectively ) , which caused severe hypocalcemia .
Drugs: calcium, pamidronate
Sentence: of the 3 patients , 2 were ingesting acceptable doses of elemental calcium ( 1 g and 2 g daily , respectively ) in the form of calcium carbonate .
Drugs: calciumcarbonate, carbonate
Sentence: in addition to our highlighted cases , we review the history , classification , pathophysiologic features , and treatment of milk - alkali syndrome and summarize the cases reported from
Drugs: 
Sentence: early 1995 to november 2003 .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: milk - alkali syndrome may be a common cause of unexplained hypercalcemia and can be precipitated by small amounts of orally ingested calcium carbonate in susceptible persons .
Drugs: calciumcarbonate, carbonate
Sentence: treatment with hydration , furosemide , and discontinuation of the calcium and vitamin d source is adequate .
Drugs: furosemided, d
Sentence: pamidronate treatment is associated with considerable risk for hypocalcemia , even in cases of initially severe hypercalcemia .
Drugs: pamidronate
Sentence: management strategies for ribavirin - induced hemolytic anemia in the treatment of hepatitis c : clinical and economic implications .
Drugs: ribavirin
Sentence: objectives :
Drugs: 
Sentence: recently published studies have demonstrated increased efficacy and cost - effectiveness of combination therapy with interferon and alpha - 2b / ribavirin compared with interferon - alpha monotherapy in the
Drugs: ribavirin-alpha, alpha
Sentence: treatment of chronic hepatitis c ( chc ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: combination therapy is associated with a clinically important adverse effect : ribavirin - induced hemolytic anemia ( riha ) .
Drugs: ribavirin
Sentence: the objective of this study was to evaluate the direct health - care costs and management of riha during treatment of chc in a clinical trial setting .
Drugs: 
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: a systematic literature review was conducted to synthesize information on the incidence and management of riha .
Drugs: 
Sentence: decision - analytic techniques were used to estimate the cost of treating riha .
Drugs: 
Sentence: uncertainty was evaluated using sensitivity analyses .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results : riha , defined as a reduction in hemoglobin to less than 100 g / l , occurs in approximately 7 % to 9 % of patients treated with
Drugs: 
Sentence: combination therapy .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the standard of care for management of riha is reduction or discontinuation of the ribavirin dosage .
Drugs: ribavirin
Sentence: we estimated the direct cost of treating clinically significant riha to be 170 per patient receiving combination therapy per 48 - week treatment course ( range
Drugs: 
Sentence: 68 - 692 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the results of the one - way sensitivity analyses ranged from 57 to 317 .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in comparison , the cost of 48 weeks of combination therapy is 16 , 459 .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the direct cost of treating clinically significant riha is 1 % ( 170 / 16 , 459 ) of drug treatment costs .
Drugs: 
Sentence: questions remain about the optimal dose of ribavirin and the incidence of riha in a real - world population .
Drugs: ribavirin
Sentence: despite these uncertainties , this initial evaluation of the direct cost of treating riha provides an estimate of the cost and management implications of this clinically important adverse effect .
Drugs: 
Sentence: effects of amine pretreatment on ketamine catatonia in pinealectomized or hypophysectomized animals .
Drugs: amine, ketamine
Sentence: the present studies were designed to clarify the role of catecholamines and pineal idolamines on ketamine - induced catatonia in the intact , pinealectomized or hypophysectomized chick and rat .
Drugs: catecholamines, ketamine
Sentence: in the pinealectomized chick , pretreatment with dopamine increased the duration of catatonia ( doc ) after ketamine , but pretreatment with norepinephrine did not .
Drugs: dopamine, ketamine, norepinephrine
Sentence: the pineal indolamines exhibited mixed actions .
Drugs: 
Sentence: serotonin and n - acetyl serotonin which augmented ketamine doc , did not do so in the absence of the pineal gland , whereas melatonin potentiated the ketamine doc in
Drugs: serotonin-acetylserotonin, serotonin, ketamine, melatonin, ketamine
Sentence: both the intact and pinealectomized chick .
Drugs: 
Sentence: ketamine was more potent in the hypophysectomized chick and the circadian rhythm noted in the intact chick was absent ; furthermore , melatonin did not augment the ketamine doc whereas
Drugs: ketamine, melatonin, ketamine
Sentence: dopamine continued to do so .
Drugs: dopamine
Sentence: this study did not demonstrate a species difference regarding the role of the amines on the pineal in spite of the immature blood - brain barrier in the young chick
Drugs: amines
Sentence: and the intact barrier in the rat .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in addition , these data indicate a direct role of the pituitary in the augmentation of ketamine doc induced by melatonin .
Drugs: ketamine, melatonin
Sentence: furthermore , dopamine appeared to act on systems more closely involved with the induction of ketamine catatonia rather than directly on the pituitary .
Drugs: dopamine, ketamine

Drugs: chlorpheniramine
Sentence: daily subject symptom cards were completed during a screening period to assess pretreatment symptoms and during a 4 - week treatment period while subjects received study medications .
Drugs:

Drugs: azelastine

Drugs: chlorpheniramine
Sentence: study .

Drugs: azelastine

Drugs: pge2, pg
Sentence: smooth muscle .
Drugs:

Drugs: pge267,58048,968, 968

Drugs: pge2, pg

Drugs: pge2

Drugs: prostanoids, tachykinins

Drugs: potassium

Drugs: potassium

Drugs:

Drugs: potassium

Drugs: amiloride, potassium, chlorthalidone
Sentence: plasma potassium concentrations were on average 1 mmol / l lower during the chlorthalidone phase compared to amiloride therapy .
Drugs: potassium, chlorthalidone, amiloride
Sentence: blood pressure and volume states as assessed by bodyweight , plasma renin and noradrenaline ( norepinephrine ) concentrations were similar on the 2 regimens .
Drugs: noradrenaline, norepinephrine

Drugs: amiloride, chlorthalidone
Sentence: , increased upslope and duration of the monophasic action potential , prolonged ventricular effective refractory period , and increased electrical instability during programmed ventricular stimulation .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the above results indicate that because potassium - losing diuretic therapy can increase myocardial electrical excitability in patients with ischaemic heart disease , even minor falls in plasma potassium concentrations
Drugs: potassium, potassium
Sentence: are probably best avoided in such patients .

Sentence: swallowing - induced atrial tachyarrhythmia triggered by salbutamol : case report and review of the literature .
Drugs: salbutamol
Sentence: case :
Drugs: 
Sentence: a 49 - year - old patient experienced chest discomfort while swallowing .
Drugs: 
Sentence: on electrocardiogram , episodes of atrial tachyarrhythmia were recorded immediately after swallowing ; 24 - hour holter monitoring recorded several events .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the arrhythmia resolved after therapy with atenolol , but recurred a year later .
Drugs: atenolol
Sentence: the patient noticed that before these episodes he had been using an inhalator of salbutamol .
Drugs: salbutamol
Sentence: after stopping the beta - agonist , and after a week with the atenolol , the arrhythmia disappeared .
Drugs: atenolol
Sentence: discussion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: swallowing - induced atrial tachyarrhythmia ( siat ) is a rare phenomenon .
Drugs: 
Sentence: fewer than 50 cases of siat have been described in the literature .
Drugs: 
Sentence: this article summarizes all the cases published , creating a comprehensive review of the current knowledge and approach to siat .
Drugs: 
Sentence: it discusses demographics , clinical characteristics and types of arrhythmia , postulated mechanisms of siat , and different treatment possibilities such as medications , surgery , and radiofrequency catheter ablation
Drugs: 
Sentence: ( rfca ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: salbutamol is presented here as a possible trigger for siat .
Drugs: salbutamol
Sentence: although it is difficult to define causality in a case report , it is logical to think that a beta - agonist like salbutamol ( known to induce tachycardia )
Drugs: salbutamol
Sentence: may be the trigger of adrenergic reflexes originating in the esophagus while swallowing and that a beta - blocker such as atenolol ( that blocks the adrenergic activity ) may
Drugs: atenolol
Sentence: relieve it .

Sentence: sedation depth during spinal anesthesia and the development of postoperative delirium in elderly patients undergoing hip fracture repair .
Drugs: 
Sentence: objective :
Drugs: 
Sentence: to determine whether limiting intraoperative sedation depth during spinal anesthesia for hip fracture repair in elderly patients can decrease the prevalence of postoperative delirium .
Drugs: 
Sentence: patients and methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: we performed a double - blind , randomized controlled trial at an academic medical center of elderly patients ( > or = 65 years ) without preoperative delirium or severe
Drugs: 
Sentence: dementia who underwent hip fracture repair under spinal anesthesia with propofol sedation .
Drugs: propofol
Sentence: sedation depth was titrated using processed electroencephalography with the bispectral index ( bis ) , and patients were randomized to receive either deep ( bis , approximately 50 ) or
Drugs: 
Sentence: light ( bis , > or = 80 ) sedation .
Drugs: 
Sentence: postoperative delirium was assessed as defined by diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorders ( third edition revised ) criteria using the confusion assessment method beginning at any time from
Drugs: 
Sentence: the second day after surgery .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: from april 2 , 2005 , through october 30 , 2008 , a total of 114 patients were randomized .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the prevalence of postoperative delirium was significantly lower in the light sedation group ( 11 / 57 [ 19 % ] vs 23 / 57 [ 40 % ] in
Drugs: 
Sentence: the deep sedation group ; p = . 02 ) , indicating that 1 incident of delirium will be prevented for every 4 . 7 patients treated with light sedation
Drugs: 
Sentence: .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the mean + / -
Drugs: 
Sentence: sd number of days of delirium during hospitalization was lower in the light sedation group than in the deep sedation group ( 0 . 5 + / - 1 .
Drugs: 
Sentence: 5 days vs 1 . 4 + / - 4 . 0 days ; p = . 01 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the use of light propofol sedation decreased the prevalence of postoperative delirium by 50 % compared with deep sedation .
Drugs: propofol
Sentence: limiting depth of sedation during spinal anesthesia is a simple , safe , and cost - effective intervention for preventing postoperative delirium in elderly patients that could be widely and
Drugs: 
Sentence: readily adopted .

Drugs:

Sentence: consensus statement concerning cardiotoxicity occurring during haematopoietic stem cell transplantation in the treatment of autoimmune diseases , with special reference to systemic sclerosis and multiple sclerosis .
Drugs: 
Sentence: autologous haematopoietic stem cell transplantation is now a feasible and effective treatment for selected patients with severe autoimmune diseases .
Drugs: 
Sentence: worldwide , over 650 patients have been transplanted in the context of phase i and ii clinical trials .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the results are encouraging enough to begin randomised phase iii trials .
Drugs: 
Sentence: however , as predicted , significant transplant - related morbidity and mortality have been observed .
Drugs: 
Sentence: this is primarily due to complications related to either the stage of the disease at transplant or due to infections .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the number of deaths related to cardiac toxicity is low .
Drugs: 
Sentence: however , caution is required when cyclophosphamide or anthracyclines such as mitoxantrone are used in patients with a possible underlying heart damage , for example , systemic sclerosis patients .

Drugs: lmwh
Sentence: results :

Drugs: 
Sentence: data to establish the thromboembolic risk were incomplete .

Sentence: after excluding case reports , the following groups were constructed : ( a ) short - term administration , after valve insertion ( n = 212 ) ; ( b
Drugs: 
Sentence: ) short - term , perioperative ( noncardiac ) / periprocedural ( n = 114 ) ; ( c ) long - term , due to intolerance to oac (
Drugs: 
Sentence: n = 16 ) ; ( d ) long - term , in pregnancy ( n = 10 ) .
Drugs:

Drugs: 
Sentence: b , c , and d , respectively ; for hemorrhage , the overall rate was 3 . 4 % ( 3 . 8 , 2 . 6 , 10
Drugs: 
Sentence: , and 0 % for the respective groups ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: in patients with mechanical heart valves , short - term lmwh therapy compares favorably with uh .
Drugs: lmwh, uh

Drugs: lmwh

Drugs: lmwh

Drugs: spironolactoneb, b
Sentence: objective : nephrotoxicity is the major adverse effect of amphotericin b ( amb ) , often limiting administration of full dosage .

Sentence: selective distal tubular epithelial toxicity seems to be responsible for the profound potassium wasting that is a major clinical side effect of treatment with amb . potassium depletion also potentiates
Drugs: potassium, amb, potassium
Sentence: the tubular toxicity of amb .

Drugs: spironolactone, potassium, amb
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: in this study 26 patients with various hematological disorders were randomized to receive either intravenous amb alone or amb and oral spironolactone 100 mg twice daily when developing a proven
Drugs: amb, amb, spironolactone
Sentence: or suspected fungal infection .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: patients receiving concomitant amb and spironolactone had significantly higher plasma potassium levels than those receiving amb alone ( p = 0 . 0027 ) .
Drugs: amb, spironolactone, potassium, amb
Sentence: those patients receiving amb and spironolactone required significantly less potassium supplementation to maintain their plasma potassium within the normal range ( p = 0 . 022 ) .
Drugs: amb, spironolactone, potassium, potassium
Sentence: moreover , urinary potassium losses were significantly less in patients receiving amb and spironolactone than those receiving amb alone ( p = 0 . 040 ) .
Drugs: potassium, amb, spironolactone, amb
Sentence: conclusion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: this study showed that spironolactone can reduce potassium requirements and prevent hypokalemia by reducing urinary potassium loss in neutropenic patients on amb treatment .
Drugs: spironolactone, potassium, potassium, amb

Sentence: chronically elevated prolactin levels in children with prolactinomas may be associated with arrested growth and development resulting in either delayed puberty or short stature .
Drugs: 
Sentence: these possibilities stress the importance of developing a safe and effective approach to drug - induced hyperprolactinemia in youth .

Drugs: cabergoline

Drugs: vigabatrin
Sentence: purpose :
Drugs: 
Sentence: symptomatic visual field constriction thought to be associated with vigabatrin has been reported .
Drugs: vigabatrin
Sentence: the current study investigated the visual fields and visual electrophysiology of eight patients with known vigabatrin - attributed visual field loss , three of whom were reported previously .
Drugs: vigabatrin
Sentence: six of the patients were no longer receiving vigabatrin .
Drugs: vigabatrin
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the central and peripheral fields were examined with the humphrey visual field analyzer .
Drugs: 
Sentence: full visual electrophysiology , including flash electroretinography ( erg ) , pattern electroretinography , multifocal erg using the veris system , electro - oculography , and flash and pattern visual
Drugs: 
Sentence: evoked potentials , was undertaken .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: seven patients showed marked visual field constriction with some sparing of the temporal visual field .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the eighth exhibited concentric constriction .
Drugs: 
Sentence: most electrophysiological responses were usually just within normal limits ; two patients had subnormal arden electro - oculography indices ; and one patient showed an abnormally delayed photopic b wave
Drugs: 
Sentence: .
Drugs: 
Sentence: however , five patients showed delayed 30 - hz flicker b waves , and seven patients showed delayed oscillatory potentials .
Drugs: 
Sentence: multifocal erg showed abnormalities that sometimes correlated with the visual field appearance and confirmed that the deficit occurs at the retinal level .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: marked visual field constriction appears to be associated with vigabatrin therapy .
Drugs: vigabatrin
Sentence: the field defects and some electrophysiological abnormalities persist when vigabatrin therapy is withdrawn .
Drugs: vigabatrin

Drugs: rapamycin
Sentence: background :
Drugs:

Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: twenty renal transplant recipients were switched to fixed dose rapamycin ( rapa ) ( 5 mg / day ) 0 to 204 months posttransplant .
Drugs: rapamycin, rapa
Sentence: drug monitoring was not initially used to adjust doses .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the indications for switch were chronic csa or tac nephrotoxicity ( 12 ) , acute csa or tac toxicity ( 3 ) , severe facial dysmorphism ( 2 ) ,
Drugs: csa, tac, csa, tac
Sentence: posttransplant lymphoproliferative disorder ( ptld ) in remission ( 2 ) , and hepatotoxicity in 1 .
Drugs: 
Sentence: follow - up is 7 to 24 months .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: in the 12 patients switched because of chronic nephrotoxicity there was a significant decrease in serum creatinine
Drugs: creatinine
Sentence: [ 233 + / - 34 to 210 + / - 56 micromol / liter ( p < 0 . 05 ) at 6 months ] .
Drugs: 
Sentence: facial dysmorphism improved in two patients .
Drugs: 
Sentence: no relapse of ptld was observed .
Drugs: 
Sentence: five patients developed pneumonia ( two pneumocystis carinii pneumonia , one infectious mononucleosis with polyclonal ptld lung infiltrate ) and two had bronchiolitis obliterans .
Drugs: 
Sentence: there were no deaths .
Drugs: 
Sentence: rapa was discontinued in four patients , because of pneumonia in two , ptld in one , and oral aphtous ulcers in one .
Drugs: rapa
Sentence: rapa levels were high ( > 15 ng / ml ) in 7 of 13 ( 54 % ) patients .
Drugs: rapa
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: rapa conversion provides adequate immunosuppression to enable csa withdrawal .
Drugs: rapa, csa
Sentence: however , when converting patients to rapa drug levels should be monitored to avoid over - immunosuppression and adequate antiviral and pneumocystis carinii pneumonia prophylaxis should be given .

Drugs: epinephrine
Sentence: objective signs of ischemia and factors increasing myocardial oxygen consumption were compared during epinephrine infusion and supine bicycle exercise .
Drugs: oxygen, epinephrine
Sentence: both epinephrine and exercise produced myocardial ischemia as evidenced by st segment depression and angina .
Drugs: epinephrine
Sentence: however , the mechanisms of myocardial ischemia induced by epinephrine were significantly different from those of exercise .
Drugs: epinephrine
Sentence: exercise - induced myocardial ischemia was marked predominantly by increased heart rate and rate - pressure product with a minor contribution of end - diastolic volume , while epinephrine -
Drugs: epinephrine
Sentence: induced ischemia was characterized by a marked increase in contractility and a less pronounced increase in heart rate and rate - pressure product .
Drugs: 
Sentence: these findings indicate that ischemia produced by epinephrine , as may occur during states of emotional distress , has a mechanism distinct from that due to physical exertion .

Sentence: 22 - oxacalcitriol suppresses secondary hyperparathyroidism without inducing low bone turnover in dogs with renal failure .
Drugs: 22-oxacalcitriol, oxacalcitriol
Sentence: background :
Drugs: 
Sentence: calcitriol therapy suppresses serum levels of parathyroid hormone ( pth ) in patients with renal failure but has several drawbacks , including hypercalcemia and / or marked suppression of bone
Drugs: calcitriol
Sentence: turnover , which may lead to adynamic bone disease .
Drugs: 
Sentence: a new vitamin d analogue , 22 - oxacalcitriol ( oct ) , has been shown to have promising characteristics .
Drugs: vitamind-oxacalcitriol, oxacalcitriol, oct
Sentence: this study was undertaken to determine the effects of oct on serum pth levels and bone turnover in states of normal or impaired renal function .
Drugs: oct
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: sixty dogs were either nephrectomized ( nx , n = 38 ) or sham - operated ( sham , n = 22 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the animals received supplemental phosphate to enhance pth secretion .
Drugs: phosphate
Sentence: fourteen weeks after the start of phosphate supplementation , half of the nx and sham dogs received doses of oct ( three times per week ) ; the other half
Drugs: phosphate, oct
Sentence: were given vehicle for 60 weeks .
Drugs: 
Sentence: thereafter , the treatment modalities for a subset of animals were crossed over for an additional eight months .
Drugs: 
Sentence: biochemical and hormonal indices of calcium and bone metabolism were measured throughout the study , and bone biopsies were done at baseline , 60 weeks after oct or vehicle treatment
Drugs: calcium, oct
Sentence: , and at the end of the crossover period .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: in nx dogs , oct significantly decreased serum pth levels soon after the induction of renal insufficiency .
Drugs: oct
Sentence: in long - standing secondary hyperparathyroidism , oct ( 0 . 03 microg / kg ) stabilized serum pth levels during the first months .
Drugs: oct
Sentence: serum pth levels rose thereafter , but the rise was less pronounced compared with baseline than the rise seen in nx control .
Drugs: 
Sentence: these effects were accompanied by episodes of hypercalcemia and hyperphosphatemia .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in animals with normal renal function , oct induced a transient decrease in serum pth levels at a dose of 0 . 1 microg / kg , which was not
Drugs: oct
Sentence: sustained with lowering of the doses .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in nx dogs , oct reversed abnormal bone formation , such as woven osteoid and fibrosis , but did not significantly alter the level of bone turnover .
Drugs: oct
Sentence: in addition , oct improved mineralization lag time , ( that is , the rate at which osteoid mineralizes ) in both nx and sham dogs .
Drugs: oct
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: these results indicate that even though oct does not completely prevent the occurrence of hypercalcemia in experimental dogs with renal insufficiency , it may be of use in the management
Drugs: oct
Sentence: of secondary hyperparathyroidism because it does not induce low bone turnover and , therefore , does not increase the risk of adynamic bone disease .
Drugs:

Sentence: leukopenia was dose limiting : as many as 62 . 5 % of patients experienced grade 4 leukopenia .

Sentence: of 0 through 2 .
Drugs: 
Sentence: most patients ( 72 . 4 % ) had stage iv nsclc .

Sentence: paclitaxel 225 mg / m2 was infused over 3 hours every 3 weeks with standard prophylactic premedication .
Drugs: paclitaxel
Sentence: of 50 patients evaluable for response , 12 ( 24 % ) had partial remission , 26 ( 52 % ) had no change , and 12 had disease progression
Drugs: 
Sentence: ( 24 % ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: hematologic toxicities were mild : only one patient ( 2 % ) developed grade 3 or 4 neutropenia , while 29 % had grade 1 or 2 .

Sentence: grade 1 or 2 polyneuropathy affected 56 % of patients while only one ( 2 % ) experienced severe polyneuropathy .

Drugs: 
Sentence: .
Drugs: 
Sentence: nausea and vomiting were infrequent , with 14 % of patients experiencing grade 1 or 2 and only 2 % experiencing grade 3 or 4 .
Drugs: 
Sentence: paclitaxel is thus an active single agent in this patient population , with a 3 - hour infusion proving comparably effective to a 24 - hour infusion and superior in
Drugs: paclitaxel

Sentence: effect of calcium chloride and 4 - aminopyridine therapy on desipramine toxicity in rats .
Drugs: calciumchloride-aminopyridine, aminopyridine, desipramine
Sentence: background : hypotension is a major contributor to mortality in tricyclic antidepressant overdose .
Drugs: 
Sentence: recent data suggest that tricyclic antidepressants inhibit calcium influx in some tissues .
Drugs: calcium
Sentence: this study addressed the potential role of calcium channel blockade in tricyclic antidepressant - induced hypotension .
Drugs: calcium
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: two interventions were studied that have been shown previously to improve blood pressure with calcium channel blocker overdose .
Drugs: calcium
Sentence: cacl2 and 4 - aminopyridine .
Drugs: cacl2-aminopyridine, aminopyridine
Sentence: anesthetized rats received the tricyclic antidepressant desipramine ip to produce hypotension , qrs prolongation , and bradycardia .
Drugs: desipramine
Sentence: fifteen min later , animals received cacl2 , nahco3 , or saline .
Drugs: cacl2, nahco3
Sentence: in a second experiment , rats received tricyclic antidepressant desipramine ip followed in 15 min by 4 - aminopyridine or saline .
Drugs: desipramine-aminopyridine, aminopyridine
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: nahco3 briefly ( 5 min ) reversed hypotension and qrs prolongation .
Drugs: nahco3
Sentence: cacl2 and 4 - aminopyridine failed to improve blood pressure .
Drugs: cacl2-aminopyridine, aminopyridine
Sentence: the incidence of ventricular arrhythmias ( p = 0 . 004 ) and seizures ( p = 0 . 03 ) in the cacl2 group was higher than the other
Drugs: cacl2
Sentence: groups .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the administration of cacl2 or 4 - aminopyridine did not reverse tricyclic antidepressant - induced hypotension in rats .
Drugs: cacl2-aminopyridine, aminopyridine
Sentence: cacl2 therapy may possibly worsen both cardiovascular and central nervous system toxicity .
Drugs: cacl2
Sentence: these findings do not support a role for calcium channel inhibition in the pathogenesis of tricyclic antidepressant - induced hypotension .
Drugs: calcium

Drugs: 
Sentence: the dlt correlated with serum levels > or = 10 mumol / l . conclusion :

Drugs: 
Sentence: clomiphene citrate ( cc ) is commonly prescribed for ovulation induction .

Sentence: it is considered safe , with minimal side effects .

Drugs: cc
Sentence: spontaneous coronary thrombosis or thromboembolism with subsequent clot lysis has been suggested as one of the most common causes of myocardial infarction ( mi ) during pregnancy , with a
Drugs: 
Sentence: subsequently normal coronary angiogram .
Drugs: 
Sentence: case :
Drugs: 
Sentence: a 33 - year - old woman with a 5 - week gestation had recently received cc for ovulation induction and presented with chest pain .
Drugs: cc
Sentence: an electrocardiogram showed a lateral and anterior wall myocardial infarction .
Drugs: 
Sentence: cardiac enzymes showed a peak rise in troponin i to 9 . 10 ng / ml .
Drugs: 
Sentence: an initial exercise stress test was normal .
Drugs: 
Sentence: at the time of admission , the patient was at high risk of radiation injury to the fetus , so a coronary angiogram was postponed until the second trimester .
Drugs: 
Sentence: it showed normal coronary vessels .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: this appears to be the first reported case documenting a possible association between cc and myocardial infarction .
Drugs: cc
Sentence: thrombosis might be a rare but hazardous complication of cc .
Drugs: cc
Sentence: given this life - threatening complication , appropriate prophylactic measures should be used in high - risk woman undergoing ovarian stimulation .

Drugs: ethambutol

Drugs: 
Sentence: ethambutol is used in the treatment of tuberculosis , which is still prevalent in southeast asia , and can be associated with permanent visual loss .
Drugs: ethambutol
Sentence: we report 3 cases which presented with bitemporal hemianopia .
Drugs: 
Sentence: clinical picture :
Drugs: 
Sentence: three patients with ethambutol - associated toxic optic neuropathy are described .
Drugs: ethambutol
Sentence: all 3 patients had loss of central visual acuity , colour vision ( ishihara ) and visual field .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the visual field loss had a bitemporal flavour , suggesting involvement of the optic chiasm .
Drugs: 
Sentence: treatment :
Drugs: 
Sentence: despite stopping ethambutol on diagnosis , visual function continued to deteriorate for a few months .
Drugs: ethambutol
Sentence: subsequent improvement was mild in 2 cases .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in the third case , visual acuity and colour vision normalised but the optic discs were pale .
Drugs: 
Sentence: outcome :
Drugs: 
Sentence: all 3 patients had some permanent loss of visual function .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: ethambutol usage is associated with permanent visual loss and should be avoided if possible or used with caution and proper ophthalmological follow - up .
Drugs: ethambutol
Sentence: the author postulates that in cases of ethambutol associated chiasmopathy , ethambutol may initially affect the optic nerves and subsequently progress to involve the optic chiasm .
Drugs: ethambutol, ethambutol

Drugs: verapamil
Sentence: background :
Drugs: 
Sentence: atrial tachycardia - induced remodeling promotes the occurrence and maintenance of atrial fibrillation ( af ) and decreases l - type ca ( 2 + ) current .
Drugs: ca

Drugs: ca, ca
Sentence: 2 + ) channel inhibition .
Drugs: 
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: to evaluate the potential mechanisms of af promotion by ca ( 2 + ) channel blockers , we administered verapamil to morphine - chloralose anesthetized dogs .
Drugs: ca, verapamil, morphine, chloralose
Sentence: diltiazem was used as a comparison drug and autonomic blockade with atropine and nadolol was applied in some experiments .
Drugs: diltiazem, atropine, nadolol
Sentence: epicardial mapping with 240 epicardial electrodes was used to evaluate activation during af .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: verapamil caused af promotion in six dogs , increasing mean duration of af induced by burst pacing , from 8 + / - 4 s ( mean + / -
Drugs: verapamil
Sentence: s . e . ) to 95 + / - 39 s ( p < 0 . 01 vs . control ) at a loading dose of 0 . 1
Drugs: 
Sentence: mg / kg and 228 + / - 101 s ( p < 0 . 0005 vs . control ) at a dose of 0 . 2 mg / kg
Drugs: 
Sentence: .
Drugs: 
Sentence: underlying electrophysiological mechanisms were studied in detail in five additional dogs under control conditions and in the presence of the higher dose of verapamil .
Drugs: verapamil
Sentence: in these experiments , verapamil shortened mean effective refractory period ( erp ) from 122 + / - 5 to 114 + / - 4 ms ( p < 0
Drugs: verapamil
Sentence: . 02 ) at a cycle length of 300 ms , decreased erp heterogeneity ( from 15 + / - 1 to 10 + / - 1 % , p
Drugs: 
Sentence: < 0 . 05 ) , heterogeneously accelerated atrial conduction and decreased the cycle length of af ( 94 + / - 4 to 84 + / - 3 ms
Drugs: 
Sentence: , p < 0 . 005 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: diltiazem did not affect erp , af cycle length or af duration , but produced conduction acceleration similar to that caused by verapamil ( n = 5 ) .
Drugs: diltiazem, verapamil
Sentence: in the presence of autonomic blockade , verapamil failed to promote af and increased , rather than decreasing , refractoriness .
Drugs: verapamil
Sentence: neither verapamil nor diltiazem affected atrial conduction in the presence of autonomic blockade .
Drugs: verapamil, diltiazem
Sentence: epicardial mapping suggested that verapamil promoted af by increasing the number of simultaneous wavefronts reflected by separate zones of reactivation in each cycle .
Drugs: verapamil
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: verapamil promotes af in normal dogs by promoting multiple circuit reentry , an effect dependent on intact autonomic tone and not shared by diltiazem .
Drugs: verapamil, diltiazem

Sentence: impact of alcohol exposure after pregnancy recognition on ultrasonographic fetal growth measures .
Drugs: alcohol
Sentence: background : more than 3 decades after jones and smith ( 1973 ) reported on the devastation caused by alcohol exposure on fetal development , the rates of heavy drinking
Drugs: alcohol
Sentence: during pregnancy remain relatively unchanged .
Drugs: 
Sentence: early identification of fetal alcohol exposure and maternal abstinence led to better infant outcomes .
Drugs: alcohol
Sentence: this study examined the utility of biometry for detecting alcohol - related fetal growth impairment .
Drugs: alcohol
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: we obtained fetal ultrasound measures from routine ultrasound examinations for 167 pregnant hazardous drinkers who were enrolled in a brief alcohol intervention study .
Drugs: alcohol
Sentence: the fetal measures for women who quit after learning of their pregnancies were compared with measures for women who continued some drinking throughout the course of their pregnancies .
Drugs: 
Sentence: because intensity of alcohol consumption is associated with poorer fetal outcomes , separate analyses were conducted for the heavy ( average of > or = 5 drinks per drinking day
Drugs: alcohol
Sentence: ) alcohol consumers .
Drugs: alcohol
Sentence: fetal measures from the heavy - exposed fetuses were also compared with measures from a nondrinking group that was representative of normal , uncomplicated pregnancies from our clinics .
Drugs: 
Sentence: analyses of covariance were used to determine whether there were differences between groups after controlling for influences of gestational age and drug abuse .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: nearly half of the pregnant drinkers abstained after learning of their pregnancies .
Drugs: 
Sentence: when women reportedly quit drinking early in their pregnancies , fetal growth measures were not significantly different from a non - alcohol - exposed group , regardless of prior drinking
Drugs: alcohol
Sentence: patterns .
Drugs: 
Sentence: any alcohol consumption postpregnancy recognition among the heavy drinkers resulted in reduced cerebellar growth as well as decreased cranial to body growth in comparison with women who either quit drinking
Drugs: alcohol
Sentence: or who were nondrinkers .
Drugs: 
Sentence: amphetamine abuse was predictive of larger cranial to body growth ratios .
Drugs: amphetamine
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: alterations in fetal biometric measurements were observed among the heavy drinkers only when they continued drinking after becoming aware of their pregnancies .
Drugs: 
Sentence: although the reliance on self - reported drinking is a limitation in this study , these findings support the benefits of early abstinence and the potential for ultrasound examinations in
Drugs: 
Sentence: the detection of fetal alcohol effects .
Drugs: alcohol

Sentence: .

Sentence: absence of acute cerebral vasoconstriction after cocaine - associated subarachnoid hemorrhage .
Drugs: cocaine
Sentence: introduction :
Drugs: 
Sentence: cocaine use has been associated with neurovascular complications , including arterial vasoconstriction and vasculitis .
Drugs: cocaine
Sentence: however , there are few studies of angiographic effects of cocaine on human cerebral arteries .
Drugs: cocaine
Sentence: information on these effects could be obtained from angiograms of patients with cocaine - associated subarachnoid hemorrhage ( sah ) who underwent angiography shortly after cocaine use .
Drugs: cocaine, cocaine
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: we screened patients with sah retrospectively and identified those with positive urine toxicology for cocaine or its metabolites .
Drugs: cocaine
Sentence: quantitative arterial diameter measurements from angiograms of these patients were compared to measurements from control patients with sah who were matched for factors known to influence arterial diameter .
Drugs: 
Sentence: qualitative comparisons of small artery changes also were made .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: thirteen patients with positive cocaine toxicology were compared to 26 controls .
Drugs: cocaine
Sentence: there were no significant differences between groups in the mean diameters of the intradural internal carotid , sphenoidal segment of the middle cerebral , precommunicating segment of the anterior cerebral
Drugs: 
Sentence: , or basilar arteries ( p greater than 0 . 05 for all comparisons , unpaired t - tests ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: there also were no significant differences between groups when expressing diameters as the sum of the precommunicating segment of the anterior cerebral + sphenoidal segment of the middle cerebral +
Drugs: 
Sentence: supraclinoid internal carotid artery + basilar artery divided by the diameter of the petrous internal carotid artery ( p greater than 0 . 05 , unpaired t - tests )
Drugs: 
Sentence: .
Drugs: 
Sentence: qualitative assessments showed two arterial irregularities in the distal vasculature in each group .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: no quantitative evidence for narrowing of large cerebral arteries or qualitative angiographic evidence for distal narrowing or vasculitis could be found in patients who underwent angiography after aneurysmal sah associated
Drugs: 
Sentence: with cocaine use .
Drugs: cocaine

Drugs: carboplatin
Sentence: background :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the most striking of carboplatin 's advantages ( cbdca ) over cisplatin ( cddp ) is its markedly reduced rate of neurotoxic effects .
Drugs: carboplatin, cbdca, cisplatin, cddp
Sentence: however , the use of cbdca higher - intensity schedules and the association with other neurotoxic drugs in polychemotherapy may cause some concern about its safety with respect to peripheral
Drugs: cbdca
Sentence: nervous system damage .
Drugs: 
Sentence: materials and methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: two different schedules of cbdca administration ( 10 mg / kg and 15 mg / kg i . p .
Drugs: cbdca
Sentence: twice a week for nine times ) were evaluated in wistar rats .
Drugs: 
Sentence: neurotoxicity was assessed for behavioral ( tail - flick test ) , neurophysiological ( nerve conduction velocity in the tail nerve ) , morphological , morphometrical and analytical effects .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: cbdca administration induced dose - dependent peripheral neurotoxicity .
Drugs: cbdca
Sentence: pain perception and nerve conduction velocity in the tail were significantly impaired , particularly after the high - dose treatment .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the dorsal root ganglia sensory neurons and , to a lesser extent , satellite cells showed the same changes as those induced by cddp , mainly affecting the nucleus and
Drugs: cddp
Sentence: nucleolus of ganglionic sensory neurons .
Drugs: 
Sentence: moreover , significant amounts of platinum were detected in the dorsal root ganglia and kidney after cbdca treatment .
Drugs: platinum, cbdca
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: cbdca is neurotoxic in our model , and the type of pathological changes it induces are so closely similar to those caused by cddp that it is probable that neurotoxicity
Drugs: cbdca, cddp
Sentence: is induced in the two drugs by the same mechanism .
Drugs: 
Sentence: this model can be used alone or in combination with other drugs to explore the effect of cbdca on the peripheral nervous system .
Drugs: cbdca
Sentence: iatrogenic risks of endometrial carcinoma after treatment for breast cancer in a large french case - control study .
Drugs: 
Sentence: f d ration nationale des centres de lutte contre le cancer ( fnclcc ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: since tamoxifen is widely used in breast cancer treatment and has been proposed for the prevention of breast cancer , its endometrial iatrogenic effects must be carefully examined .
Drugs: tamoxifen
Sentence: we have investigated the association between endometrial cancer and tamoxifen use or other treatments in women treated for breast cancer in a case - control study .
Drugs: tamoxifen
Sentence: cases of endometrial cancer diagnosed after breast cancer ( n = 135 ) and 467 controls matched for age , year of diagnosis of breast cancer and hospital and survival
Drugs: 
Sentence: time with an intact uterus were included .
Drugs: 
Sentence: women who had received tamoxifen were significantly more likely to have endometrial cancer diagnosed than those who had not ( crude relative risk = 4 . 9 , p =
Drugs: tamoxifen
Sentence: 0 . 0001 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: univariate and adjusted analyses showed that the risk increased with the length of treatment ( p = 0 . 0001 ) or the cumulative dose of tamoxifen received ( p
Drugs: tamoxifen
Sentence: = 0 . 0001 ) , irrespective of the daily dose .
Drugs: 
Sentence: women who had undergone pelvic radiotherapy also had a higher risk ( crude relative risk = 7 . 8 , p = 0 . 0001 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: after adjusting for confounding factors , the risk was higher for tamoxifen users ( p = 0 . 0012 ) , treatment for more than 3 years ( all p
Drugs: tamoxifen
Sentence: < 0 . 03 ) and pelvic radiotherapy ( p = 0 . 012 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: women who had endometrial cancer and had received tamoxifen had more advanced disease and poorer prognosis than those with endometrial cancer who had not received this treatment .
Drugs: tamoxifen
Sentence: our results suggest a causal role of tamoxifen in endometrial cancer , particularly when used as currently proposed for breast cancer prevention .
Drugs: tamoxifen
Sentence: pelvic radiotherapy may be an additional iatrogenic factor for women with breast cancer .
Drugs: 
Sentence: endometrial cancers diagnosed in women treated with tamoxifen have poorer prognosis .
Drugs: tamoxifen
Sentence: women who receive tamoxifen for breast cancer should be offered gynaecological surveillance during and after treatment .
Drugs: tamoxifen
Sentence: a long - term evaluation of the risk - benefit ratio of tamoxifen as a preventive treatment for breast cancer is clearly warranted .
Drugs: tamoxifen

Drugs: tamoxifen
Sentence: background : increased attention has been focused recently on the estrogenic effects of tamoxifen .
Drugs: tamoxifen
Sentence: review of the literature reveals an association between tamoxifen use and gynecologic tumors .
Drugs: tamoxifen

Drugs: 
Sentence: a 52 - year - old postmenopausal woman was treated with tamoxifen for stage ii estrogen receptor - positive breast carcinoma .

Sentence: her aspartate transaminase and alanine transaminase levels increase markedly after 6 months of tamoxifen use .
Drugs: aspartate, alanine, tamoxifen
Sentence: after an additional 17 months of elevated serum transaminases , the patient was found to have a stage ic granulosa cell tumor of the ovary .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: patients with tamoxifen - induced liver dysfunction may be at increased risk for granulosa cell tumors because of alterations in tamoxifen metabolism .
Drugs: tamoxifen, tamoxifen

Sentence: the drug was given to two groups consisting of castrated and noncastrated rats and compared to two groups of castrated and noncastrated controls .

Drugs: 
Sentence: marmara university school of medicine , department of histology and embryology , zeynep kamil women and children 's hospital .

Sentence: serum prolactin levels , uterine histopathology .

Drugs:

Drugs: steroids
Sentence: this invasion eventually progresses to adenomyosis .

Drugs: adriamycin
Sentence: 550 mg / m2 ) in man .
Drugs: 
Sentence: histologically , the myocardial lesions resembled those found in human anthracycline - induced cardiomyopathy .
Drugs: anthracycline
Sentence: 1 of the 10 monkeys developed acute myeloblastic leukemia after receiving 324 mg / m2 of adriamycin ; the 10th monkey is alive and well 26 months after the last
Drugs: adriamycin
Sentence: dose of drug .
Drugs: 
Sentence: our results suggest that adriamycin is a more potent cardiotoxin in monkeys than in man , and that leukemia may be a consequence of prolonged treatment with this drug .

Drugs: mitomycinc, c
Sentence: mitomycin c associated hemolytic uremic syndrome ( hus ) is a potentially fatal but uncommon condition that is not yet widely recognised .
Drugs: mitomycinc, c
Sentence: it consists of microangiopathic hemolytic anemia , thrombocytopenia and progressive renal failure associated with mitomycin c treatment and affects about 10 % of patients treated with this agent .
Drugs: mitomycinc, c
Sentence: the renal failure usually develops about 8 - 10 mth after start of mitomycin c treatment and the mortality is approximately 60 % from renal failure or pulmonary edema .
Drugs: mitomycinc, c
Sentence: renal lesions are similar to those seen in idiopathic hus and include arteriolar fibrin thrombi , expanded subendothelial zones in glomerular capillary walls , ischemic wrinkling of glomerular basement membranes
Drugs: 
Sentence: and mesangiolysis .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the mechanism of action is postulated as mitomycin c - induced endothelial cell damage .
Drugs: mitomycinc, c
Sentence: we describe the clinical course and pathological findings in a 65 yr - old man with gastric adenocarcinoma who developed renal failure and thrombocytopenia while on treatment with
Drugs: 
Sentence: mitomycin c and died in pulmonary edema .
Drugs: mitomycinc, c

Drugs: 
Sentence: absorptiometry .

Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: hyperprolactinemia was present in 49 % of 83 boys ( n = 41 ) treated with risperidone for a mean of 2 . 9 years .

Sentence: < . 03 ) .

Drugs: serotonin
Sentence: . 03 ) and bmd z score at the lumbar spine ( p < . 05 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: these findings became more marked when the analysis was restricted to non - hispanic white patients .
Drugs:

Drugs: risperidone
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: this is the first study to link risperidone - induced hyperprolactinemia and ssri treatment to lower bmd in children and adolescents .
Drugs: risperidone

Drugs: levofloxacin
Sentence: the search was limited to studies published in english .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: six cases of levofloxacin - induced seizures have been reported in the literature .
Drugs: levofloxacin

Drugs:

Sentence: hepatotoxicity associated with sulfasalazine in inflammatory arthritis :
Drugs: sulfasalazine
Sentence: a case series from a local surveillance of serious adverse events .
Drugs: 
Sentence: background :
Drugs: 
Sentence: spontaneous reporting systems for adverse drug reactions ( adrs ) are handicapped by under - reporting and limited detail on individual cases .
Drugs: 
Sentence: we report an investigation from a local surveillance for serious adverse drug reactions associated with disease modifying anti - rheumatic drugs that was triggered by the occurrence of liver failure
Drugs: 
Sentence: in two of our patients .
Drugs: 
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: serious adr reports have been solicited from local clinicians by regular postcards over the past seven years .
Drugs: 
Sentence: patients ' , who had hepatotoxicity on sulfasalazine and met a definition of a serious adr , were identified .
Drugs: sulfasalazine
Sentence: two clinicians reviewed structured case reports and assessed causality by consensus and by using a causality assessment instrument .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the likely frequency of hepatotoxicity with sulfasalazine was estimated by making a series of conservative assumptions .
Drugs: sulfasalazine
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: ten cases were identified : eight occurred during surveillance .
Drugs: 
Sentence: eight patients were hospitalised , two in hepatic failure - one died after a liver transplant .
Drugs: 
Sentence: all but one event occurred within 6 weeks of treatment .
Drugs: 
Sentence: seven patients had a skin rash , three eosinophilia and one interstitial nephritis .
Drugs: 
Sentence: five patients were of black british of african or caribbean descent .
Drugs: 
Sentence: liver enzymes showed a hepatocellular pattern in four cases and a mixed pattern in six .
Drugs: 
Sentence: drug - related hepatotoxicity was judged probable or highly probable in 8 patients .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the likely frequency of serious hepatotoxicity with sulfasalazine was estimated at 0 . 4 % of treated patients .
Drugs: sulfasalazine
Sentence: conclusion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: serious hepatotoxicity associated with sulfasalazine appears to be under - appreciated and intensive monitoring and vigilance in the first 6 weeks of treatment is especially important .
Drugs: sulfasalazine

Drugs: vitaminc, c

Drugs: vitaminc, c
Sentence: objective : the objective was to examine the relation between vitamin c intake and mortality from cardiovascular disease .
Drugs: vitaminc, c
Sentence: design :

Drugs: vitaminc, c

Drugs:

Drugs: 
Sentence: 57 ( p for trend < 0 . 01 ) .

Sentence: when dietary and supplemental vitamin c were analyzed separately , only supplemental vitamin c showed a positive association with mortality endpoints .

Drugs: vitaminc, c
Sentence: conclusion :

Sentence: , were searched for evidence of vte .

Drugs: 
Sentence: background :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the use of iodinated contrast medium can result in nephropathy .
Drugs: 
Sentence: whether iso - osmolar contrast medium is less nephrotoxic than low - osmolar contrast medium in high - risk patients is uncertain .
Drugs: 
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: we conducted a randomized , double - blind , prospective , multicenter study comparing the nephrotoxic effects of an iso - osmolar , dimeric , nonionic contrast medium ,
Drugs: 
Sentence: iodixanol , with those of a low - osmolar , nonionic , monomeric contrast medium , iohexol .
Drugs: iodixanol, iohexol
Sentence: the study involved 129 patients with diabetes with serum creatinine concentrations of 1 . 5 to 3 . 5 mg per deciliter who underwent coronary or aortofemoral angiography .
Drugs: creatinine
Sentence: the primary end point was the peak increase from base line in the creatinine concentration during the three days after angiography .
Drugs: creatinine
Sentence: other end points were an increase in the creatinine concentration of 0 . 5 mg per deciliter or more , an increase of 1 . 0 mg per deciliter or
Drugs: creatinine
Sentence: more , and a change in the creatinine concentration from day 0 to day 7 .
Drugs: creatinine
Sentence: results :

Drugs: creatinine, iodixanol
Sentence: deciliter in the iohexol group ( p = 0 . 001 ; the increase with iodixanol minus the increase with iohexol , - 0 . 42 mg per deciliter [

Sentence: 95 percent confidence interval , - 0 . 73 to - 0 . 22 ] ) .

Drugs: iohexol
Sentence: the iodixanol group , 0 . 09
Drugs: iodixanol
Sentence: [ 95 percent confidence interval , 0 . 02 to 0 . 41 ] ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: no patient receiving iodixanol had an increase of 1 . 0 mg per deciliter or more , but 10 patients in the iohexol group ( 15 percent ) did .

Drugs: creatinine, iodixanol

Sentence: background :
Drugs: 
Sentence: hallucinations as a symptom of central neurotoxicity are a known but poorly described side effect of ifosfamide .
Drugs: ifosfamide
Sentence: most cases of ifosfamide - induced hallucinations have been reported with other mental status changes .
Drugs: ifosfamide
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the authors interviewed six persons with ifosfamide - induced hallucinations in the presence of a clear sensorium .
Drugs: ifosfamide

Drugs: ifosfamide
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: hallucinations occurred only when the patient 's eyes were closed and , in all but one case , were reported as disturbing or frightening .
Drugs: 
Sentence: underreporting of these hallucinations by patients is likely .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: hallucinations may be the sole or first manifestation of neurotoxicity .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the incidence may be dose and infusion - time related .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the clinician should be alerted for possible ifosfamide - induced hallucinations , which may occur without other signs of neurotoxicity .

Drugs: baclofen

Sentence: ccnu ( lomustine ) toxicity in dogs : a retrospective study ( 2002 - 07 ) .
Drugs: ccnu, lomustine
Sentence: objective :
Drugs: 
Sentence: to describe the incidence of haematological , renal , hepatic and gastrointestinal toxicities in tumour - bearing dogs receiving
Drugs: 
Sentence: 1 - ( 2 - chloroethyl ) - 3 - cyclohexyl - 1 - nitrosourea ( ccnu ) .
Drugs: 1-(2-chloroethyl)-3-cyclohexyl-1-nitrosourea, nitrosourea, ccnu
Sentence: design :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the medical records of 206 dogs that were treated with ccnu at the melbourne veterinary specialist centre between february 2002 and december 2007 were retrospectively evaluated .
Drugs: ccnu
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: of the 206 dogs treated with ccnu , 185 met the inclusion criteria for at least one class of toxicity .
Drugs: ccnu
Sentence: ccnu was used most commonly in the treatment of lymphoma , mast cell tumour , brain tumour , histiocytic tumours and epitheliotropic lymphoma .
Drugs: ccnu
Sentence: throughout treatment , 56 . 9 % of dogs experienced neutropenia , 34 . 2 % experienced anaemia and 14 . 2 % experienced thrombocytopenia .
Drugs: 
Sentence: gastrointestinal toxicosis was detected in 37 . 8 % of dogs , the most common sign of which was vomiting ( 24 . 3 % ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: potential renal toxicity and elevated alanine transaminase ( alt ) concentration were reported in 12 . 2 % and 48 . 8 % of dogs , respectively .
Drugs: alanine
Sentence: the incidence of hepatic failure was 1 . 2 % .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: ccnu - associated toxicity in dogs is common , but is usually not life threatening .
Drugs: ccnu

Sentence: use of dexamethasone with mesna for the prevention of ifosfamide - induced hemorrhagic cystitis .
Drugs: dexamethasone, mesna, ifosfamide
Sentence: aim : hemorrhagic cystitis ( hc ) is a limiting side - effect of chemotherapy with ifosfamide ( ifs ) .
Drugs: ifosfamide, ifs
Sentence: in the study presented here , we investigated the use of dexamethasone in combination with mesna for the prevention of ifs - induced hc .
Drugs: dexamethasone, mesna, ifs
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: male wistar rats ( 150 - 200 g ; 6 rats per group ) were treated with saline or mesna 5 min ( i . p . )
Drugs: mesna
Sentence: before and 2 and 6 h after ( v . o . ) administration of ifs .
Drugs: ifs
Sentence: one , two or three doses of mesna were replaced with dexamethasone alone or with dexamethasone plus mesna .
Drugs: mesna, dexamethasone, dexamethasone, mesna
Sentence: cystitis was evaluated 24 h after its induction by the changes in bladder wet weight and by macroscopic and microscopic analysis .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the replacement of the last dose or the last two doses of mesna with dexamethasone reduced the increase in bladder wet weight induced by ifs by 84 . 79 %
Drugs: mesna, dexamethasone, ifs
Sentence: and 89 . 13 % , respectively .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in addition , it almost abolished the macroscopic and microscopic alterations induced by ifs .
Drugs: ifs
Sentence: moreover , the addition of dexamethasone to the last two doses of mesna was more efficient than three doses of mesna alone when evaluated microscopically .
Drugs: dexamethasone, mesna, mesna
Sentence: conclusion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: dexamethasone in combination with mesna was efficient in blocking ifs - induced hc .
Drugs: dexamethasone, mesna, ifs
Sentence: however , the replacement of last two doses of mesna with saline or all of the mesna doses with dexamethasone did not prevent hc .
Drugs: mesna, mesna, dexamethasone

Drugs: antipurineacid, acid
Sentence: lometrexol is an antifolate which inhibits glycinamide ribonucleotide formyltransferase ( garft ) , an enzyme essential for de novo purine synthesis .
Drugs: lometrexolribonucleotide, ribonucleotide, purine
Sentence: extensive experimental and limited clinical data have shown that lometrexol has activity against tumours which are refractory to other drugs , notably methotrexate .
Drugs: lometrexol, methotrexate
Sentence: however , the initial clinical development of lometrexol was curtailed because of severe and cumulative antiproliferative toxicities .
Drugs: lometrexol
Sentence: preclinical murine studies demonstrated that the toxicity of lometrexol can be prevented by low dose folic acid administration , i . e . for 7 days prior to and 7
Drugs: lometrexolacid, acid
Sentence: days following a single bolus dose .
Drugs: 
Sentence: this observation prompted a phase i clinical study of lometrexol given with folic acid supplementation which has confirmed that the toxicity of lometrexol can be markedly reduced by
Drugs: lometrexolacid, acid, lometrexol
Sentence: folic acid supplementation .
Drugs: folicacid, acid
Sentence: thrombocytopenia and mucositis were the major toxicities .
Drugs: 
Sentence: there was no clear relationship between clinical toxicity and the extent of plasma folate elevation .
Drugs: folate
Sentence: associated studies demonstrated that lometrexol plasma pharmacokinetics were not altered by folic acid administration indicating that supplementation is unlikely to reduce toxicity by enhancing lometrexol plasma clearance .
Drugs: lometrexolacid, acid, lometrexol

Drugs: 
Sentence: this information will facilitate the future evaluation of this class of compounds in cancer therapy .

Sentence: conclusion :

Drugs: no, adr
Sentence: the attenuating effect of carteolol hydrochloride , a beta - adrenoceptor antagonist , on neuroleptic - induced catalepsy in rats .
Drugs: carteololhydrochloride, hydrochloride
Sentence: it is known that beta - adrenoceptor antagonists are effective in the treatment of akathisia , one of the extrapyramidal side effects that occur during neuroleptic treatment .
Drugs: 
Sentence: neuroleptic - induced catalepsy , a model of neuroleptic - induced extrapyramidal side effects , was considered suitable as a model for predicting neuroleptic - induced akathisia in humans ,
Drugs: 
Sentence: although neuroleptic - induced catalepsy was not considered a specific test for neuroleptic - induced akathisia .
Drugs: 
Sentence: therefore , the effects of carteolol , a beta - adrenoceptor antagonist , on haloperidol - induced catalepsy in rats were behaviorally studied and compared with those of propranolol and
Drugs: carteolol, haloperidol, propranolol
Sentence: biperiden , a muscarinic receptor antagonist .
Drugs: biperiden
Sentence: carteolol , as well as propranolol and biperiden , inhibited the haloperidol - induced catalepsy .
Drugs: carteolol, propranolol, biperiden, haloperidol
Sentence: the inhibitory effect of carteolol was almost comparable to that of propranolol , but was weaker than that of biperiden .
Drugs: carteolol, propranolol, biperiden
Sentence: carteolol did not evoke postsynaptic dopamine receptor - stimulating behavioral signs such as stereotypy and hyperlocomotion in rats .
Drugs: carteolol, dopamine
Sentence: carteolol did not antagonize the inhibitory effects of haloperidol on apomorphine - induced stereotypy and locomotor activity in rats .
Drugs: carteolol, haloperidol, apomorphine
Sentence: in addition , carteolol did not evoke 5 - ht1a receptor - stimulating behavioral signs such as flat body posture and forepaw treading and did not inhibit
Drugs: carteolol
Sentence: 5 - hydroxytryptophan - induced head twitch in rats .
Drugs: 5-hydroxytryptophan, hydroxytryptophan
Sentence: finally , carteolol did not inhibit physostigmine - induced lethality in rats .
Drugs: carteolol, physostigmine
Sentence: these results strongly suggest that carteolol improves haloperidol - induced catalepsy via its beta - adrenoceptor antagonistic activity and is expected to be effective in the treatment of akathisia without
Drugs: carteolol, haloperidol
Sentence: attenuating neuroleptic - induced antipsychotic effects due to its postsynaptic dopamine receptor antagonistic activity .
Drugs: dopamine

Sentence: d - penicillamine in the treatment of localized scleroderma .
Drugs: d-penicillamine, penicillamine
Sentence: localized scleroderma has no recognized internal organ involvement but may be disfiguring and disabling when the cutaneous lesions are extensive or affect children .
Drugs: 
Sentence: there is no accepted or proven treatment for localized scleroderma .
Drugs:

Drugs: d-penicillamine, penicillamine
Sentence: this drug was judged to have a favorable effect on the disease course in 7 ( 64 % ) of 11 patients .
Drugs: 
Sentence: improvement began within 3 to 6 months and consisted of cessation of active cutaneous lesions in all 7 patients , skin softening in 5 , and more normal growth of
Drugs: 
Sentence: the affected limb in 2 of 3 children .
Drugs: 
Sentence: joint stiffness and contractures also improved .
Drugs:

Drugs: d-penicillamine, penicillamine
Sentence: to 53 months .
Drugs: 
Sentence: d - penicillamine caused nephrotic syndrome in 1 patient and milder reversible proteinuria in 3 other patients ; none developed renal insufficiency .
Drugs: d-penicillamine, penicillamine
Sentence: these data suggest that d - penicillamine may be effective in severe cases of localized scleroderma .
Drugs: d-penicillamine, penicillamine

Sentence: rate .

Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: forty - three caucasian patients with primary open - angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension with a mean ( + / - sd ) age of 63 ( + / -
Drugs: 
Sentence: 8 ) years were randomized and crossed over in a double - masked manner to 14 days of treatment with placebo ( morning and evening in both eyes ) ,
Drugs: 
Sentence: timolol solution ( morning and evening in both eyes ) , or timolol gellan ( morning in both eyes with placebo in the evening ) .

Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: both timolol solution and timolol gellan reduced the mean 24 - hour heart rate compared with placebo ( p < or = . 001 ) , and this reduction was

Drugs: timolol, timolol
Sentence: gellan treatments was statistically significant ( p = . 01 ) .

Sentence: conclusions :

Drugs: timolol, timolol
Sentence: this response was most pronounced during the active daytime period .

Sentence: although exercise performance was not assessed in this trial , reductions of this magnitude should not have substantial clinical consequences .

Sentence: the apical ballooning syndrome ( abs ) is a recently described stress - mediated acute cardiac syndrome characterized by transient wall - motion abnormalities involving the apex and midventricle with
Drugs: 
Sentence: hyperkinesis of the basal left ventricular ( lv ) segments without obstructive epicardial coronary disease .
Drugs: 
Sentence: cardiotoxicity is not an uncommon adverse effect of chemotherapeutic agents .
Drugs: 
Sentence: however , there are no reports of abs secondary to chemotherapeutic agents .
Drugs: 
Sentence: we describe the case of a woman who developed the syndrome after chemotherapy for metastatic cancer .
Drugs:

Drugs: 
Sentence: she underwent recent chemotherapy with fluorouracil for metastatic colorectal cancer .
Drugs: fluorouracil
Sentence: echocardiography revealed a wall - motion abnormality involving the apical and periapical segments which appeared akinetic .
Drugs: 
Sentence: coronary angiography revealed no obstructive coronary lesions .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the patient was stabilized with medical therapy .
Drugs: 
Sentence: four weeks later she remained completely asymptomatic .
Drugs: 
Sentence: echocardiogram revealed a normal ejection fraction and a resolution of the apical akinesis .

Drugs: methadone, heroin
Sentence: background :
Drugs: 
Sentence: methadone is prescribed to heroin addicts to decrease illicit opioid use .
Drugs: methadone, heroin
Sentence: prolongation of the qt interval in the ecg of patients with torsade de pointes ( tdp ) has been reported in methadone users .
Drugs: methadone
Sentence: as heroin addicts sometimes faint while using illicit drugs , doctors might attribute too many episodes of syncope to illicit drug use and thereby underestimate the incidence of tdp in
Drugs: heroin
Sentence: this special population , and the high mortality in this population may , in part , be caused by the proarrhythmic effect of methadone .
Drugs: methadone
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: in this cross - sectional study interview , ecgs and blood samples were collected in a population of adult heroin addicts treated with methadone or buprenorphine on a daily basis
Drugs: heroin, methadone, buprenorphine
Sentence: .
Drugs: 
Sentence: of the patients at the drug addiction service in the municipal of copenhagen , 450 ( approximately 52 % ) were included .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the qt interval was estimated from 12 lead ecgs .
Drugs: 
Sentence: all participants were interviewed about any experience of syncope .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the association between opioid dose and qt , and methadone dose and reporting of syncope was assessed using multivariate linear regression and logistic regression , respectively .
Drugs: methadone
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: methadone dose was associated with longer qt interval of 0 . 140 ms / mg ( p = 0 . 002 ) .
Drugs: methadone
Sentence: no association between buprenorphine and qtc was found .
Drugs: buprenorphine
Sentence: among the subjects treated with methadone , 28 % men and 32 % women had prolonged qtc interval .
Drugs: methadone
Sentence: none of the subjects treated with buprenorphine had qtc interval > 0 . 440 s ( ( 1 / 2 ) ) .
Drugs: buprenorphine
Sentence: a 50 mg higher methadone dose was associated with a 1 . 2 ( 95 % ci 1 . 1 to 1 . 4 ) times higher odds for syncope
Drugs: methadone
Sentence: .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: methadone is associated with qt prolongation and higher reporting of syncope in a population of heroin addicts .
Drugs: methadone, heroin

Sentence: sirolimus and mycophenolate mofetil for calcineurin - free immunosuppression in renal transplant recipients .
Drugs: sirolimusmofetil, mofetil
Sentence: calcineurin inhibitors , such as cyclosporine and tacrolimus , have been available for almost 20 years .
Drugs: cyclosporine, tacrolimus
Sentence: although these drugs are highly effective and represent the mainstay of transplant immunosuppression , they are associated with acute and chronic nephrotoxicity .
Drugs: 
Sentence: acute nephrotoxicity , which occurs in the early period after transplantation , leads to a higher rate of dialysis , and chronic nephrotoxicity may eventually result in graft loss .
Drugs: 
Sentence: acute and chronic nephrotoxicity is becoming more common as the use of marginal kidneys for transplantation increases .
Drugs: 
Sentence: two recently available immunosuppressive agents , mycophenolate mofetil and sirolimus ( rapamycin ) , have no nephrotoxicity .
Drugs: mycophenolatemofetil, mofetil, sirolimus, rapamycin
Sentence: the use of these drugs in combination with other agents has led to the development of new paradigms of immunosuppressive therapy .
Drugs: 
Sentence: this paper reviews the results of clinical trials that have investigated these new approaches to immunosuppression in renal transplant recipients .

Sentence: dopamine is not essential for the development of methamphetamine - induced neurotoxicity .
Drugs: dopamine, methamphetamine
Sentence: it is widely believed that dopamine ( da ) mediates methamphetamine ( meth ) - induced toxicity to brain dopaminergic neurons , because drugs that interfere with da neurotransmission decrease
Drugs: dopamine, da, methamphetamine, meth, da
Sentence: toxicity , whereas drugs that increase da neurotransmission enhance toxicity .
Drugs: da
Sentence: however , temperature effects of drugs that have been used to manipulate brain da neurotransmission confound interpretation of the data .
Drugs: da
Sentence: here we show that the recently reported ability of l - dihydroxyphenylalanine to reverse the protective effect of alpha - methyl - para - tyrosine on meth - induced
Drugs: l-dihydroxyphenylalanine-methyl-para-tyrosine, tyrosine, meth
Sentence: da neurotoxicity is also confounded by drug effects on body temperature .
Drugs: da

Sentence: the protective role of nrf2 in streptozotocin - induced diabetic nephropathy .
Drugs: streptozotocin
Sentence: objective : diabetic nephropathy is one of the major causes of renal failure , which is accompanied by the production of reactive oxygen species ( ros ) .
Drugs: oxygen
Sentence: nrf2 is the primary transcription factor that controls the antioxidant response essential for maintaining cellular redox homeostasis .
Drugs: 
Sentence: here , we report our findings demonstrating a protective role of nrf2 against diabetic nephropathy .
Drugs: 
Sentence: research design and methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: we explore the protective role of nrf2 against diabetic nephropathy using human kidney biopsy tissues from diabetic nephropathy patients , a streptozotocin - induced diabetic nephropathy model in nrf2 (
Drugs: streptozotocin
Sentence: - / - ) mice , and cultured human mesangial cells .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the glomeruli of human diabetic nephropathy patients were under oxidative stress and had elevated nrf2 levels .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in the animal study , nrf2 was demonstrated to be crucial in ameliorating streptozotocin - induced renal damage .
Drugs: streptozotocin
Sentence: this is evident by nrf2 ( - / - ) mice having higher ros production and suffering from greater oxidative dna damage and renal injury compared with nrf2 ( +
Drugs: 
Sentence: / + ) mice .
Drugs: 
Sentence: mechanistic studies in both in vivo and in vitro systems showed that the nrf2 - mediated protection against diabetic nephropathy is , at least , partially through inhibition of transforming
Drugs: 
Sentence: growth factor - beta1 ( tgf - beta1 ) and reduction of extracellular matrix production .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in human renal mesangial cells , high glucose induced ros production and activated expression of nrf2 and its downstream genes .
Drugs: glucose
Sentence: furthermore , activation or overexpression of nrf2 inhibited the promoter activity of tgf - beta1 in a dose - dependent manner , whereas knockdown of nrf2 by sirna enhanced tgf
Drugs: 
Sentence: - beta1 transcription and fibronectin production .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: this work clearly indicates a protective role of nrf2 in diabetic nephropathy , suggesting that dietary or therapeutic activation of nrf2 could be used as a strategy to prevent or
Drugs: 
Sentence: slow down the progression of diabetic nephropathy .

Drugs: txa
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: an in - depth chart review was undertaken in all 24 patients who developed perioperative seizures .
Drugs: 
Sentence: electroencephalographic activity was recorded in 11 of these patients , and all patients had a formal neurological evaluation and brain imaging studies .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: twenty - one of the 24 patients did not have evidence of new cerebral ischemic injury , but seizures were likely due to ischemic brain injury in 3 patients .
Drugs: 
Sentence: all patients with seizures did not have permanent neurological abnormalities .
Drugs: 
Sentence: all 24 patients with seizures received high doses of txa intraoperatively ranging from 61 to 259 mg / kg , had a mean age of 69 . 9 years ,
Drugs: txa
Sentence: and 21 of 24 had undergone open chamber rather than coronary bypass procedures .
Drugs: 
Sentence: all but one patient were managed using cardiopulmonary bypass .
Drugs: 
Sentence: no evidence of brain ischemic , metabolic , or hyperthermia - induced causes for their seizures was apparent .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: our results suggest that use of high - dose txa in older patients in conjunction with cardiopulmonary bypass and open - chamber cardiac surgery is associated with clinical seizures in
Drugs: txa
Sentence: susceptible patients .

Drugs: dexamethasone
Sentence: purpose :
Drugs: 
Sentence: glucocorticoid administration can lead to the development of ocular hypertension and corticosteroid glaucoma in a subset of the population through a decrease in the aqueous humor outflow facility .
Drugs:

Drugs: 
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the anterior segments of human donor eyes from regional eye banks were placed in a constant flow , variable pressure perfusion culture system .
Drugs: 
Sentence: paired eyes were perfused in serum - free media with or without 10 ( - 7 )
Drugs: 
Sentence: m dexamethasone for 12 days .
Drugs: dexamethasone
Sentence: intraocular pressure was monitored daily .
Drugs: 
Sentence: after incubation , the eyes were morphologically characterized by light microscopy , transmission and scanning electron microscopy , and scanning laser confocal microscopy .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: a significant increase in intraocular pressure developed in 13 of the 44 pairs of eyes perfused with dexamethasone with an average pressure rise of 17 . 5 + / -
Drugs: dexamethasone
Sentence: 3 . 8 mm hg after 12 days of dexamethasone exposure .
Drugs: dexamethasone
Sentence: the contralateral control eyes , which did not receive dexamethasone , maintained a stable intraocular pressure during the same period .
Drugs: dexamethasone
Sentence: the outflow pathway of the untreated eyes appeared morphologically normal .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in contrast , the dexamethasone - treated hypertensive eyes had thickened trabecular beams , decreased intertrabecular spaces , thickened juxtacanalicular tissue , activated trabecular meshwork cells , and increased amounts
Drugs: dexamethasone
Sentence: of amorphogranular extracellular material , especially in the juxtacanalicular tissue and beneath the endothelial lining of the canal of schlemm .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the dexamethasone - treated nonresponder eyes appeared to be morphologically similar to the untreated eyes , although several subtle dexamethasone - induced morphologic changes were evident .
Drugs: dexamethasone, dexamethasone
Sentence: conclusion :
Drugs: 
Sentence: dexamethasone treatment of isolated , perfusion - cultured human eyes led to the generation of ocular hypertension in approximately 30 % of the dexamethasone - treated eyes .
Drugs: dexamethasone, dexamethasone

Drugs: steroid
Sentence: this system may provide an acute model in which to study the pathogenic mechanisms involved in steroid glaucoma and primary open angle glaucoma .

Sentence: hemolytic - uremic syndrome associated with ingestion of quinine .
Drugs: quinine
Sentence: hemolytic - uremic syndrome following quinine ingestion is a newly described phenomenon , with just two previous descriptions of 4 cases in the literature .
Drugs: quinine
Sentence: we describe a 5th case .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the reaction may be mediated by the presence of antibodies reactive against platelets in the presence of quinine .
Drugs: quinine

Drugs: 
Sentence: however , it is unclear whether pharmacological treatment or spontaneous resolution is responsible for the improvement .

Drugs: quinine
Sentence: it is important to recognize this reaction when it occurs and to avoid further quinine exposure , since the reaction seems to be recurrent .

Sentence: eight cancer patients in the terminal stages of the disease treated with high doses of intravenous morphine developed hyperalgesia .
Drugs: morphine

Sentence: drugs were ceased in six patients because of adverse reactions ; in three of these vancomycin was considered the likely cause .
Drugs: vancomycin

Drugs: aminoglycoside, vancomycin
Sentence: we conclude that vancomycin , administered appropriately , constitutes safe , effective therapy for infections caused by susceptible bacteria .
