Sentence: delayed - onset heparin - induced thrombocytopenia .
Drugs: heparin
Sentence: background :
Drugs: 
Sentence: heparin - induced thrombocytopenia presents 5 to 12 days after heparin exposure , with or without arterial or venous thromboemboli .
Drugs: heparin, heparin
Sentence: delayed recognition and treatment of heparin - induced thrombocytopenia contribute to poor patient outcomes .
Drugs: heparin
Sentence: objective :
Drugs: 
Sentence: to describe and increase awareness of a clinical scenario in which the onset or manifestations of heparin - induced thrombocytopenia are delayed .
Drugs: heparin
Sentence: design :
Drugs: 
Sentence: retrospective case series .
Drugs: 
Sentence: setting :
Drugs: 
Sentence: three large urban hospitals ( with active cardiovascular surgery programs ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: patients :
Drugs: 
Sentence: 14 patients seen over a 3 - year period in whom heparin - induced thrombocytopenia became apparent on delayed presentation with thromboembolic complications .
Drugs: heparin
Sentence: measurements :
Drugs: 
Sentence: platelet counts , onset of objectively determined thromboembolism , results of heparin - induced platelet factor 4 antibody tests , and outcomes .
Drugs: heparin
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: patients went home after hospitalizations that had included heparin exposure - - in most cases , with no thrombocytopenia recognized - - only to return to the hospital ( median
Drugs: heparin
Sentence: , day 14 ) with thromboembolic complications .
Drugs: 
Sentence: thromboemboli were venous ( 12 patients , 7 with pulmonary emboli ) or arterial ( 4 patients ) or both .
Drugs: 
Sentence: platelet counts were mildly decreased in all but 2 patients on second presentation .
Drugs: 
Sentence: on readmission , 11 patients received therapeutic heparin , which worsened the patients ' clinical condition and , in all 11 cases , decreased the platelet count ( mean at
Drugs: heparin
Sentence: readmission , 143 x 10 ( 9 ) cells / l ; mean nadir after heparin re - exposure , 39 x 10 ( 9 ) cells / l )
Drugs: heparin
Sentence: .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results of serologic tests for heparin - induced antibodies were positive in all patients .
Drugs: heparin
Sentence: subsequent treatments included alternative anticoagulants ( 11 patients ) , thrombolytic drugs ( 3 patients ) , inferior vena cava filters ( 3 patients ) and , eventually ,
Drugs: 
Sentence: warfarin ( 11 patients ) .
Drugs: warfarin
Sentence: three patients died .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: delayed - onset heparin - induced thrombocytopenia is increasingly being recognized .
Drugs: heparin
Sentence: to avoid disastrous outcomes , physicians must consider heparin - induced thrombocytopenia whenever a recently hospitalized patient returns with thromboembolism ; therapy with alternative anticoagulants , not heparin , should
Drugs: heparin, heparin
Sentence: be initiated .
Drugs: 
Sentence: valsartan , a new angiotensin ii antagonist for the treatment of essential hypertension : a comparative study of the efficacy and safety against amlodipine .
Drugs: valsartanii, ii, amlodipine
Sentence: objective :
Drugs: 
Sentence: to compare the antihypertensive efficacy of a new angiotensin ii antagonist , valsartan , with a reference therapy , amlodipine .
Drugs: angiotensinii, ii, valsartan, amlodipine
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: one hundred sixty - eight adult outpatients with mild to moderate hypertension were randomly allocated in double - blind fashion and equal number to receive 80 mg valsartan or 5
Drugs: valsartan
Sentence: mg amlodipine for 12 weeks .
Drugs: amlodipine
Sentence: after 8 weeks of therapy , in patients whose blood pressure remained uncontrolled , 5 mg amlodipine was added to the initial therapy .
Drugs: amlodipine
Sentence: patients were assessed at 4 , 8 , and 12 weeks .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the primary efficacy variable was change from baseline in mean sitting diastolic blood pressure at 8 weeks .
Drugs: 
Sentence: secondary variables included change in sitting systolic blood pressure and responder rates .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: both valsartan and amlodipine were effective at lowering blood pressure at 4 , 8 , and 12 weeks .
Drugs: valsartan, amlodipine
Sentence: similar decreases were observed in both groups , with no statistically significant differences between the groups for any variable analyzed .
Drugs: 
Sentence: for the primary variable the difference was 0 . 5 mm hg in favor of valsartan ( p = 0 . 68 ; 95 % confidence interval , - 2
Drugs: valsartan
Sentence: . 7 to 1 . 7 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: responder rates at 8 weeks were 66 . 7 % for valsartan and 60 . 2 % for amlodipine ( p = 0 . 39 ) .
Drugs: valsartan, amlodipine
Sentence: both treatments were well tolerated .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the incidence of drug - related dependent edema was somewhat higher in the amlodipine group , particularly at a dose of 10 mg per day ( 2 . 4 %
Drugs: amlodipine
Sentence: for 80 mg valsartan ; 3 . 6 % for 5 mg amlodipine ; 0 % for valsartan plus 5 mg amlodipine ; 14 . 3 % for 10 mg
Drugs: valsartan, amlodipine, valsartan, amlodipine
Sentence: amlodipine ) .
Drugs: amlodipine
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: the data show that valsartan is at least as effective as amlodipine in the treatment of mild to moderate hypertension .
Drugs: valsartan, amlodipine
Sentence: the results also show valsartan to be well tolerated and suggest that it is not associated with side effects characteristic of this comparator class , dihydropyridine calcium antagonists .
Drugs: valsartan, dihydropyridine, calcium

Drugs: amiodarone
Sentence: myxedema coma is a life threatening condition that carries a mortality reaching as high as 20 % with treatment .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the condition is treated with intravenous thyroxine ( t4 ) or intravenous tri - iodo - thyronine ( t3 ) .
Drugs: thyroxine-iodo-thyronine, thyronine, t3
Sentence: patients with chf on amiodarone may suffer serious morbidity and mortality from hypothyroidism , and thus may deserve closer follow up for thyroid stimulating hormone ( tsh ) levels .
Drugs: amiodarone
Sentence: this case report carries an important clinical application given the frequent usage of amiodarone among chf patients .
Drugs: amiodarone

Drugs: 
Sentence: other unexplained symptoms .
Drugs: 
Sentence: fear - potentiated startle , but not light - enhanced startle , is enhanced by anxiogenic drugs .
Drugs: 
Sentence: rationale and objectives : the light - enhanced startle paradigm ( les ) is suggested to model anxiety , because of the non - specific cue and the long -
Drugs: 
Sentence: term effect .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in contrast , the fear - potentiated startle ( fps ) is suggested to model conditioned fear .
Drugs: 
Sentence: however , the pharmacological profiles of these two paradigms are very similar .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the present study investigated the effects of putative anxiogenic drugs on les and fps and aimed at determining the sensitivity of les for anxiogenic drugs and to potentially showing a
Drugs: 
Sentence: pharmacological differentiation between these two paradigms .
Drugs: 
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: male wistar rats received each dose of the alpha ( 2 ) - adrenoceptor antagonist yohimbine ( 0 . 25 - 1 . 0mg / kg ) , the
Drugs: yohimbine
Sentence: 5 - ht ( 2c ) receptor agonist m - chlorophenylpiperazine ( mcpp , 0 . 5 - 2 . 0mg / kg ) or the gaba ( a )
Drugs: 5-ht-chlorophenylpiperazine, chlorophenylpiperazine, mcpp, gaba
Sentence: inverse receptor agonist pentylenetetrazole ( ptz , 3 - 30mg / kg ) and were subsequently tested in either les or fps .
Drugs: pentylenetetrazole, ptz
Sentence: results :
Drugs: 
Sentence: none of the drugs enhanced les , whereas mcpp increased percentage fps and yohimbine increased absolute fps values .
Drugs: mcpp, yohimbine
Sentence: furthermore , yohimbine increased baseline startle amplitude in the les , while mcpp suppressed baseline startle in both the les and fps and ptz suppressed baseline startle in the fps
Drugs: yohimbine, mcpp, ptz
Sentence: .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: in contrast to findings in the fps paradigm , none of the drugs were able to exacerbate the les response .
Drugs: 
Sentence: thus , a clear pharmacological differentiation was found between les and fps .
Drugs:

Sentence: ) 9 , 10 , or 11 ( kimmel ca , wilson jg , schumacher hj .
Drugs: 
Sentence: teratology 4 : 15 - 24 , 1971 ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: there are no published asa studies using the multiple dosing paradigm of gds 6 to 17 .
Drugs: asa
Sentence: objectives of the current study were to compare results between sprague - dawley ( sd ) and wistar strains when asa is administered on gd 9 , 10 , or
Drugs: asa
Sentence: 11 ; to compare the malformation patterns following single and multiple dosings during organogenesis in sd rats ; and to test the hypothesis that maternal gastrointestinal toxicity confounds the detection
Drugs: 
Sentence: of low incidence malformations with asa when a multiple dosing paradigm is used .
Drugs: asa
Sentence: methods :
Drugs: 
Sentence: asa was administered as a single dose on gd 9 ( 0 , 250 , 500 , or 625 mg / kg ) , 10 ( 0 , 500 ,
Drugs: asa
Sentence: 625 , or 750 mg / kg ) , or 11 ( 0 , 500 , 750 , or 1000 mg / kg ) and from gd 6 to gd
Drugs: 
Sentence: 17 ( 0 , 50 , 125 , or 250 mg / kg a day ) in the multiple dose study to sd rats .
Drugs: 
Sentence: animals were killed on gd 21 , and fetuses were examined viscerally .
Drugs: 
Sentence: results :
Drugs:

Drugs: 
Sentence: and vsds in rabbits ( cook jc et al . , 2003 ) ; hence , the present study focused on these malformations , even though asa induces several other
Drugs: asa
Sentence: low - incidence malformations .

Sentence: in single dose studies , dh , md , and vsd were induced on gds 9 and 10 .
Drugs: 
Sentence: vsd also was noted following treatment on gd 11 .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in contrast , dh and md were noted in the multiple dose study design only in the high - dose group , and vsd was noted across all dose groups
Drugs: 
Sentence: .
Drugs: 
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs:

Drugs: 
Sentence: variations and malformations were similar when asa was administered as a single dose or during the period of organogenesis ( gds 6 to 17 ) .
Drugs: asa
Sentence: it was also evident that , by titrating the dose to achieve a maximum tolerated dose , malformations that normally occur at low incidence , as reported from previous single
Drugs: 
Sentence: dose studies , could also be induced with asa given at multiple doses .
Drugs: asa

Sentence: apomorphine : an underutilized therapy for parkinson 's disease .
Drugs: apomorphine
Sentence: apomorphine was the first dopaminergic drug ever used to treat symptoms of parkinson 's disease .
Drugs: apomorphine
Sentence: while powerful antiparkinsonian effects had been observed as early as 1951 , the potential of treating fluctuating parkinson 's disease by subcutaneous administration of apomorphine has only recently become the
Drugs: apomorphine
Sentence: subject of systematic study .
Drugs: 
Sentence: a number of small scale clinical trials have unequivocally shown that intermittent subcutaneous apomorphine injections produce antiparkinsonian benefit close if not identical to that seen with levodopa and that
Drugs: apomorphine, levodopa
Sentence: apomorphine rescue injections can reliably revert off - periods even in patients with complex on - off motor swings .
Drugs: apomorphine
Sentence: continuous subcutaneous apomorphine infusions can reduce daily off - time by more than 50 % in this group of patients , which appears to be a stronger effect than that
Drugs: apomorphine
Sentence: generally seen with add - on therapy with oral dopamine agonists or comt inhibitors .
Drugs: dopamine
Sentence: extended follow - up studies of up to 8 years have demonstrated long - term persistence of apomorphine efficacy .
Drugs: apomorphine
Sentence: in addition , there is convincing clinical evidence that monotherapy with continuous subcutaneous apomorphine infusions is associated with marked reductions of preexisting levodopa - induced dyskinesias .
Drugs: apomorphine, levodopa
Sentence: the main side effects of subcutaneous apomorphine treatment are related to cutaneous tolerability problems , whereas sedation and psychiatric complications play a lesser role .
Drugs: apomorphine
Sentence: given the marked degree of efficacy of subcutaneous apomorphine treatment in fluctuating parkinson 's disease , this approach seems to deserve more widespread clinical use .
Drugs: apomorphine

Sentence: postoperative myalgia after succinylcholine : no evidence for an inflammatory origin .
Drugs: succinylcholine
Sentence: a common side effect associated with succinylcholine is postoperative myalgia .
Drugs: succinylcholine
Sentence: the pathogenesis of this myalgia is still unclear ; inflammation has been suggested but without convincing evidence .
Drugs: 
Sentence: we designed the present study to investigate whether an inflammatory reaction contributes to this myalgia .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the incidence and severity of succinylcholine - associated myalgia was determined in 64 patients pretreated with saline or dexamethasone before succinylcholine ( n = 32 for each ) .
Drugs: succinylcholine, dexamethasone, succinylcholine
Sentence: incidence and severity of myalgia did not differ significantly between the two groups : 15 patients in the dexamethasone group complained of myalgia compared with 18 patients in the saline
Drugs: dexamethasone
Sentence: group , and severe myalgia was reported by five patients and three patients , respectively ( not significant ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: at 48 h after surgery , 12 patients in both groups still suffered from myalgia ( not significant ) .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in addition , interleukin - 6 ( il - 6 ) as an early marker of inflammation was assessed in a subgroup of 10 patients pretreated with saline .
Drugs: 
Sentence: we found an increase of il - 6 for only three patients , but only one patient reported myalgia ; no relationship between myalgia and the increase of il -
Drugs: 
Sentence: 6 was found .
Drugs: 
Sentence: in conclusion , there is no evidence for an inflammatory origin of succinylcholine - associated myalgia .
Drugs: succinylcholine
Sentence: implications :
Drugs: 
Sentence: administration of dexamethasone before succinylcholine was not effective in decreasing the incidence or the severity of succinylcholine - induced postoperative myalgia .
Drugs: dexamethasone, succinylcholine, succinylcholine
Sentence: furthermore , there was no significant relationship between postoperative myalgia and time course of interleukin - 6 concentrations , a marker of inflammation .
Drugs: 
Sentence: pretreatment with dexamethasone is not justified to prevent postoperative myalgia after succinylcholine .
Drugs: dexamethasone, succinylcholine

Drugs: steroidsulphate, sulphate

Drugs: pregnenolonesulphate, sulphate, pregs
Sentence: the ageing process .
Drugs: 
Sentence: the mechanism by which this endogenous steroid enhances memory formation is hypothesized to involve actions on glutamatergic and gabaergic systems .
Drugs: steroid
Sentence: this hypothesis stems from findings that pregs is a potent positive modulator of n - methyl - d - aspartate receptors ( nmdars ) and a negative modulator of
Drugs: pregs-methyl-d-aspartate, aspartate
Sentence: gamma - aminobutyric acid ( a ) receptors ( gaba ( a ) rs ) .
Drugs: gamma-aminobutyricacid, acid, gaba
Sentence: moreover , pregs is able to reverse the amnesic - like effects of nmdar and gaba ( a ) r ligands .
Drugs: pregs, gaba
Sentence: to investigate this hypothesis , the present study in rats examined the memory - altering abilities of structural analogs of pregs , which differ in their modulation of nmdar and
Drugs: pregs
Sentence: / or gaba ( a ) r function .
Drugs: gaba
Sentence: the analogs tested were : 11 - ketopregnenolone sulphate ( an agent that is inactive at gaba ( a ) rs and nmdars ) ,
Drugs: 11-ketopregnenolonesulphate, sulphate, gaba
Sentence: epipregnanolone ( [ 3beta - hydroxy - 5beta - pregnan - 20 - one ] sulphate , an inhibitor of both gaba ( a ) rs and nmdars ) ,
Drugs: epipregnanolone([3beta-hydroxy-5beta-pregnan-20-one]sulphate, sulphate, gaba
Sentence: and a newly synthesized ( - ) pregs enantiomer ( which is identical to pregs in effects on gaba ( a ) rs and nmdars ) .
Drugs: pregs, pregs, gaba
Sentence: the memory - enhancing effects of pregs and its analogs were tested in the passive avoidance task using the model of scopolamine - induced amnesia .
Drugs: pregs, scopolamine
Sentence: both pregs and its ( - ) enantiomer blocked the effects of scopolamine .
Drugs: pregs, scopolamine

Drugs: pregs-ketopregnenolonesulphatesulphate, sulphate, scopolamine
Sentence: nmda receptors diminishes the memory - enhancing effects of pregs .
Drugs: nmda, pregs

Drugs: pregs, scopolamine

Drugs: oxytocin

Sentence: pallidal stimulation : an alternative to pallidotomy ?
Drugs: 
Sentence: a resurgence of interest in the surgical treatment of parkinson 's disease ( pd ) came with the rediscovery of posteroventral pallidotomy by laitinen in 1985 .
Drugs: 
Sentence: laitinen 's procedure improved most symptoms in drug - resistant pd , which engendered wide interest in the neurosurgical community .
Drugs: 
Sentence: another lesioning procedure , ventrolateral thalamotomy , has become a powerful alternative to stimulate the nucleus ventralis intermedius , producing high long - term success rates and low morbidity rates
Drugs: 
Sentence: .
Drugs: 
Sentence: pallidal stimulation has not met with the same success .
Drugs: 
Sentence: according to the literature pallidotomy improves the """" on """" symptoms of pd , such as dyskinesias , as well as the """" off """" symptoms , such as rigidity
Drugs: 
Sentence: , bradykinesia , and on - off fluctuations .
Drugs: 
Sentence: pallidal stimulation improves bradykinesia and rigidity to a minor extent ; however , its strength seems to be in improving levodopa - induced dyskinesias .
Drugs: levodopa
Sentence: stimulation often produces an improvement in the hyper - or dyskinetic upper limbs , but increases the """" freezing """" phenomenon in the lower limbs at the same time .
Drugs: 
Sentence: considering the small increase in the patient 's independence , the high costs of bilateral implants , and the difficulty most patients experience in handling the devices , the question
Drugs: 
Sentence: arises as to whether bilateral pallidal stimulation is a real alternative to pallidotomy .

Sentence: fluconazole - induced torsade de pointes .
Drugs: fluconazole
Sentence: objective :
Drugs: 
Sentence: to present a case of fluconazole - associated torsade de pointes ( tdp ) and discuss fluconazole 's role in causing tdp .
Drugs: fluconazole, fluconazole
Sentence: case summary :
Drugs: 
Sentence: a 68 - year - old white woman with candida glabrata isolated from a presacral abscess developed tdp eight days after commencing oral fluconazole
Drugs: fluconazole
Sentence: the patient had no other risk factors for tdp , including coronary artery disease , cardiomyopathy , congestive heart failure , and electrolyte abnormalities there was a temporal association between
Drugs: 
Sentence: the initiation of fluconazole and tdp .
Drugs: fluconazole
Sentence: the tdp resolved when fluconazole was discontinued ; however , the patient continued to have premature ventricular contractions and nonsustained ventricular tachycardia ( nsvt ) until six days after drug
Drugs: fluconazole
Sentence: cessation discussion
Drugs: 
Sentence: : use of the naranjo probability scale indicates a probable relationship between the use of fluconazole and the development of tdp .
Drugs: fluconazole
Sentence: the possible mechanism is depression of rapidly activating delayed rectifier potassium currents .
Drugs: potassium
Sentence: in our patient , there was no other etiology identified that could explain qt prolongation or tdp
Drugs: 
Sentence: the complete disappearance of nsvt and premature ventricular contractions followed by normalization of qt interval after the drug was stopped strongly suggests fluconazole as the etiology .
Drugs: fluconazole
Sentence: conclusions :
Drugs: 
Sentence: clinicians should be aware that fluconazole , even at low doses , may cause prolongation of the qt interval , leading to tdp .
Drugs: fluconazole
Sentence: serial electrocardiographic monitoring may be considered when fluconazole is administered in patients who are at risk for ventricular arrhythmias .
Drugs: fluconazole

Drugs: methylprednisolone
Sentence: because of the national acute spinal cord injury studies ( nascis ) , high - dose methylprednisolone became the standard of care for the acute spinal cord injury .
Drugs: methylprednisolone
Sentence: in the nascis , there was no mention regarding the possibility of acute corticosteroid myopathy that high - dose methylprednisolone may cause .
Drugs: corticosteroid, methylprednisolone
Sentence: the dosage of methylprednisolone recommended by the nascis 3 is the highest dose of steroids ever being used during a 2 - day period for any clinical condition .
Drugs: methylprednisolone, steroids
